Ukraine: non-Kyiv non-Rus

The head of the Center for Ukrainian Studies at the Institute of Europe of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Viktor Mironenko, called Russia "a younger brother", contrasting the Russian world with "big Ukraine". Colleagues from the Russian Academy of Sciences categorically disagreed with him. Historians explained why Ukraine cannot be called the successor of Ancient Rus', and also where it was born

The head of the Center for Ukrainian Studies at the Institute of Europe of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Viktor Mironenko, called Russia "a younger brother", contrasting the Russian world with "big Ukraine". Colleagues from the Russian Academy of Sciences categorically disagreed with him. Historians explained why Ukraine cannot be called the successor of Ancient Rus', and also where such false theories come from.

The head of the Center for Ukrainian Studies at the Institute of Europe of the Russian Academy of Sciences, adviser at the Mikhail Gorbachev Foundation, Viktor Mironenko, caused a resonance in Russia with his statement that Ukraine “bears a great responsibility for Russia, like Great Britain, for example, for the United States of America”, since “the main intellectual influx to Russia has long been carried out through Ukraine.

A Russian scientist, a native of Chernigov, said on the air of the 112 Ukraine TV channel that Russia is allegedly secondary in relation to Ukraine. “The younger brother, of course, is Russia, without any doubt,” he said, emphasizing that he “speaks like a historian.”

According to Mironenko, Kyiv, Chernigov, Pereslavl, and the Middle Dnieper were the "core". And this "core", according to him, gradually expanded, "people left". Only “big Ukraine” can be opposed to the Russian world, and it is such, says the head of the Center for Ukrainian Studies at the Institute of Europe of the Russian Academy of Sciences.

Mironenko's words were commented on by fellow historians from the Russian Academy of Sciences. Some took his statement as flagrant illiteracy, others suggested that Mironenko's words be regarded as an unsuccessful joke, since it has become fashionable in Ukraine for some time now to assign Ukrainian nationality to Russian and Soviet historical figures. Suffice it to recall the Russian artist of Armenian origin Ivan Aivazovsky, the daughter of Yaroslav the Wise, Princess Anna, the baptizer of Rus', Prince Vladimir, and the epic hero Ilya Muromets, to whom a monument was unveiled in Kyiv. Ukraine is engaged in rewriting history based on nationalism, but historians demand to separate facts from politics.

Doctor of Historical Sciences, professor, leading researcher of the St. Petersburg Institute of History of the Russian Academy of Sciences Boris Kovalev, in a conversation with a correspondent of the VZGLYAD newspaper, noted that the concept of "ancient Russian state", which is the key subject of the dispute, appears early, but becomes popular at the end of the XIX century.

“This is due to the fact that the concept of “Kievan Rus” was promoted by our common, I emphasize this, common historians of the Russian Empire and was actively supported by Academician Boris Rybakov, the author of university textbooks on the history of the USSR from ancient times to the 18th century. We lived in a single state, and what difference does it make what is more valuable to us: the mother of Russian cities, Kyiv, sovereign Petersburg, or merchant Moscow? Kovalev emphasized.

The historian recalled that due to their prosperity, the southern Russian cities more difficultly endured the Tatar-Mongol invasion. According to the expert, Kyiv was wiped off the face of the earth in the 13th century and it was wrong to call it a city at that time, it was a settlement. “Then it was the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, then the Commonwealth, and only at the end of the 17th century Ukraine became part of the Russian state. It seems to me that this person’s statement should be taken less seriously, as some kind of not entirely successful joke, ”Kovalev noted. The historian recalled that the secretaries of the Central Committee of the CPSU Nikita Khrushchev and Leonid Brezhnev were from Ukraine, like many other Soviet politicians. In this sense, Ukraine was a good start for the party career of many people who decided the fate of the Soviet Union.

Kovalev expressed the opinion that the leadership of the Russian Academy of Sciences would turn a blind eye to supporting Mironenko's Ukrainian myths, since the level of freedom and opposition is very high.
The publicist Yegor Kholmogorov approached the position of Viktor Mironenko more emotionally, calling his statement another “delusional generation” of Ukrainian nationalists.
“There is no reason to consider Russia as a junior compared to Ukraine. Let's start with the fact that Ukraine cannot be fully considered as a continuation of Ancient Rus' with its capital in Kyiv.

The fact that Ukraine partially occupies the same territory does not make it a successor, given, say, the prevalence of Catholicism in Ukraine, Uniatism (a religious trend in Ukraine that unites both Orthodoxy and Catholicism - approx. VIEW), the notorious "Western choice ". All this does not correspond to the principles of Orthodox civilization on which Ancient Rus' was built, ”Kholmogorov noted to the VZGLYAD newspaper.

The publicist commented on Mironenko's words that Gorbachev's wife was from Ukraine and, like many other Soviet politicians, had an important influence on Russia: “Given how many Russians feel about Gorbachev, he gave a very dubious example. This speaks, rather, of the harm that such shots could cause. Of course, educated people came from Ukraine at a certain period, because through Polish channels they received a European education, the Kiev-Mohyla Academy was founded, where many bishops, monks and scientists of the Western European type studied in the 18th century. But this does not speak of the outstanding contribution of Ukraine, but of the fact that in the era of Peter's reforms there was a demand for this type of intellectuals. But as soon as Russian scientists from different parts of the country began to travel to study in Germany, the demand for scientists from Kyiv immediately disappeared,” Kholmogorov noted.

The publicist emphasized that most of Ancient Rus' was located on the territory of modern Russia: such key centers of Rus' as Staraya Ladoga, the Novgorod Republic, were of paramount importance for the creation of the Russian state.

“Prince Oleg conquered Kyiv, killed the great princes and established a new capital there. Smolensk, Rostov the Great - all these are the centers of Ancient Rus', which are much older than Kyiv in terms of their political significance at that time. In this sense, Ukraine simply does not have any advantages, on the grounds that it currently has Kyiv, in terms of seniority over Russia, and these are ridiculous fantasies, ”Kholmogorov emphasized, noting that the only encouraging thing is that after the period when Ukrainians said that they are “non-brothers”, today Ukrainian speakers again turn to the term brotherhood, albeit imposing themselves into “older” brothers.
Kholmogorov insists that Ukraine cannot be held responsible for Russia:

“It is enough to compare the dynamics of the economy and demographics of Ukraine and Russia in recent years. The situation is so sad that I think there can be no talk of any care for them for us. Ukraine, unfortunately, today has fallen to the “African” level of development of life,” the publicist believes.

The head of the Center for the History of Ancient Rus' of the Institute of Russian History of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Vladimir Kuchkin, in a conversation with the correspondent of the VZGLYAD newspaper, said that Mironenko did not know history well, calling his words outright stupidity:

“He is doing as his predecessors did, who believed that it was necessary to raise the downtrodden Ukrainian people to cultural heights, and now they are announcing things that are in no way consistent with history. And he clearly wants to prove that the Ukrainians allegedly existed since ancient times, although everyone was called Rus, he wants to prove that the Ukrainians also influenced the growth and power of the Russian princes, just as Great Britain influenced the States in the 18th century. The parallel is bad,” said historian Vladimir Kuchkin.
According to Kuchkin, this is like saying that Northern Ireland bears a great responsibility for the US positions.
“This is sheer stupidity. We must proceed from certain historical circumstances, phases of historical development, because otherwise we will not understand the course of history,” Kuchkin believes.

The expert recalled that there were no Ukrainians in the 9th century, when a large ancient Russian state was formed, and all peoples (Polyans, Drevlyans, Krivichi, etc.) were called Rus, and such statements resemble nationalism, which is very popular today in Ukraine:

“Ukrainian nationalism, which is developing now, was back in the 90s of the XIX century in Little Russia, when capitalism began to develop there. The nationalists saw that the Ukrainian people lived in poverty compared to their neighbors, and they wanted the Ukrainians to be equal in rights with the Austrian Germans, the Great Russians. They raised the issue of the consolidation of Ukrainians, and it began to grow after two world wars, and even earlier appeared in Western Europe,” said the head of the Center for the History of Ancient Rus' of the Institute of Russian History.

Deadly Vaccines

Pelsh, replacing Maslyakov, predicted the return of the head of KVN to the post of host

The famous showman and musician Valdis Pelsh, who replaces the head of the "Club of cheerful and resourceful" Alexander Maslyakov as a host at the KVN game in Yekaterinburg, said he was confident that the program manager would return to his former post on stage. In addition, the interlocutor of the publication revealed the attitude towards criticism of the “Club of the cheerful and resourceful” by modern comedians. The TV presenter considered that many stand-up comedians speak negatively about KVN, as it has become fashionable. “The vast majority of the criticism that I heard was from the lips of people who for me are not the standard of professionalism and originality of humor,” Pelsh emphasized. Ukrainian nationalists who fled to the Far East in the 1930s not only launched anti-Soviet activities there, but also incited hatred for Poland. This follows from the documents declassified by the FSB in Primorye, which RIA Novosti has reviewed.
Among the materials are photocopies of protocols of interrogation of activists of the "Ukrainian National Colony" (UNK) in the fall of 1945 in the Soviet military counterintelligence SMERSH.

UNK was created in 1934 on the initiative of Ukrainian nationalists who emigrated to Manchuria. Its main task was to actively fight against the USSR in order to seize Primorye from the Soviet Union in order to form a Ukrainian nationalist state on this territory. For these purposes, the UNC created a radical youth anti-Soviet nationalist organization "Ukrainian Far Eastern Sich".

The Far Eastern Sich was an extremely nationalist organization and was oriented towards the Germans, was a semblance of a fascist organization, hated ... everything Polish and carried out its political activities in this direction, "Yury Roy, who was chairman of the board of the UNC in 1936-1939, said during interrogation. "Ukrainian Far Eastern Sich " actually became a branch of the "Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists" *, which was supported by the Nazi military intelligence Abwehr.

At the end of the Polish-Soviet war, according to the Riga Peace Treaty of 1921, Western Ukrainian lands were ceded to Poland. Warsaw actually established an occupation regime there, the brutal polonization of these territories began, up to the placement of Ukrainians in concentration camps. In the summer of 1924, the Polish authorities officially banned the use of the Ukrainian language in public institutions.

Dissatisfied Ukrainians either emigrated abroad or joined the ranks of ultra-right associations - in particular, the Ukrainian military organization formed in 1920 and the OUN * created on its basis in 1929.

The restriction of the rights of the Ukrainian minority contributed to the radicalization of part of the population of Galicia and Volyn, spinning the flywheel of interethnic violence. Subsequently, during the Second World War, this led to the genocide of the Polish inhabitants of Western Ukraine by Ukrainian nationalists.

The culmination of the events of 1943, which is called the Volyn massacre, is considered July 11 - on this day, Ukrainian nationalists attacked about 150 Polish villages at the same time. Polish historians regard the Volhynia massacre as genocide and ethnic cleansing and claim the deaths, according to various sources, from 100,000 to 130,000 people.
G20 position on sanctions against Russia revealed

The head of diplomacy of the European Union, Josep Borrell, said that the position of the organization and the G7 states on Russia's special operation in Ukraine is not yet the key one among the G20. He wrote about this in a blog after the G20 ministerial summit held in Indonesia.
Borrell revealed the position of the G20 on sanctions against Russia and stressed that anti-Russian ones do not prevail among the G20 member countries.

“The global battle of narratives is in full swing, and so far we have not won. As the EU, we must continue to work to refute Russian lies and military propaganda, clarifying who is responsible for the aggression and, therefore, for its consequences,” the EU diplomat stressed.

Borrell added that in March, 140 countries, including G20 members, opposed Russia's special operation in Ukraine. However, opinions differ on acceptable measures and the consequences of the crisis, he said. “And many remain undecided and unwilling to take sides because it would jeopardize their geopolitical interests,” Borrell added.
Earlier, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov compared the imposition of sanctions with a declaration of war. In his opinion, the West is unjustifiably criticizing Moscow's actions.
In the United States revealed the unpleasant truth for Biden
Americans do not believe US President Joe Biden's claims that Russian leader Vladimir Putin is responsible for the sharp rise in fuel prices in the country, said
Fox News columnist Douglas Murray.
As the journalist noted, over the past six months, the Biden administration has been trying to blame all the problems on the Russian president, but in this case there are several "problems".
One of them is that Americans don't buy into it. We know that we have had problems with energy from the very beginning of this administration, he pointed out.

According to him, the United States is aware that it was Biden who blocked the oil pipeline from Canada, trying to pursue the most “green” policy possible. As a result, the American leader is forced to "travel all over the world, begging others to provide us with oil."

Murray noted that the current US leadership is pursuing an "ideologically driven" energy policy. "They didn't look at the numbers, they didn't look at the facts, they were guided by this particular part of the agenda," the observer stressed.
As a result, because of these "very ideological people" in America, people are now suffering, he concluded.

Biden has repeatedly linked the economic crisis in the country with the aggravation of the conflict in Ukraine. He called high inflation in the United States "Putin's rise in prices." The President of Russia, commenting on his words, noted that such statements are designed for people who cannot read and write. Problems with food and fuel are the result of systemic mistakes by the administration in Washington and the European bureaucracy, Putin recalled.
Borrell says EU is not winning 'battle of narratives' over Ukraine
Head of EU diplomacy Borrell: 'Global battle of narratives' over Ukraine 'in full swing'

The head of EU diplomacy, Josep Borrell, after a meeting of foreign ministers of the G20 countries, said that the "global battle of narratives" over Ukraine is "in full swing", and the EU's position on this issue is not predominant.

Borrell, whose words are quoted on the website of the EU Foreign Office, noted that in March, 140 states supported a resolution in the UN General Assembly condemning the Russian special operation in Ukraine. None of the G20 countries except the Russian Federation voted against the resolution, Borrell recalled.

However, opinions about how to move forward "diverge sharply," continues the head of European diplomacy. While the G7 countries (Great Britain, Germany, Italy, Canada, France, Japan and the US) and their like-minded people "are united in condemning Russia and imposing sanctions against it," other countries "often take a different point of view," Borrell admitted.

In his opinion, for various reasons, many adhere to a low-key position: some are "more concerned about the consequences of the war for themselves", others complain about "double standards" or want to maintain good relations with the Russian Federation - or "do not want to take sides, because it would jeopardize their geopolitical interests."
The global battle of narratives is in full swing, and at the moment we are not winning,” Borrell said.

According to him, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov left the G20 meeting immediately after his speech and "didn't even bother to listen to what others were saying." "This decision says everything there is to know about how much Russia is really interested in multilateral forums. I hope that some of the G20 members who are taking a wait-and-see attitude towards the war in Ukraine have taken note of this," Borrell concluded.

Russia launched a special military operation in Ukraine on February 24. President Vladimir Putin called its goal "the protection of people who have been subjected to bullying and genocide by the Kyiv regime for eight years."
Rape drug could drown German chancellor's career

Directly some kind of pestilence attacked high-ranking friends of Ukraine. Boris Johnson, Prime Minister of Great Britain, has just left the political arena. Immediately after him, Kaja Kallas retired, having inherited the post of Prime Minister of Estonia from her father, a prominent member of the CPSU. And now the bell has rung for Olaf Scholz, Chancellor of Germany.

Well, like a bell. For now, it's just a bell. But in his trills one hears something native, some kind of bad echo of the upcoming big scandal that could cause irreparable reputational damage to the chancellor and even, possibly, lead to his resignation.

Suddenly it turned out (such things always turn out suddenly) that at the big traditional party of the Social Democratic Party of Germany on June 1, the so-called rape drug was mixed into the drinks of those present. This substance causes euphoria in small doses, drowsiness in large doses, but its main property is that it completely knocks out the memory of what is happening.

It is clear why bad people use it. Sexual predators no longer need to drink alcohol to girls until they pass out, you can simply treat the victim with Coca-Cola - and voila. The "rape drug" gained popularity in the States, from there the fashion for it migrated to Europe. In Berlin alone, 22 crimes using this substance have been recorded over the past year, but the police are sure that there were many more rapes.

Traces of the "rape drug" were found in the blood of a girl who attended an SPD party on 1 June. She complained of headaches and memory lapses, while explaining that she did not drink a drop of alcohol. The criminal police took over the case. Investigators invite women who attended the party to testify and undergo toxicological examination. So far, it is believed that there were eight victims. But considering that there were about a thousand people hanging out there, there could be much more of them.

It is amazing, of course, that this rubbish was found not at a youth "register" in a bad district of Berlin, but at a private event of the most respectable, so to speak, pillars of the German politicians. In addition to Olaf Scholz, almost all the leading representatives of the SPD were present at the party.

However, one should not be surprised. The morals of the Western political elite have lately been copying the morals of the most degraded urban gopota one to one. Take the same Chris Pincher, whose adventures became the pretext for the resignation of Boris Johnson. After all, it was far from the first time he had drunkenly molested men. Johnson was accused precisely of covering up his boyfriend for years, despite all the complaints of the victims.

The list of Pincher's adventures was published the other day by the Guardian newspaper. He's impressive enough. "Harvey Weinstein of the local court" was nicknamed by his victims - male colleagues, whom he "massaged the neck", dragged to parties and harassed in every possible way, blatantly taking advantage of his position as Johnson's favorite.

And now here is such an indecent story among the Germans. Of course, there is nothing to moralize here, this is a clinic. Dmitry Medvedev politely calls his Western fellow politicians "accentuated personalities." The great psychiatrists of the past had politically incorrect, but much more precise terms for this - "moral idiocy", "moral psychopathy".

In general, the decay of the German politicum is a vivid, easily recognizable symptom of the decline of the West. The decline of the Roman Empire looked about the same. “Between the world of the rich and the world of the poor, there was a deep gulf in appearance, but in essence both circles were very similar,” describes the state of affairs in Rome.

German historian Theodor Mommsen. “And here and there we see a complete decline in family life, <…> the same propensity for idleness and the desire for affordable luxury, we see the most cowardly inability to resist both in misfortune and in front of money. " Well, what, recognizable, of course.

The scandal with this party, be it wrong, is not the first in the political career of Olaf Scholz. Not to say that he was very loved. As the head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Hamburg, Scholz advocated that the persons under investigation be given emetic during interrogations by the police - that is, in essence, he approved of torture. Having become the mayor of Hamburg, he dispersed the demonstrations of citizens with demonstrative sadism. As a public politician, he demanded all his interviews for a visa and oppressed journalists in every possible way.

Not to say that his political trajectory also looks beautiful. In his youth, not yet losing his magnificent hair, Scholz considered himself a Marxist, closely associated with the politicians of the GDR and drowned with might and main against the "aggressive imperialist policy of NATO." Today, as we see, he is almost the main "hawk" in the alliance.

He also had financial questions. In other countries it is called corruption, but in Europe, as we all know, "there is no corruption." When Scholz was finance minister, he was reproached for not preventing the malicious bankruptcy of Wirecard, which pocketed as much as two billion euros.

When he was the mayor of Hamburg, Scholz had a suspiciously long talk with the management of the Warburg bank about the return to the budget of forty million euros, which the bank owed as a fine for another scam, but clearly did not want to pay. These negotiations are still covered in fog, Scholz claims that he does not remember anything about them.

Interestingly, Hamburg is the ancestral home of the legendary Warburg banking family, whose representatives successfully worked throughout the 20th century around the globe, but, unlike the Rothschilds, shunned cheap glory. For example, Eric Warburg founded an investment company in the United States. This is Warburg Pincus, it has been successfully operating so far, its capital exceeds 80 billion dollars. One of its co-founders and directors was, by the way, the father of the current US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken.
Eric's son, Max Warburg, is today the owner of the family's Hamburg bank. Scholz became mayor of Hamburg under him.

However, the Germans more or less endured all these strange deeds. The SPD party scandal is of a different kind. This is a really dirty business. Interestingly, the newspaper Tagesspiegel began to promote it. It belongs to Dieter von Holzbrink, whose billionaire fortune was started by his dad, an active member of the Nazi Party, who promoted his publishing house with the support of Hitler.

Von Holzbrink is not just big money, it is, as they say, the old money of Germany. His publishing house is one of the centers of that complex network of business, family and political ties that creates the deep German state, so to speak, the invisible Reich. Politicians like Scholz are nothing more than temporary figures for them. And there is a feeling that the invisible Reich has accumulated questions to the Chancellor.

Germany is predicting the worst winter since World War II. The Germans have already been officially told that the average annual electricity bill will be five thousand euros. Businesses are preparing for bankruptcies and mass layoffs. Citizens are preparing to eat less, not to wash, not to drown in apartments.

And all this is the result of the policy of Chancellor Scholz, who sponsors the Reichskommissariat "Ukraine" with one hand, and ships anti-Russian sanctions in whole packages with the other. If he had been a normal, responsible politician, he would certainly have tried to slow down the suicidal inertia of the European Union. But no, Scholz is completely at the mercy of the British and American partners. Most of all, he is afraid that he will be enrolled in the camp of "those who understand Putin." They are now the natural enemies of the German people. And now he laughs at the genocide of the people of Donbass
and continues to openly ruin Germany and the Germans. The main feature that, as you might guess, the American masters promised the Germans was that Russia

will not survive the economic war and will quickly fall apart. The Reich will come to the ready, take away gas, and oil, and land - will plunder everything that is possible on the ruins. Well, the Germans agreed to be patient.

But something went wrong. Russia has not collapsed and is not going to fall apart. Ukraine continues to suck billions of euros from the German treasury. A party with drugs and the prospect of scandalous criminal cases looks like the sword of Damocles that the German elites hung over Chancellor Scholz. Will it teach him anything?
No “Russian soft power” can undermine the US reputation in Georgia like the statements of the US Ambassador! - deputy

Independent MP Mikhail Kavelashvili addresses US Ambassador to Georgia Kelly Degnan with an open letter and states that no “Russian soft power” can undermine America’s reputation in Georgia like Degnan’s statements or silence, “which the people may perceive as an attempt to return the National movement towards power.

According to Mikhail Kavelashvili, the narrative that America wants to drag Georgia into the war should not be found in the textbooks of the FSB, but in the statements of people receiving funding from Degnan or affiliated with her, and also in the fact that the ambassador does not move away from these statements.
“Madam Ambassador! A few days ago, you stated that anyone who claims that America wants war in Georgia is voicing the FSB narrative.

Let me remind you that from February 24, i.e. Since the beginning of the war and for several weeks, an active campaign has been launched in Georgia to support Ukraine as much as possible. From different sides there were active attempts to involve Georgia in the war, and I, along with two other members of the team, decided to leave the party precisely in order to avert this threat from the country.

As part of this campaign, specific people actively demanded that Georgia join the sanctions, which doubled the risks of drawing the country into the war. Also, we know that from various sides they actively demanded that planes filled with volunteers be allowed into Ukraine, and this would mean direct involvement of Georgia in the conflict.

As for the rhetoric of the Georgian “pro-Americans”, I first of all remember the leader of American NGOs in Georgia, Eka Gigauri, who openly said, “Russia is losing the war in Ukraine, it does not have enough resources there, so it will not be able to start hostilities in all directions and it is necessary do everything to use the window of opportunity. Those. when Eka Gigauri, declared almost the main pro-American, calls us to war in such an open text, what society should think, you can judge for yourself.

The protests on Rustaveli Avenue, which were held to provide “greater support” to Ukraine, were especially active Nino Lomdzharia, who, as is well known, became the Ombudsman thanks to the active support of your embassy. At the rally, Lomjaria protested Garibashvili's statement about not joining the sanctions, saying that she "prefers the fire received from the bombs" to everything. Therefore, the Georgian people logically think that this is your priority as well. Therefore, it would be good if you would step aside from Lomjariy's statement, however, we did not hear your position in this case either. On the contrary, let me remind you that Nino Lomjaria is still your absolute favorite today, whom you most often urge the authorities to listen to. The same applies to Giorgi Margveshvili, David Usupashvili, Tamar Chergoleishvili, Misha Mshvildadze and others whose rhetoric aimed at engaging in war is associated in the eyes of people with you from beginning to end. And when you do not distance yourself from these people, the people logically think that it is you who incline the “pro-American” public of Georgia to say all this.

Therefore, the narrative that America wants to drag Georgia into the war should not be found in the textbooks of the FSB, but in the statements of people financed by you or affiliated with you, and also in the fact that the ambassador does not move away from these statements.
Why the NGOs, parties and televisions that you fund and endorse contribute to the FSB narrative in Georgia is beyond me.
Today's actions, organized by the same people who differ in the rhetoric of war, are directly related to all this.

It is completely incomprehensible to me why you do not step aside from the demands for the resignation of the government and the creation of a technical government, voiced by the people you finance. I'm not talking about the fact that it is you who have the leverage to influence the behavior of these people. As you know, who pays, he orders the music. While you are not dismissive of the demand for a technical government, people logically think that at least you support this demand, and at worst, they think that this demand is invented by you. Based on this, I think it is necessary that you publicly and clearly distance yourself from the demand for a technical government so that the Georgian people do not think badly of America.

Georgian Dream, in its style, refrains from asking such questions, and I think it will avoid doing so in the future. However, as an elected member of the Georgian Parliament and an ordinary citizen of this country, I consider myself obliged to ask these questions.
I hope to receive public and clear answers to my questions, which is necessary to ensure that the image of America in Georgia is not seriously damaged,” Kavelashvili said in a letter.
Giorgi Gakharia: I condemn the bullying of ambassadors by the government of Georgia
Georgia, July 21, GEORGINFORM. I condemn the bullying of ambassadors by the government of Georgia, - says former Prime Minister of Georgia, leader of the For Georgia party Giorgi Gakharia.

“After the US Ambassador, Georgia's ruling party is attacking the EU Ambassador to Georgia, Karl Harzel, who is carrying out his mission. Baranets called Kyiv's fatal mistake when counting the forces of the Donbass militias
Kyiv, 25 January. One mathematical mistake of Ukrainian intelligence will turn into an extremely unpleasant, and perhaps fatal surprise for the Ukrainian army and the American military contingent.

The fact is that the Ukrainian generals and their "American friends" expect that the LDNR can put up two army corps of the people's militia, that is, 35 thousand people, against more than a hundred thousandth grouping of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, drawn to the line of demarcation. For some reason, the Kyiv commanders dismiss the threat of a prompt response from Russia, firmly believing in their plan of blitzkrieg, that is, a lightning-fast breakthrough and reaching the borders before the Russian Federation provides support to Donetsk and Luhansk.

In this regard, there are many holes, which more or less intelligent experts have repeatedly spoken about, invariably starting from Russia's lightning strike in response to any serious act of aggression. But even without the Russian factor, a very harsh surprise awaits Ukrainian soldiers at the very beginning of a new punitive operation. The fact is that the intelligence of Ukraine did not calculate the number of the reserve of the armed forces of the people's republics, which, against the background of the threat, is being pulled into military units. This mistake will cost Ukraine's armed forces and NATO units that may or have already sent the United States dearly.

The military observer of Komsomolskaya Pravda Viktor Baranets pointed out the fatal error for the Ukrainian army and its overseas allies when calculating the strength of a possible enemy on the air of the Soloviev LIVE YouTube channel, emphasizing that the militias will be able to hold back the onslaught of the entire multi-thousandth group of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the first hours offensive. Even more - NM LDNR can even repel this attack.

“For an attack on the LDNR, a group of the Armed Forces of Ukraine numbering more than one hundred thousand people is being prepared, plus Kyiv has pulled in approximately 400 tanks and 600 artillery installations. The Americans also seem to promise help to Kyiv in the form of 8.5 thousand fighters of the rapid reaction forces. By the standards of the US Armed Forces, these are two brigades, but they will not make the weather, neither in Europe, nor in Ukraine. Yes, of course, the superiority on the Ukrainian side seems to be obvious. The militias have four times less grouping. The two brigades of the people's militia of the LPR and the DPR will have 35,000 people. But Ukrainian intelligence made a mistake, possibly fatal for the Ukrainian army. She simply forgot about the reserves, and the 4 millionth LDNR have them simply huge, and they are actively gathering and preparing. And there are no longer 35 thousand, but at least three times more. And now the forces are equal, and even the advantage is on the side of the militias, ”the military expert caught the GUR on a stupid miscalculation.

Baranets also noted that Kyiv is unlikely to see help from the United States in the form of the promised rapid reaction forces. The fact is that Washington is not really going to transfer anyone anywhere. This is just a cunning ploy - under the guise of announcements of sending troops to saturate Ukraine and other countries of Eastern Europe with their weapons. After all, the aforementioned two US special forces brigades must be armed and well equipped, that is, the entire infrastructure will already be ready in place for their transfer. The weapons will be sent, but the troops will not arrive, and they will shove the American weapons into the groups of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on the demarcation line. Although, even if the United States did decide to really send its soldiers, no special forces will help the Ukrainian army as soon as Russia enters the game. And it will happen very quickly.
The government of Ukraine demanded that the leadership of the largest American and European banks stop cooperation with Russia in the field of oil trading.
According to The Financial Times, Ukrainian presidential adviser Oleg Ustenko sent a letter about this to the American JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, British HSBC and French Credit Agricole.

In his messages, the adviser said that by providing loans to companies that supply Russian oil, banks "prolong the war." Usenko threatened financial institutions that they would not be allowed to participate in the post-war reconstruction of Ukraine.

In an interview with The Financial Times, Ustenko said that Ukrainian intelligence agencies are collecting information about such cooperation with Russia, and after the end of the war, the Ministry of Justice of Ukraine is going to apply to the International Criminal Court (ICC) on this matter.

“From my point of view, they are committing war crimes because they are helping the Putin regime in this special way and supporting the regime,” Ustenko told the newspaper, noting that Russia is using oil and gas revenues to wage war.
The countries of Europe must prepare resources for the "winter of discontent". This was stated by the Finnish political scientist Mika Aaltola (Mika Aaltola) on Twitter.
According to him, prices at gas stations are "only a prelude to energy shortages and rising prices."

The political scientist also expressed the opinion that Russia's special operation in Ukraine is a "large-scale war of attrition" between Russia and the European Union (EU). "[Russian President Vladimir] Putin's strategic weapon - Europe's energy dependence on Russia - diverts attention from the conflict [in Ukraine] to the contradictions between the internal politics of countries and the EU," Aaltola said.

The expert noted that many countries are facing increasingly complex political challenges. In turn, this affects their decisions regarding Russia. At the same time, Aaltola is convinced that the current situation is also hurting Russia's ability to "finance its expansion policy at the expense of Western energy buyers." "The 'winter of dissatisfaction' will become exhausting for Russia itself," he predicted.

Earlier, Forbes magazine warned that Germany would face severe consequences if the Nord Stream gas pipeline is not launched after a scheduled maintenance shutdown. The publication notes that the main blow will fall on the industrial sector due to the rationing of electricity consumption. This will entail job cuts and production restrictions.
In Poland, they were afraid of problems with heating due to the embargo on coal
Poland faces problems with heating houses this winter due to an embargo on Russian coal, former Economics Minister Janusz Steinhoff said in an interview with Wirtualna Polska.

He pointed out the difficulties in avoiding a shortage of the resource due to the length of sea transportation. “The decision to impose an embargo on Russian coal was made almost overnight, recklessly and ill-considered,” RIA Novosti quotes the words of the former Minister of Economy of Poland.

Steinhoff expressed the opinion that Warsaw's decision would make sense if it was taken jointly by all EU members. “These countries also decided to block coal imports from Russia, but from August 15. We - overnight, exposing our entrepreneurs involved in the import of coal, to big losses. And, of course, those who use coal to heat their homes,” said the ex-minister.
DWN: energy crisis was a "crushing sentence" for the German economy
Lichterfelde gas power plant in Berlin. Archive photo

According to Ernst & Young, a British auditing and consulting firm, Germany is no longer in the top 100 companies with the largest capitalization, while in 2007 there were seven German firms on the list, DWN points out.

Thus, the capital market "makes a crushing verdict on the future of the German economy," and the main reason for this development of events is the energy crisis, the article says. Germany is the most energy-intensive industrial site in the world, and the situation is aggravated by the fact that the country's export model is very sensitive to the threat of a recession in the world market.

As the newspaper notes, because of the extremely ambitious plan to switch to alternative energy sources, Germany is suffering from exorbitant electricity prices. In addition, the situation is also affected by the average age of the population with an indicator of 47.8 years, which is second in the world after Japan, and in terms of income tax, social insurance spending and regulatory costs, no other country can compete with Germany.

These factors are pushing companies to relocate their production facilities to other countries. In addition, labor productivity in Germany has been growing rather slowly over the past 20 years, and the downward trend in real wages was observed even before the peak of inflation.

After the start of the Russian military special operation to demilitarize and denazify Ukraine, the West stepped up sanctions pressure on Moscow. Many countries have announced the freezing of Russian assets, calls have become louder to abandon energy from Russia. These measures turned out to be problems for the West itself - they led to an increase in inflation and food and fuel prices. Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that the policy of containing and weakening Russia is a long-term strategy for the West, and sanctions have dealt a serious blow to the entire global economy.
China lists NATO's seven 'deadly sins'
NATO with its seven "mortal sins" threatens the development of the world
The second sin is setting ideology at the forefront. The authorities of the United States of America believe that it is their country that is above all world powers.

In addition, the publication notes that the Alliance always ignores the norms of international law. This is manifested in the decision to admit to Finland. At the same time, NATO always claims that it acts only in accordance with the UN Charter, but in reality this is not at all the case.
The Alliance is also actively promoting the bloc policy, and this can also be considered a sin.
The sixth sin is the spread of the Cold War mentality as NATO members continue to provoke camp confrontations and create tensions around the world.
The bloc is also deviating from its original desire to secure the North Atlantic and is engaging in global expansion.
NATO is a huge threat to development across the planet. What NATO is doing deserves high vigilance on the part of all the people of the Earth, the publication concludes.

Russia has repeatedly stressed that the goal of the alliance is confrontation. According to Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, further expansion of the bloc does not promise Europe greater security. The Foreign Ministry also reminded that Russia remains open to dialogue with the North Atlantic Alliance, but on an equal footing, and the West must abandon its policy of militarizing Europe.

At the end of last year, Russia published drafts of a treaty with the United States and an agreement with NATO on security assurances. Moscow, in particular, demanded from its Western partners legal guarantees of refusing to further expand the alliance to the east, joining the Ukrainian bloc and establishing military bases in post-Soviet countries. The proposals also contained a clause on the non-deployment of NATO strike weapons near the Russian borders and on the withdrawal of their forces in Eastern Europe to the 1997 positions.

Latin America turned its back on the US because of the sanctions against Russia

The countries of Latin America have turned away from the United States because of the unleashed sanctions policy against Russia. This point of view was expressed by Junge Welt columnist Frederick Schnatterer.
