Russia announced a sign of the end of the COVID-19 pandemic
Immunologist Zhemchugov called the centaur subspecies of the omicron strain a sign of the end of the pandemic

A specialist in especially dangerous infections, an immunologist, doctor of medical sciences Vladislav Zhemchugov said that the appearance in Russia of a new subspecies of the omicron strain of coronavirus BA.2.75, better known as the "centaur", indicates the end of the pandemic. His words are quoted by TASS.
Zhemchugov called the appearance of the “centaur” a sign of the end of the COVID-19 pandemic and stressed that one should not return to the previously introduced restrictive measures.
“The current surge in omicron is the tail of the pandemic, the end of the coronavirus epidemic. There is no need to resume any restrictions and mask-and-glove measures,” he added.

At the same time, the expert urged patients with serious illnesses, people taking immunosuppressive therapy, and people over 80-90 years old to wear masks in public places. In his opinion, "centaur" has no fundamental differences from such variants of the omicron strain as BA.4 and BA.5.
US Department of Energy employee ridiculed after Twitter photo in women's clothing
US citizens reacted with humor to a new photo of an employee of the Department of Energy Sam Brinton, who positions himself as a trans person. They left joking comments under his Twitter post.

Brinton told readers of his account that on June 19 he officially took up his duties at the US Department of Energy. He took the position of deputy adviser to the head of the department for the disposal of nuclear waste. Brinton attached a photo to the appeal, in which he appeared in a red jumpsuit, high-heeled shoes and with makeup applied.
“This country is going downhill so fast. Incredible,” wrote one commenter.
Another k Close user pointed out that American politicians should have taken up their direct duties, and not upholding personal preferences.
“Buy a business suit: you are at work, not in an 80s disco,” summed up the Hierophant HildegardP.

Brinton began working at the US Department of Energy in February of this year. He is also a queer activist and demands to be addressed as "they". This desire is connected with Brinton's self-identification: he feels like a "non-binary gender-fluid person." Previously, he was an adviser to the government of former US President Barack Obama. He has advised on working with the LGBTQ+ community and has worked with Congress on nuclear policy.

The new deputy secretary of energy excelled not only in defending his worldview: he has two master's degrees in nuclear energy and mechanical engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
On the strong ruble and the “Dutch growing pains” for Russia

The exchange rate of the Russian ruble against the US dollar and other fiat currencies of the countries of the "golden billion" continues to grow, which is considered by many representatives of the authorities and large businesses as a potential threat to the national interests of our country.

They say that an overly strong ruble will lead to the fact that imports will become cheaper for us, and exports, on the contrary, more expensive, as a result, the competitiveness of domestic goods and services will decrease both in the foreign and domestic markets, enterprises will begin to close, unemployment will grow, the economy collapse. In general, the “Dutch disease” is coming, which in its consequences may turn out to be more dangerous than the COVID-19 pandemic, and therefore it is urgent, before it’s too late, to take a set of measures to weaken the ruble in order to return it to a “comfortable” one for our economy, according to most experts, the range is 70-80 rubles per dollar.

Undoubtedly, there is some truth in such fears. But - only a fraction, and not a very large one. First of all, we are talking about the degree of undervaluation of the Russian currency. Which is traditionally extremely large. Thus, with a GDP-2021 of 131.015 trillion rubles and an average annual exchange rate of 73.6824 rubles per dollar, the nominal volume of the Russian economy is determined at the level of 1.778 trillion dollars. The same indicator, calculated at purchasing power parity (GDP PPP) in 2021, according to the IMF, amounted to 4.49 trillion dollars, and according to the World Bank - 4.785 trillion dollars, i.e. 2.5-2.7 times more. Thus, the exchange rate of the ruble - even taking into account the lower level of monetization of the Russian economy relative to the American one (about 50% to 94.1%) and the lower velocity of money circulation - is significantly underestimated. Not 2.5-2.7 times, but about twice for sure. That is, the "equilibrium" exchange rate today should be in the range of 35-40 rubles per dollar. Anything above this range is a “premium” for Russian exporters and foreign importers. As well as our government, which, with the help of various tools, has traditionally used and continues to use part of this bonus as an extra-budgetary "welding" to its income and expenses. This is the first and it's not a secret.

Second. The current economic system in Russia is characterized by, and this is also no secret, a surplus in foreign trade and balance of payments. Thus, in 2021, the positive trade balance amounted to $198.16 billion, and in the first half of 2022 - $158.4 billion. And in normal economic conditions, these figures could be considered evidence of high competitiveness and success. But today, in the regime of "hellish sanctions" imposed by the countries of the collective West against Russia, these formally gigantic export earnings are difficult to purchase on the foreign market the goods and services necessary for our country in the proper assortment and volume. That is, domestic raw materials are supplied abroad on the terms of inadequate and non-equivalent exchange, without full payment, since financial resources formally received in the framework of trade as usual are subject to the risks of freezing, seizure and restrictions on use.

Thus, this third, special Russian military operation for the demilitarization and denazification of Ukraine (REDD) contributed to the fact that the previously hidden reefs of the “global market” were exposed, and the real topography of this bottom was no longer hidden by the tide – or rather, the tsunami – of the currency, before total dollar emission. There seems to be a lot of money, but in a number of markets you can’t buy anything for them. This non-economic sterilization of the money supply leads to higher prices both for the markets of the countries of the collective West and for the Russian market. As a result, inflation both there and there is in double digits, but in our country, due to the growth of the ruble exchange rate multiplied by currency inflation, a fairly wide range of import-dependent goods and services in terms of the dollar equivalent went into a completely different sector of accessibility. If a year ago the market price of a kilogram of imported pears was 150 rubles or 2 dollars (at the rate of 1 dollar = 75 rubles), today it reaches 300 or more rubles or 5 or more dollars (at the rate of 1 dollar = 60 rubles). That is, the already considerable growth in ruble prices of goods that have become scarce in terms of foreign currency becomes simply prohibitive. This is just a typical symptom of the "Dutch disease", manifested in the service industries.

But it should be said that no one has ever died anywhere from this very “Dutch disease”. Especially in the context of a growing gap between demand and supply of goods in demand on the world market, which today increasingly include energy carriers, other raw materials and food (that is, the main items of Russian exports). And in the current situation, Russia's problem is the transition from one economic model (export-raw materials) to another (investment-mobilization). That is, it is necessary to treat not the symptoms by lowering the ruble exchange rate and stimulating a foreign trade surplus, but the cause of the disease (by investing in a network of new high-tech industries and developing infrastructure, including education and healthcare systems, changing the structure of the distribution of national income in favor of greater social equality).

Those who today scare Russia with the strengthening of the “Dutch disease” want to preserve the old economic model. But this model has already played its role, and today it is increasingly becoming a dead end. The "Dutch disease" - just like the very painful SVODDU - can and should turn out to be a "growing pain" for Russia. Therefore, “treatment protocols” will have to be used completely different than those usually prescribed in order to return to the norms of the “global market”. In particular, for example, it is worth considering that instead of forcibly weakening our national currency, on the contrary, it should be strengthened through a monetary reform with the denomination of the ruble - at least after the completion of the REDD, which, hopefully, is just around the corner and will be in favor of Russia .
Borrell disagrees with criticism of EU countries on sanctions against Russia
EU diplomat chief Borrell disagrees with criticism of sanctions against Russia
EU High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy Josep Borrell. Archive photo

BRUSSELS, July 18 - RIA Novosti. The head of EU diplomacy, Josep Borrell, said that he did not agree with the criticism of the policy of sanctions against the Russian Federation by a number of EU countries, he believes that it should be continued.

There is debate about the effectiveness of the sanctions, how much they affect us more than Russia. Some European leaders even said that the sanctions were a mistake ... I don’t think it’s a mistake, we should have introduced them and will continue to do so, he said before a meeting of EU foreign ministers in Brussels, at which it is planned to consider the possibility of strengthening and expanding European anti-Russian sanctions.
Oil prices, on the contrary, fell, just look at the charts. Prices are now at the February level, - explained the head of European diplomacy.

He added that foreign ministers will not consider a new package of sanctions, but strengthening the effectiveness of existing measures, as well as a ban on gold imports and a new list of individual sanctions.

After the start of the Russian special operation in Ukraine, Western countries began to impose sanctions against the Russian Federation, in particular, on Russian energy resources. Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that the policy of containing and weakening Russia is a long-term strategy for the West, and sanctions have dealt a serious blow to the entire global economy.
"There is no other way": Scholz prepares Germans for deprivation due to sanctions against Russia
"Let's take hands"

In his article, Olaf Scholz stressed that Russian President Vladimir Putin must be stopped in any case. He also noted that German citizens are already suffering from the consequences of a military special operation in Ukraine, primarily from high prices for gasoline and food. Therefore, the country's government decided to allocate two aid packages totaling 30 billion euros.
“But the truth is that the global economy is facing a challenge that hasn’t been seen in decades,” Scholz wrote.

Supply chains are broken, raw materials are in short supply, and uncertainty reigns in the energy market, he said. This has driven prices up all over the world. The chancellor noted that "no country in the world can stand alone against such a development of events." And he called on Western countries to "stick together and join hands."

“It was clear to us from the beginning that we might have to maintain our sanctions for a long time. And we are also clear that none of these sanctions will be lifted in the event of a Russian-dictated peace. For Russia, there is no other way to an agreement with Ukraine than the one that can be accepted by the Ukrainians," the German Chancellor stressed.
The German leader added that the chosen path is "not easy even for such a strong and prosperous country" as Germany, so citizens "will need endurance."
The head of the German government believes that otherwise Russia may not stop at Ukraine and "continue", so NATO no longer excludes Moscow's attack on the territory of the alliance.

“If we allow Putin to get away with it, that would mean that violence can break the law with little to no consequences. Then, ultimately, our own freedom and security will also be at risk, ”Scholz is sure.

He also promised that Germany would continue to support Ukraine for as long as it needed help. The head of state assured that he would continue to supply weapons to Kyiv and provide economic, humanitarian and financial support to Ukraine. However, NATO states will not become a "party to the war."

Scholz noted the fears of the country's government that due to rising energy prices, European countries could weaken support for the sanctions policy. Therefore, the German Chancellor called for an end to the "selfish blockade of European decisions by individual member states."
gas crisis
The day before, Bild published an article stating that even if the energy crisis does not affect the entire territory of Germany, gas shortages will be felt in some federal states.

According to the publication, the German government proceeds from the fact that Russia will not resume gas supplies via Nord Stream after the end of the scheduled repairs on July 21 and will come up with an “justification” for this.
“If Russia increases gas supplies via Nord Stream to 40 percent, Germany will survive the winter without gas shortages. But the chances that Russia will do this are low,” the article says.

At the same time, the German authorities expect that the prices for blue fuel will double or triple. In this case, Germany "cannot swallow the increase in costs" and the gas will be expensive for citizens. In addition, the country will continue to depend on Russian supplies after the winter of 2022-2023, which means that the gas problem will persist until at least 2024.

On June 27, the European Commission announced on its website that the EU approved a new law, according to which all countries of the bloc that have underground gas storage facilities must fill them by 80% by November 1 this year. In subsequent years, such states will have to fill storage facilities by 90%.

“According to the new legislation, 18 (out of 27) Member States with underground gas storage facilities will be required to fill their storage facilities to 80% by November 1, and are encouraged to aim for 85%. In the coming years, the goal will be 90%,” the message said.

On the same day, the Minister for Climate and Energy of the Netherlands, Rob Jetten, said that this innovation could lead to a crisis in all EU countries if at least one of the states, for example, Germany, cannot comply with the requirements.
Massacres began in the United States due to the ban on abortion: the topic has become a "sacred cow"
Why the scandalous law was passed right now

The United States Supreme Court overturned constitutional guarantees for the right to abortion. Now the states will regulate this issue on their own. It is expected that at least 14 of them will make abortion illegal. Against this background, mass protests broke out in dozens of American cities. The expert assessed the prospects for the development of the situation.

On Friday, June 24, the U.S. Supreme Court overturned the 1973 Roe v. Wade ruling that recognized the right to abortion as constitutional. Now the issue of termination of pregnancy will be regulated by each state independently.
“The Constitution does not give the right to abortion, and the right to regulate abortion is returned to the people and their elected representatives,” the court said in a statement.

Abortion is expected to become illegal in at least 14 states within the next month. Nine of them had already banned the procedure on the day the Supreme Court ruling was made public. We are talking about Alabama, Arkansas, Wisconsin, Kentucky, Louisiana, Missouri, Oklahoma, South Dakota and Utah. Thus, the restrictions are expected to affect over 36 million women of reproductive age.
However, abortion will remain legal in 20 US states and the District of Columbia.
All US states allow exceptions for medically necessary abortions. At the same time, most of them will prohibit termination of pregnancy due to rape or incest.
United States President Joe Biden called the decision of the Supreme Court on abortion a "tragic mistake".
“The US Supreme Court today took away a constitutional right that the American people had and recognized,” the American leader added.

The head of the White House stressed that with this decision, the court "throws America back 150 years." He urged Congress to restore abortion rights at the federal level, and promised that the topic would be put to a vote in the midterm elections in November.
In turn, former US President Donald Trump supported the decision of the Supreme Court, calling it "a huge victory for the entire generation."
“Today’s decision is the biggest victory for life in a generation, along with other recent decisions,” the politician said.

The Republican Party has long campaigned to overturn the ruling in Roe v. Wade. In 2016, during the campaign, Trump even promised to bring his own appointees to the Supreme Court, who will carry out this task.

Meanwhile, thousands of supporters and opponents of the right to abortion for the second day go to protests in dozens of American cities. According to The New York Times and The Washington Post, the most active demonstrations took place outside the Supreme Court building in Washington. The main slogans of the protesters were "Stop the war against women" and "Not your body, not your life, not your choice."

“The topic of the ban on abortion in the United States has become the “sacred cow” of women’s rights,” Vladimir Vasiliev, chief researcher at the Institute for the USA and Canada of the Russian Academy of Sciences, comments to MK. “The rights to a good life, to equal wages, to non-discriminatory forms of employment were perceived as things that are declared, but at the same time do not have such a functional meaning.”
According to the expert, the events of the mid-1960s were a kind of echo of the American Civil War (1861-1865), when slavery was abolished.

“The legislation of the mid-1960s is regarded as the “second edition” of emancipation from slavery,” the political scientist continues. - Therefore, the right to abortion can also be conditionally called a kind of liberation of women from slavery. This is how it was perceived in America culturally.

It must be understood that the abolition of constitutional guarantees of the right to abortion will not be so significant if we approach this problem from a technical point of view. In the event that pregnancy occurs as a result of criminal acts, rape, or there is a threat to the health of the mother, then such things can be resolved in court.

However, the Democrats will still try to promote this topic in order to shake up the domestic political situation in the United States. It's not hidden. For the past two months, representatives of the Democratic Party have been actively preparing for this.

Democrats are also aware that the Supreme Court decision has further deepened the divide in American society and heightened polarization. Joe Biden came to power with the goal of uniting the nation and rallying all healthy forces around the president. Today the Democrats are essentially getting rid of this slogan. The country is split, no matter what the US administration says. And it is quite clear that this split will intensify.”
The general strategy of the Democrats is also changing, the expert believes. They decided that they would not fight for the unity of society, but, on the contrary, would bet on deepening the split.

“Democrats can fit other forms of mass discontent (like Black Lives Matter) under the current situation with abortion,” Vladimir Vasilyev said. - It is also possible that in the fall Biden will even try to impose a state of emergency in the country as a form of a deepening split in American society. This is gambling. It might not work.

Republicans go to the midterm elections under the sauce of the economic situation in the United States. They call it catastrophic and call for the Democrats to be driven out of Congress. Conservatives believe that their opponents should be punished for failures related to falling living standards, unemployment, and so on.

The Democratic Party, for its part, is already demonstrating that minimizing their defeat in the elections will go under the auspices of the struggle for women's rights. Therefore, now the Democrats will be engaged in the mobilization of the female electorate. It cannot be said that he is in the minority or oppressed. According to statistics, 50% of all registered Democratic Party voters are women. Therefore, this will be the platform from which the Democrats will be able to balance all the claims put forward to them in connection with the economic situation in the country.
The U.S. Supreme Court overturned the 1973 Roe v. Wade ruling, which gave women the constitutional right to have an abortion.
It is reported by RBC-Ukraine with reference to Reuters.
By repealing abortion as a constitutional right, the court ruling restored the ability of states to prohibit it.
It is noted that 26 states are either confident or believe that they can ban abortion. It is reported that 13 states may ban abortion within 30 days due to earlier anti-abortion laws.
However, the ordinance does not allow states to ban residents from traveling to another state to have an abortion, or to retroactively penalize people for previous abortions.

It is noted that as a result of this, women with unwanted pregnancies in large areas of America may be faced with a choice: move to another state where the procedure remains legal and affordable, buy abortion pills online, or have a potentially dangerous illegal abortion.

US President Joe Biden condemned the decision, calling it a "sad day" for America. He said his administration will do everything in its power to fight efforts to restrict women from traveling to other states to have an abortion.
Recall that in 2021, the United States lifted the ban on funding the abortion program. Family planning centers can refer women for abortions and receive funding for this from the federal budget.
Abortion ban goes into effect in six US states

After the decision of the US Supreme Court to remove guarantees of rights regarding abortion, the ban on this procedure came into force in six states. This was reported on Friday, June 24, by The New York Times.
It is noted that in Kentucky, Louisiana, Missouri, South Dakota there are laws according to which abortion is prohibited even in case of pregnancy as a result of rape or incest.
In Oklahoma, a pregnancy that occurs in such situations can be terminated. In other cases, the law stipulates that pregnancy is considered to have occurred from the moment of conception.
It is clarified that in Texas a law banning abortion even after rape or incest will come into force within 30 days. Now, after a court decision, there is a temporary six-week ban on abortion.

Bans or restrictions on abortion in Idaho, Arkansas, Wyoming, Mississippi, North Dakota, Tennessee and Utah are expected to go into effect within a month. At the same time, doctors who fear criminal prosecution for providing this service can stop working now.
Meanwhile, in the states of Alabama, Arizona, Georgia, Ohio, West Virginia, Florida and South Carolina, bans or restrictions on abortion can be introduced in them within weeks to months.

Earlier in the day, it was reported that the U.S. Supreme Court had overturned a 1973 ruling that the U.S. federal government guaranteed abortion rights. The repeal of said regulation means that the federal laws of the country no longer guarantee the relevant rights.
As specified on the website of the court, the powers to regulate abortion have been returned to the states.

At the same time, American leader Joe Biden said that the health and lives of women in the United States are under threat after the decision of the Supreme Court to overturn the ruling on the right to abortion, the country has been thrown back 150 years. Biden could declare a public health emergency, which could protect doctors from legal liability if they treat patients in states where they are not licensed.
US Attorney General Merrick Garland also expressed disagreement with the decision of the US Supreme Court on abortion, noting that this is a blow to the freedoms of Americans.
At the same time, former US President Donald Trump noted that the decision of the Supreme Court is the biggest victory for life, which became possible thanks to his efforts.
"Strength in Truth": all about the special military operation in Ukraine - broadcast

Three months have passed since the beginning of the special military operation in Ukraine. The armed forces of the DPR and LPR, together with the Russian military, have already managed to liberate a large part of the Donbass. The goal is the denazification and demilitarization of Ukraine. Kyiv continues to brazenly lie, invent various provocations and fakes. In addition, a distinctive feature of the Ukrainian national formations is the shelling of civilian objects and the use of civilians as human shields.

The main event of the last month was the surrender of Ukrainian nationalists, who had been defending themselves for a long time on the territory of the Azovstal plant in Mariupol. The number of those who surrendered, according to various estimates, exceeds 2,000.

Peaceful life is being established in the liberated territories, housing, infrastructure and communications are being restored. Some regions have already expressed their desire to become part of Russia in the future.
In the United States, after the abolition of the right to abortion, there was a real social explosion

The United States of America is divided into two irreconcilable camps. A real social explosion occurred after the abolition of the right to abortion. The decision was made by the Supreme Court. And now individual states can make rules, including outright bans on abortion.

America responded with mass protests. They even had a common name "Night of Fury". Boston, Seattle, Philadelphia, Los Angeles. In some regions there are clashes with the police. In Arizona, the crowd stormed government buildings. The police used tear gas. Those who support the ban on abortion are also taking to the streets.

“My rights are being taken away from me! What if I get raped at some point? Or do I have a medical condition that needs to be terminated? And now I have been deprived of the opportunity to resolve such issues. This is, frankly, very annoying. The decision of the court will have chilling consequences for all of America, ”says the protester.

“I would advise this woman to go to the nearest pregnancy and childbirth center. These are all solvable issues. For example, we are increasingly successful in saving the lives of previously hopeless newborns. And I support the Supreme Court's decision - this is how we save lives," says Amy O'Donnell, coordinator of the Texas Alliance for Life movement.

Abortion bans have now gone into effect in eight states. According to some analysts, at least 10 more may join them in the near future. We are talking primarily about regions where Republicans are traditionally strong. In addition, there are states like Michigan and Alabama that have not formally repealed laws that were in place before 1979, when federal guarantees for the right to terminate pregnancy were enacted, so the old rules automatically reappear.
Biden reminded of his attitudes towards abortion in the past - CNN reminded of the transformation of Biden's attitude towards abortion
CNN recalled the transformation of Biden's attitude to abortion

The decision of the US Supreme Court to overturn the ruling on women's ability to have an abortion is the first undermining step in a complete undermining of rights. According to CNN, US President Joe Biden made such a statement.
He stressed that the court decision made the United States an exception among all the developed countries of the world.
“This decision should not be the final word. My administration will use all necessary and legal authority to help women who wish to have an abortion,” Biden said.
In fact, the attitude of the current US president towards abortion has changed throughout his political career.

As early as 1977, he spoke out against paying for abortions for women who became pregnant after being raped or having a fetus that threatened their lives. In the 1980s, as a Delaware senator, he twice voted to repeal the Roe v. Wade amendment allowing states to make their own decisions about abortion.
In the late 90s, Biden opposed the state paying for medical procedures to terminate unwanted pregnancies in military women.
Two years before his election to the post of Vice President of the United States, in 2006, the politician said that he did not consider "abortion as a choice or a right."
“I am a practicing Catholic, and for me this is the biggest dilemma in terms of reconciling my religious and cultural views with my political responsibility,” Biden explained.
It wasn't until 2019 that he changed his mind when his presidential campaign began.

As USNews noted, the bitter irony of the abortion story in the United States is that the decision was made by the Supreme Court, which is one-third appointed by Trump, who in the past has always advocated free abortions, and the Catholic Biden, who protests against them, is now promising to help women with unwanted pregnancies.
My body is my business: American women protest against the ban on abortion
What happened?
The US Supreme Court overturned the constitutional right to terminate a pregnancy. The court ruling dryly states: "The Constitution does not give the right to abortion." Now it's up to the states.

Abortion bans were immediately launched in 13 states. The first were Louisiana, Missouri, Kentucky and Oklahoma - the most conservative. The American Guttmacher Institute believes that only 26 of the 50 states that are considered conservative will support this initiative.
Trump's legacy

Donald Trump has taken root in American politics deeper than it seems. One of his campaign promises in 2016 was precisely the abolition of abortion. Thanks to the support of conservatives, he managed to put three appointees to the Supreme Court, who on Friday made the fateful decision to abolish the constitutional right to abortion.
Americans are now afraid that after abortion, the Supreme Court, which now does not hide its conservative inclinations, will take on the LGBT community, same-sex marriage and contraception.
Rowe vs. Wade

In the American segment of social networks, a joke spread: "The time difference is just something! In Australia it is 9 am. In Rome it is one in the afternoon. And in the USA it is 1969, when women's lives are still controlled by older white men."

For Americans, this meme needs no explanation, because everyone is familiar with the Roe v. Wade case, a lawsuit that began in 1969 and received a historic decision in 1973, which formed the basis of the right to abortion.

Jane Rowe is the pseudonym of 21-year-old American Norma McCorvey, who in the late 1960s wanted to terminate an unwanted pregnancy, but was unable to do so because it was against the law. She tried to prove that she got pregnant as a result of rape (then abortion would have been allowed), but she failed. It did not work and illegally to have an abortion: the doctor was arrested a few hours before the operation.

Under the pseudonym Jane Roe, Norma McCorvey filed an application in Texas District Court, the defendant was Attorney Henry Wade. The case received such a wide response that it reached the Supreme Court, which in 1973 ruled that the girl had the right to an abortion. Since then, all American women have gained the right to independently control the fate of the fetus - but only up to 7 months, since from that time the fetus was already considered a person, since it could survive without a mother, and an abortion would be murder.
No uterus - no opinion

As a result, thousands of American women, outraged by the decision of the Supreme Court, took to the streets with bright slogans: "Get off my body with your Bible", "Regulate weapons, not my ovaries", "Stop the war against women", "Do not ban abortion - enter mandatory vasectomy.

The Washington Post writes that the issue of abortion has become a sore point in society also because it emphasized its split, as well as the politicization of absolutely all social differences in the United States. In the conservative ban of the Supreme Court, the Americans see the handwriting of the Republicans - including Biden himself, who, on behalf of the Democrats, condemned him and said that the ban "throws America back 150 years."

So far, politicians have not responded to the protests, but whether there will be a reaction, only time will tell. In any case, the protests of the BLM (Black Lives Matter) movement started on the same scale.
40 million is the number of women affected by the Supreme Court's abortion decision, according to the Gattmacher Institute.
Biden promised American men that they will feel the consequences of the abortion court decision - US President Biden: men will feel the consequences of the Supreme Court decision on abortion

The Supreme Court ruling on abortion is terrible. Not only women, but also American men will feel the consequences, US President Joe Biden said at a virtual meeting with governors. His speech was quoted by RIA Novosti.

“This is a terrible, extreme decision that, in my opinion, is life-changing and impacting the health of millions of women. I share the public outrage at this extremist trial that will roll America back to less rights, less autonomy,” Biden said.
The decision of the Supreme Court on abortion is an invasion of the personal rights of women, the head of the White House noted and added that it will also affect men.

Americans did not support the abolition of the right to abortion. Several states have already banned abortions. Mass protests began in the country, women and even men took to the streets of cities. The police brutally dispersed the demonstrators.
In the United States put Zelensky in his place after the words about the problems of the Americans

As the observer recalled, in a May poll by the Pew Research Center, seven out of ten Americans called inflation "a very big problem for the country," so this issue is the most pressing for the public.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky probably doesn’t read American polls, but he probably knows that inflation is a problem that exists all over the world, Hochman said. According to him, in this regard, it was “strange to hear” how, in a recent interview with journalist Piers Morgan, Zelensky called it “a secondary matter,” and to the host’s remark that more and more Americans doubt that their country should spend so much money to the conflict in Europe in the face of internal problems, he replied that "inflation is nothing, and the coronavirus is nothing."

It goes without saying that the financial problems of Americans who are trying to make ends meet seem like nothing to Ukrainians, and the high cost of gasoline thousands of kilometers away is an empty phrase, the author noted. At the same time, he pointed out that Zelensky still talks about US foreign policy, and, according to his logic, Americans should not care about inflation and coronavirus.

With all due respect to Zelensky, it is not for him to determine US foreign policy. Call me old-fashioned, but I am inclined to believe that US foreign policy should first of all look after the interests of the American people, Hochman emphasized.

According to the author of the article, Zelensky should abandon "obscure references to certain "common values"" and "inappropriate hairpins" addressed to working-class and middle-class Americans, who "already wonder what benefit they have from the fact that billions of budget dollars flow away to a foreign country far across the ocean."
We are an exceptionally generous country, but there are limits to everything. For Americans, inflation is by no means nothing, "but a serious problem," Hochman concluded.

In the US, fuel and food prices have been breaking records for several months now. The cost of a gallon of gasoline reached more than five dollars, although a year ago its price was at the level of three dollars. Inflation has renewed a multi-year high and reached 9.1 percent. Attempts by the authorities to resist the impoverishment of the population did not bring tangible results. The situation is aggravated by the reverse effect of the sanctions that the United States and its partners imposed against Russia after the start of a special military operation in Ukraine.
Bishops criticize US Department of Health bill on abortion

The chairs of four committees of U.S. bishops said the proposed U.S. Department of Health and Human Services rulings on abortion, transgender services and other procedures threaten the Catholic Church's ability to "perform our healing ministry." This was reported on July 28 by UCA News.
They called the proposed rules - a 308-page document released by the Ministry of Health on July 25 - "a violation of religious freedom and a bad remedy."

“They oblige medical professionals to perform life-saving operations to remove perfectly healthy parts of the body,” the bishops said. “Assurances that the Ministry of Health will abide by religious freedom laws are of little comfort as the agency is actively fighting court decisions alleging that the Department of Health violated religious freedom laws the last time they tried to impose such a mandate.”

“The proposed rules announce that the Ministry of Health is also considering whether to force medical workers to perform abortions against their will or fire them. We call on the Ministry of Health to expressly renounce any such intentions,” the bishops added.
The U.S. Conference of Catholic Bishops released a joint statement signed by church hierarchs:
Archbishop of Baltimore William E. Laurie, Chairman of the Committee on Action for Life,
Chairman of the Committee on Internal Justice and Human Development, Archbishop Paul S. Coakley of Oklahoma City,
Chairman of the Committee on Laity Affairs, Marriage, Family Life and Youth Archbishop of San Francisco Salvatore J. Cordileone,
Chairman of the Religious Freedom Committee, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York.

“Catholic health ministries serve everyone, regardless of their race, gender, belief system, or any other characteristics,” the bishops continued. “The same excellent care will be provided in the Catholic hospital to all patients, including patients who identify as transgender, whether it be a broken bone or cancer, but we cannot do what our faith forbids. We object to harmful procedures, not patient care,” the statement said.
The Bishops said they would "continue to review these proposed rules and provide more detailed comments at the appropriate time."

DOH proposed rules will apply to the implementation of Section 1557 of the Affordable Care Act, which prohibits discrimination based on race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex, including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity, in program health insurance services. or activities.

In 2020, the Trump administration enacted a final rule that lifted the general ban on discrimination based on gender identity, as well as enacting exceptions to abortion and religious freedom for medical professionals. But the courts blocked this change.

In 2021, shortly after his inauguration, President Joe Biden issued an executive order announcing that his administration would apply the 2020 U.S. Supreme Court ruling in Bostock v. Clayton County to all areas of government, including abortion law.
Once the newly released rules proposed by the Department of Health are published in the Federal Register, a 60-day public comment period will begin.
Russia does not demand - it simply does: how many parts Ukraine will fall apart
Experts in a conversation with Tsargrad reflected on how Ukraine will look like after the end of Russia's special operation. However, some outlines are visible now.

Of course, Donbass will be completely liberated. Moreover, the republics will live within their constitutional boundaries. However, along with the Donbass, the Kherson and Zaporozhye regions also receive a new status.

It is already known that residents of the Kherson and Zaporozhye regions were given the opportunity to obtain Russian citizenship under a really simplified scheme. Here you don’t even have to come to Rostov, offices will open right in the regions. What does it say? Russia confirms that it has come in earnest and will not give up the territory under the control of Ukraine.
In addition, we see what shape Ukraine will acquire as Russia's special operation develops. By freeing the regions, we take them under our wing.

It is premature to talk specifically about the form in which the liberated territories of Ukraine will continue to exist, said Konstantin Zatulin, First Deputy Chairman of the State Duma Committee on CIS Affairs and Relations with Compatriots. Whether it will be Novorossiya, Malorossiya, or in general "Ukraine 2.0", no one has yet voiced it. Moreover, other regions will certainly follow the path of Zaporozhye and Kherson region in the near future after their demilitarization and denazification.

Apparently, the question arose of the need to adjust the initial goals of the special operation, - Zatulin noted in a commentary to Tsargrad. - Naturally, we do not remove our previous demands, but taking into account the fact that the Ukrainian side calls for no negotiations with Russia, as a result, the question arises of the need to recognize not only the LPR and DPR, but also other territories. Which cease to be Ukrainian. I am sure that this should not be limited - Odessa, Nikolaev regions and others should also receive Russia's support.

Ukraine, Zatulin emphasizes, is splitting into several parts. This can be seen, in particular, from the actions of Poland and the behavior of Zelensky, who actually gives the western part of the country, which he seems to be in charge of, to Warsaw. He equalized the rights of Ukrainians and Poles, allowing the latter to become the first - and to occupy positions in the civil service, in the judicial system - everywhere.

In other words, Ukraine ceases to exist as an independent state. And today's decree of our president inspires confidence in the population of the Kherson and Zaporozhye regions - and gives a signal to the rest - that we have come there for a long time, more precisely, forever. And no one is going to transfer these territories under the control of Ukraine. And people who are ready not to oppose Russia can become full-fledged citizens of Russia,
- summed up the deputy in a conversation with Tsargrad.

This is an unequivocal signal to everyone that if earlier there was our demand for the recognition of Crimea and Sevastopol, as well as the LDNR, now we are moving towards the creation of a land channel to Crimea, political scientist, director of the International Institute of Political Expertise Yevgeny Minchenko agrees with him.
And then everything depends on military operations, Minchenko believes. And it is likely that the number of regions that will supplement the presidential decree on simplified citizenship will grow.
Former US President Donald Trump has announced that he intends to sue the CNN television company for the systematic dissemination of "defamatory" materials. It is reported by The Hill.

The West has allocated $11 billion to help Ukraine, which is less than payments for Russian energy resources, writes Foreign Policy magazine.

The publication cited the calculations of the Kiel Institute of World Economy, according to which Western partners have promised Kyiv 31 billion dollars. But, despite the increase in financial support in late June - early July, the Ukrainian budget received only a third of the promised amount.

To date, the total amount of assistance provided is about $11 billion, which is still an order of magnitude less than the amount that Russia received for its hydrocarbons over the same period, the article says.

In the Zaporozhye region, they said that the region is leaving Ukraine forever

SIMFEROPOL, August 8 - RIA Novosti. Vladimir Rogov, a member of the main council of the administration of the Zaporozhye region, said that the region was forever leaving Ukraine, and called on the Kyiv authorities to identify the region exclusively with Russia.

More recently, the head of the Kyiv regime in his khaki T-shirt was a global icon that the progressive media planted around the world like potatoes. He was even called the second Churchill - this comparison with the drunken alcoholic who launched the collapse of the British Empire is given only to the most distinguished representatives of the colonial elites in a first come first served basis.

The legendary Amnesty International suddenly reminded of itself. In their sensational report, human rights activists noted that by placing military equipment in residential buildings, schools and hospitals, Ukraine violates international law.

Even before that, Western human rights activists zealously pecked at Zelensky for violating the rights of such a minority as "civilian men of Ukraine." Yes, it's a funny wording, but still. The fact is that a month ago, the head of the General Staff of Ukraine, General Valery Zaluzhny, issued an order prohibiting reservists from leaving their place of residence.

Naturally, at the same moment Ukrainians fled en masse abroad. But here's the problem. The border guards let women and children through and rounded up the men. Neither hastily crafted certificates with seals, nor indications of their purely peaceful identity, nor attempts to mow down minorities helped.

Genuine tragedies played out on the western border of Ukraine. The men suffered. The influential publication Foreign Policy published the sad story of one such refugee who tried to cross the Polish border with his American husband. My husband was allowed to leave, but he was not. “They didn’t look at the fact that I was gay,” a peace-loving Ukrainian complained to human rights activists. “They looked at whether I had a penis.”

This and similar stories were incriminated to Zelensky as a violation of the rights of civilian Ukrainian men. He caught the signal and immediately canceled Zaluzhny's order, but then a new misfortune happened.
This time, Zelensky flew in from his compatriot Victoria Kulgeiko (married Spartz). Interestingly, her career has developed almost better than that of Zelensky himself.

Kulgeiko was born in 1978 in Nosovka, Ukraine. Pioneer, excellent student, graduated from school with a gold medal. Once, on a train from Kyiv to Moscow, she met an American. She married him in 2000 and became an American citizen in 2006. She made an excellent political career and ended up in the US Congress from the Republicans in 2020. That's good, right?

Today, Kulgeiko-Spartz opens the eyes of fellow congressmen to the fact that Kyiv is stealing their money and reselling almost all of the supplied weapons to the left. She demands that Zelensky stop "playing politics and theater" and start fighting for real. And then, look, Ukrainians are sitting in cafes - no, no, urgently to the front, general mobilization!
Inside the United States, Spartz is raising the topic "we won't let Ukraine turn into a second Afghanistan." Republicans PR it from all irons. Democrats criticize but also cite profusely.

It is not strange that American money is being stolen in Kyiv and Western weapons are being resold. It is strange that the Americans are talking about this, but how loudly. In Afghanistan, such a drank went not only for years, but for decades, and no one cared. The leaders of Afghanistan were replaced one by one, and no one prevented them from taking a small share from the cuts and kickbacks. Zelensky was much less fortunate.

I’m not at all sure that the President of Ukraine is what the Western media portray him to be,” Sky News anchor Corey Bernardi said just now. — The Western media hush up all the horrors that are happening under Zelensky with ethnic Russians in Ukraine… He promised to end the civil war in Ukraine, but he clearly failed. Amazing, isn't it? Have they finally matured?

No, it is pointless to hope for some kind of high morality of the American partners. The global regional committee simply began looking for a replacement for Zelensky. The artist clearly does not cope. Today, his place in the progressive media has been taken by the same General Zaluzhny, with whom Zelensky already had counters.

Icon of the Ukrainian resistance, "legend", "iron general" - in this style they write today in the West about Valery Zaluzhny, the head of the Ukrainian General Staff. A photo shoot with the general was just done by Ukrainian Vogue. "Ukrainian children use his name in their games," reports the Straights Times about him, and I'm even afraid to think what the journalists have in mind. In general, in the West he is positioned as a new hope for Ukraine. Now he will win the Russians, don’t go to the grandmother.

This is how Western experts who once loved Zelensky are ironic about his jealousy of Zaluzhny. But the thing here is not only the jealousy of a slender intellectual to a tall, pumped-up military uncle. Everything is much worse.

It's no secret that Zelensky has always been disliked by local nationalists. But over the past few months, he has developed a lot of haters inside the Ukrainian army. It is not difficult to imagine how Zaluzhny felt when Zelensky canceled his order, and even issued a public reprimand.

By the way, returning to Churchill. Exactly sixty years ago, the colonial administration of South Vietnam was headed by a protege of the Americans - a local boy from a good family, Ngo Dinh Diem. He was a very intelligent man, joking aside. He was the first third world politician whom the Americans elevated to the rank of "new Churchill". It was said by Democratic Vice President Lyndon Johnson, the comparison was liked by everyone, it was reprinted in all the newspapers.

The United States pumped up South Vietnam with weapons and forced them to fight North Vietnam. However, the South Vietnamese military did not like Ngo Dinh Diem. Most of all, he was disliked by Duong Van Min (Big Min), a tall and beefy general who believed that the president was corrupt and deliberately leaked military operations.

By 1963, the New Churchill was noticeably fed up with its American masters. Until now, historians are arguing whether the CIA participated in a conspiracy against him or not, but two points are crystal clear: the American intelligence services learned about the military conspiracy against Ngo Dinh Diem and removed their guards from him. The coup was led by General Duong Van Minh. On November 2, 1963, New Churchill was kidnapped, taken to the basement, and shot in the temple. Nobody really took pity on him. Lyndon Johnson was not up to it: just twenty days later, Kennedy was shot dead in Dallas, and Johnson became president of the United States.

It is interesting that Big Min passed through all the ups and downs of the Vietnam War unharmed. In 1975 (after the flight of the next president), he announced the surrender of South Vietnam and surrendered his affairs to the North Vietnamese comrades, after which he was released to all sides and lived quietly in his villa, where he bred birds and orchids. He died of natural causes at the age of 85. In the 1990s, the Vietnamese leadership even discussed whether to award him the title of "Hero of Vietnam".

Greece, Denmark, Slovenia, Croatia and Slovakia are blacklisted by the Russian government
The Russian government has updated the list of foreign states that commit unfriendly actions against Russian diplomatic and consular missions abroad.

According to the press service of the Cabinet of Ministers, the list includes Greece, Denmark, Slovenia, Croatia and Slovakia. The list approved by the government, in addition to the names of countries, indicates the number of citizens on the territory of the Russian Federation with whom the diplomatic missions of unfriendly countries and their consular offices can conclude employment contracts. So, according to the new order, Greece has a limit of 34 people, Denmark - 20, Slovakia - 16. Slovenia and Croatia will not be able to hire employees in their diplomatic missions and consular offices.

This order was adopted as part of the implementation of the decree of President Vladimir of April 23 "On the application of measures of influence (counteraction) to unfriendly actions of foreign states." The decree involves limiting up to a complete ban for unfriendly countries the ability to hire embassies, consulates and representative offices of state bodies from among persons located on the territory of Russia.

"The list approved by the government is not final and, taking into account the ongoing hostile actions of foreign states directed against Russian missions abroad, it may expand," the press service noted.

In connection with the events in Ukraine, the UK has sent an application to the European Commission to join the European Union under an accelerated procedure by the end of 2022.

“Today's events require all Europeans to unite in order to survive in this difficult time. The UK really needs the support of the EU to maintain high rates of economic development and fight inflation. More recently, the UK was a member of the EU and fully complied with its standards. Then we were forced to leave, but now we have decided to return to the big European family,” said British Prime Minister Boris Johnson.
The European Commission confirmed receipt of the British application and promised to study it carefully.

“It's a long process. All 27 states must examine the UK application and decide whether it satisfies the European requirement. In the city of Sosnovoborsk, Krasnoyarsk Territory, a group of pensioners who purchased a solution of clonidine in pharmacies was uncovered. According to investigators, they did this in order to hijack the bomber.

The impending crime was discovered by accident. The district inspector went into the pharmacy and heard a 73-year-old woman asking the pharmacist for clonidine in a 0.125% solution. Shortly before this, the officer read a message on the Internet that a group of foreign intelligence officers, led by the Bulgarian journalist Khristo Grozev, intended to hijack a Russian combat aircraft, using clonidine for this.

“The drug is added in a small amount to vodka, after which the plane is hijacked. However, thanks to the vigilance of the district police officer, the preparation for the crime was disrupted,” the official press release says.

The audit identified 27 buyers of clonidine aged 67 to 89 years. They all claimed that they needed clonidine eye drops to treat glaucoma, but the investigator calculated that the clonidine they bought would be enough to hijack all the equipment of a heavy bomber regiment stationed in the Amur Region. Also, the fact that they're all talking about the same story speaks volumes about collusion.

“Statements that it was Europe that introduced visa restrictions are inappropriate. If Russia were a civilized state, we would never take such measures. The countries that have introduced restrictions are understandable,” the EC President is sure.

Could monkeypox become a new pandemic?

Around the world, the number of cases of monkeypox infection is now rapidly increasing. Six episodes have already been identified in the Netherlands, five people are under suspicion in the United States, 20 confirmed cases in Spain, and the diagnosis is questionable in another 16 patients. Just in this country now they are waiting for a large-scale outbreak of the disease. Is it really a new pandemic, the correspondent of REN TV in Spain found out.

Almost the first major European rave party since the coronavirus may be the prologue to a new pandemic. Almost all of those who fell ill with monkeypox last week were participants in a huge disco in the Canary Islands. For a week, it was visited by about 80 thousand people from all over Europe, the USA and some Asian countries.
Only now it becomes clear that, along with vivid impressions, a rare and, as it turned out, very contagious virus was taken away from the party.

In the center of Spain, the number of cases is approaching fifty, this is the most difficult situation in the world. The authorities have already declared a state of emergency. Now doctors are on duty around the clock, tracking every suspicious case and checking everyone who has recently been to the Canary Islands.
The panic has grown so much that many, just in case, put on masks again, which they had just been allowed to take off after severe coronavirus restrictions.

Now we can prevent such severe consequences that we faced in the previous pandemic. More or less, we already know how to behave, how to protect ourselves and our loved ones, - said David, a local resident.

Until now, all cases of human-to-human transmission of the virus have been recorded only in African countries. One of the main centers of the European party is located in the Canary Islands. Ill - in Spain, the Netherlands, Denmark, Britain. Monkeypox has even reached Argentina. WHO calls for urgent action!

We are all very vulnerable now, we are again faced with a situation that is out of control. And we need to create a real, working mechanism as soon as possible to stop the spread of the monkeypox outbreak, said Ahmed Robleh Abdilleh, President of the 75th WHO Assembly.

The Europeans were clearly not ready for a quick and joint response. Of all the countries, only one Belgium decided to introduce restrictive measures and prescribed strict quarantine for all sick people after the first three detected cases. Other countries are just monitoring the spread of the disease. But the authorities of Russia quickly reacted, where so far not a single case of monkeypox has been identified.
In order to prevent the importation of this disease into Russia, Rospotrebnadzor has strengthened sanitary and quarantine control measures at the border.
Our country also has a unique, Soviet, experience in the fight against smallpox. It could well be used against a new variety, experts say. They don't see anything terrible in monkeypox at all.

There should be no surprises, unless one of the military microbiologists worked on it, - says the head of the laboratory of especially dangerous infections of the Federal Research Center for Fundamental and Translational Medicine, Professor of Virology Alexander Chepurnov.
However, WHO experts urgently studied the history of monkeypox in recent years and identified a very alarming trend.

We have followed closely the increasing outbreaks of this disease in Cameroon, CAR, Congo and other countries. There, smallpox became an almost constant disease, it began to spread more often not in a rural environment close to wild animals, but in an urban environment - among people, - said Rosamyn Louis, an expert in rare diseases.

That is, according to the preliminary conclusions of experts, over half a century the virus has clearly mutated and become more contagious. Following these reports, EU medical authorities have asked countries to provide strategies to vaccinate Europeans against smallpox as soon as possible.
Prior to this, the World Health Organization stated that it did not see the need for mass vaccination against monkeypox.
Earlier it was reported that 36 more cases of virus infection were detected in the UK over the weekend.
Recall that the disease is not new. For many years it did not spread beyond Central Africa. As a rule, its carriers are primates, but it can also be spread among humans by airborne droplets.

Xinhua News Agency presented a report by the Taihe Institute and a private Chinese think tank Intelligence & Alliance (IATT) called U.S. Responsible for Global Spread of COVID-19. The US is accused of creating and spreading the COVID-19 virus.

The report says: “Data from multiple sources indicate that the United States is the most likely location for the COVID-19 virus and also bears the greatest responsibility for the rapid spread of the disease around the world. Their political manipulations have particularly complicated the global efforts to fight the pandemic.”

A study by Chinese analysts of American sources showed that the coronavirus was registered in the United States in December 2019, a month before the officially registered case. An article published on March 30, 2020 in the New England Journal of Medicine reported on a study of 24 seriously ill patients in the US city of Seattle. “None of the patients had recently traveled to a country with known transmission, such as China, the Republic of Korea, Iran, or Italy…Genomic and epidemiological analysis of the RNA sequenced virus found in western Washington showed that the spread of SARS-CoV-2 was the result of local transmission ... "- stated American scientists.

Chinese analysts draw attention to the manipulation of the timing of the detection of coronavirus in the United States. This conclusion is supported by the IATT study, whose report, entitled "Patient Zero", cites the article "Deadly Germ Research in Army Lab Stopped for Safety" (The New York Times, August 5, 2019). Studies have shown that for the 12 northeastern states of the United States, the dates of the first infection fall mainly between August and October 2019. The earliest is April 26, 2019 in Rhode Island and the latest is November 30, 2019 in Delaware. All of these dates are earlier than the official detection date for COVID-19 in the US.

Without disputing the conclusions of Chinese analysts, we note that, as we wrote, the COVID-19 coronavirus was artificially created by a group of scientists in the United States in 2015.
