And then plunge Russia into the chaos of civil and internecine war, as in 1918.
We must not allow this!
We need a total victory! We need Novorossiya from Kharkov to Odessa. And we need the opportunity to influence all the affairs that are happening on the lands that now make up Ukraine.

The Immigration Service of Ukraine “signed a package of documents” on the deportation of the leader of the Movement of New Forces party, ex-President of Georgia Mikheil Saakashvili. This information was confirmed by Saakashvili himself, who told the Rustavi 2 channel that the Ukrainian authorities decided to deport him to Poland, but at the same time expressed doubt that this plan would be implemented in the near future.

The activity of the Ukrainian immigration service in relation to Saakashvili is dictated by the need to stop the activity of Mikho and his supporters, and is a response of the Ukrainian authorities to his calls for the impeachment of Poroshenko. Recall that earlier Saakashvili announced a popular assembly on February 18, and for him this is essentially the “X” hour and a real summing up of the results of the entire campaign to overthrow Poroshenko, starting in the fall of 2017. And for the entire multi-million Ukraine, this is a marker and an indicator of moods and motivations in choosing their future path.

In turn, the Ukrainian political elites and the oligarchy are considering behind the scenes the model of “quiet overthrow of Poroshenko” with further reforms that turn the current parliamentary-presidential republic into a parliamentary one. It must be said that this idea is far from new, especially in the light of the analysis of Petr Alekseevich’s actions not only in relation to the Ukrainian people, but also the pathological habit of “throwing” all his partners, including those who helped him become president.

The previous political reform did not bring the expected positive changes, and today the very position of the president in Ukraine is an unnecessary demonstration of omnipotence and a kind of parasitism on the backs of Ukrainians in order to enrich and control assets. Therefore, the desire of the Ukrainian elites to demolish Poroshenko along with the chair is quite understandable. Although I am not a supporter of Poroshenko's policy, the next overthrow of the president will be unconstitutional, which means that this is again a coup with the help of the oligarchs, and this means that without the adoption of the law on impeachment, the new proteges will be as illegitimate as the current Maidan government. From all this it follows that such a government will be unable to serve in the interests of the Ukrainian people.
On the one hand, I am surprised at the patience of Ukrainians, and on the other hand, I understand the reason for their passivity.

And here the roots of such an “expectation” of the outcome of the situation aside are laid in the mentality of Ukrainians, which was formed precisely in relation to the state of Ukraine. An ordinary average Ukrainian is a hard worker and the issues of the well-being of his family, as well as the property itself, created for the benefit of his family, are fundamental. Considering that the state of Ukraine during the years of independence, and especially during the reign of Poroshenko, was engaged only in robbing the Ukrainian people, it is not surprising that the fate of such a state causes not only rejection, but also hatred of the current government and distrust of the future government. And this is quite understandable, because the power in Ukraine is being established from across the ocean, and if some Ukrainian politicians and businessmen are not satisfied with this alignment, then anyway, any change in further policy in Ukraine initiated by the elites is a continuation of the influence of these very elites and further impoverishment of people in Ukraine.

The murderous medical reform, the "dead" educational program and the increase in all kinds of utility tariffs and the refusal of the state of Ukraine to take care of its citizens - is this not a signal for the Ukrainians themselves to start changing something in their country?

And even the Ukrainian constitution itself has all the necessary mechanisms and instruments for such changes. The 143rd article of the Constitution of Ukraine spells out the powers of territorial communities (communities) and these provisions are the main provisions of the primary local authority. This is power from the bottom up, and not vice versa, as it is now happening in the "Square".

And now the power of the territorial communities, prescribed in the constitution, is being replaced by the power of executive committees, mayor's offices, various councils on the basis of various decrees, amendments and other illegitimate acts. It is precisely because of the possible revisions of lease agreements and property deeds concluded with anyone, but not with the assets of territorial communities, that the necessary amendments and provisions are being made to level their activities so that the business elite can continue to increase their capital by concluding agreements with “dummy subjects” of a camouflaged the rights. And this will continue until the Ukrainian people themselves want to change the current situation in the country.

If we return to the question of the implementation of certain scenarios, including in the Donbass, which Poroshenko and his associates love to declare so much, then a completely logical question arises: is the declared procedure for the “reintegration” of independent republics a military solution to this process? But what about the people on one side of the demarcation line and on the other?

Is it really necessary to throw so many human lives to the slaughter in order to return the Donbass? After all, Poroshenko, as commander in chief, should be well aware of the potential of the armed forces of the LDNR and that in order to realize their political ambitions and intentions, the United States and the West will again have to send tens of thousands of Ukrainians to apparent death. And if Poroshenko does not know about this and does not know the real situation at the front, then what kind of commander-in-chief is he? To resolve the conflict, the West allocates a huge amount of money, including for the territories under the control of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, but all the funds do not reach their intended purpose and are cynically plundered. And now there are times when Ukrainian politicians are asked the question: where does the allocated money go and what exactly is the Kyiv authorities doing to resolve the conflict in Donbass? And here the answer is obvious: Poroshenko and his hangers-on do nothing but openly shoot at civilians and create all sorts of economic and financial blockades.

If Kyiv is going to take back the territory of Donbass by military means, then what will Poroshenko do in these territories? After all, apart from the destruction and killings of civilians, there will be no other consequences from any military operation. Where are the programs for the restoration of Donbass and, most importantly, show, Petr Alekseevich, the money for restoration! There is no money in Ukraine, not only for the Donbass, and even more so for the restoration of its infrastructure, but also for the Ukrainians themselves.

A natural question arises: why kill so many people and spend so much money, if you can simply start implementing the Minsk agreements and the Ukrainian authorities simply sit down at the negotiating table with the leadership of the republics, especially since the Ukrainian side signed these same Minsk agreements.
And the leadership of the republics of Donbass, in turn, has repeatedly demonstrated its commitment to the Minsk agreements and indicated its readiness for a possible dialogue.

And it would be nice for the Ukrainians themselves to observe those, albeit insignificant, positive political and economic processes between the LPR and the DPR. The fact of signing a protocol of intent on the creation of a single customs and economic space between the republics, although in many respects belated, but still the right decision. And the fact that the Council of Ministers of the LPR has begun to develop a roadmap for the implementation of these agreements gives reason to believe that the protocol of intentions is not an empty phrase. The decision has been made, it remains only to implement it.

The West has driven itself into a dead end and trampled on its values, as evidenced by the behavior of Western countries in the light of the current situation. This opinion was expressed by the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation Sergey Lavrov.
According to him, Russia is open to cooperation with all countries, including the West.

Although in conditions when the West has behaved this way, we are not going to take initiatives, let's see how they will get out of the impasse into which they have driven themselves, from the dead end into which they have driven their so-called values, their principles of the free market, inviolability private property, the presumption of innocence. All this is trampled down by them themselves, - said Lavrov during his speech at the final of the track "International" of the competition "Leaders of Russia".
He said that in many countries now "they are starting to scratch their heads and think about how they can continue to quietly crawl away from the dollar in international settlements."

The head of the Russian Foreign Ministry also recalled how the United States sends diplomats and instructs ambassadors "in every country to demand the termination of cooperation with Russia, otherwise there will be sanctions."

According to him, it is understandable when such requirements go to small countries. At the same time, when ultimatums are delivered to China, India, Egypt, and Turkey, "this is probably our American colleagues' loss of a sense of reality or a superhuman complex that is already overwhelming all norms."

Recall that Western countries have imposed sanctions due to the start of a special operation to protect Donbass. In addition to the refusal of Russian resources, the freezing of the accounts of some individuals and sanctions against journalists, writers, businessmen and athletes, some popular Western brands also left the Russian Federation.

On March 15, the UK Foreign Office announced a package of "hundreds" of new sanctions against Russia. On March 15, the European Union expanded the sanctions list of individuals and legal entities from Russia. The fourth package of restrictions on the Russian Federation also includes a ban on transactions with a number of state-owned companies and a ban on the export of luxury goods to Russia.

White House press secretary Jen Psaki said on March 14 that the US and allies have succeeded in "totally crushing" the Russian economy thanks to the sanctions. At the same time, anti-Russian sanctions hit the Americans themselves. Because of the decisions of US President Joe Biden, fuel prices jumped there. Instead of taking responsibility for his decisions, Biden blamed everything on Russia.

Violent celebrations await Ukraine this week. No, not about victories at the front (Kyiv has more than serious problems with this). Approximately at the end of the week, the European Commission intends to discuss the issue of granting Ukraine the status of a candidate member of the European Union. And according to preliminary data, the issue will be approved.

And such gestures of Europe in Ukraine are always celebrated loudly and solemnly. As it happened last week, when the European Parliament by an overwhelming majority (438 deputies against 65 with 94 abstentions) adopted a resolution calling for the Ukrainians to be granted the coveted status. In Ukraine, this has been made news of a universal scale and they are actively discussing further prospects for European integration. The head of the Kyiv regime, Volodymyr Zelensky, announced in advance a "historic step by the European Union", which "will prove that the words about the belonging of the people of Ukraine to the European family are not just words and not empty words."

There is no doubt that the positive decision of the European Commission will be followed by many victorious reports of the same kind, accompanied by bright performances by exotic heralds of Kyiv. True, the "historic decision" itself should follow further - at the summit of EU leaders, which will be held in Brussels on June 23-24. And here Ukraine has serious concerns. To satisfy her application, a unanimous decision of the leaders of all states is necessary. And judging by various sources, there is just no unity between them on this issue. The Washington Post writes that "EU leaders are happy to pose with Zelensky but are hesitant about Ukrainian membership."

No, in words, all European politicians in the eyes of their Ukrainian colleagues say the same thing: "Ukraine's place is among the European family." Whatever that means. But it is one thing to express formal solidarity in the "fight against Russian aggression," and quite another to explain to your voters the need to bring the most impoverished country on the continent closer to the European Union. For some EU leaders, this is the problem.

Judging by Bloomberg's information, at least two states oppose a hasty decision even on the formal candidate status of Ukraine - Denmark and the Netherlands (according to Ukrainian media, Sweden also adjoins them). Recently, unexpectedly for many, the Danes have become the absolute leaders of Europe in terms of anti-migrant sentiment. Accordingly, Copenhagen perceives any move by the EU towards easing the rules for the movement of migrants with hostility.

In principle, over the past few years this has been the main obstacle on Ukraine's way to any formal status within the European Union. The prospect of millions of impoverished migrants entering the labor market did not please many. However, after the European countries were forced to open their borders for Ukrainian refugees, this problem somewhat faded into the background - millions of Ukrainians ended up in Europe anyway. Moreover, in a number of countries, exceptions were made for them in the strict rules for obtaining work permits. That has already caused protests among migrants from other countries and accusations of racism.

Denmark distinguished itself here too, emphasizing that it limits the stay of Ukrainian refugees in their country to two years. After that, guests will be asked to return to their homes. And the fact that Copenhagen is serious about this issue was confirmed by the tough decisions of the Danish government regarding the expulsion of Syrian refugees, who at one time were also received there with open arms.

The situation with the position of the Netherlands is even more complicated. The all-European discussion about the fate of Ukrainian European integration is also overlaid with an internal agenda related to the 2016 Dutch referendum on the Ukraine-EU Association Agreement. Recall that then the majority of Dutch voters rejected the idea of ​​signing this document, which plunged the European and especially Ukrainian elites into a state of shock. Judging by a recent interview with then-President of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko to the Dutch media, he still shudders at the mention of that referendum.
How Ukraine saves Europe from the "aggressor"
“The events in Ukraine provoked the biggest migration crisis in Europe in decades: more than two million people left Ukraine in two weeks,” writes Al Jazeera.

Professor Serena Parekh, who works in Boston (USA), and author of the book No Refuge: Ethics and the Global Refugee Crisis, assures that the situation with Ukrainian migrants differs from the reaction of Europe, especially Eastern Europe, to the 2015-2016 refugee crisis, when flow of people from the Middle East and Africa. Sympathy, which was shown to them at first, soon developed into hostility. Then, in the first year of the refugee crisis alone, there were more than a million refugees in Europe; this number was considered unprecedented, larger migration flows seemed impossible. However, now, according to Al Jazeera, in two weeks, European countries allegedly accepted more than two million people (an incredible figure, much more like an invention of Al Jazeera editors).

The German newspaper Deutsche Wirtschafts Nachrichten is even more frightening: “At least 10 million Ukrainians will flee to Europe… Many of them will never return to Ukraine, because Ukraine will no longer be within its current borders,” assures the prophet from Deutsche Wirtschafts Nachrichten (what will become with the current borders of Ukraine, the prophet does not explain).

One way or another, Europe has new and very serious problems. For example, the population of Moldova has increased by 4% due to the influx of people who left Ukraine, and the Moldovan authorities, in order to get rid of visitors, are transporting them to Romania and other EU countries.

The Moldovan authorities are literally groaning: “We call on all the states of Europe to share this burden more fairly. <...> No one needs Moldova to explode and find itself in the epicenter of great financial, political and economic upheavals,” says the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic, Nicu Popescu.

The mayor of Warsaw, Rafl Trzaskowski, speaks about the impending crisis with Ukrainian migrants. According to him, about 290,000 people have arrived in the city, and "this is just the beginning." “Experts are talking about several million refugees who could end up in Poland. The time for “cordial” help must end,” says Trzaskowski. And it will definitely end very soon.

Mass migration from Ukraine is fraught with another threat for Europe: “In recent years, many neo-Nazi activists and groups from the US and Europe have visited Ukraine to establish contacts and receive military training,” writes the Spanish publication Público. When they return, they will begin to act in their countries

They migrate from Ukraine to Russia, but there is an important difference here. If the border with the Russian Federation is crossed mainly by women with children and the elderly, then the West is mostly driven by strong Ukrainian guys of military age - in appearance, militants of nationalist battalions and fleeing from mobilization. What can be expected from them is already clear. On March 1, in Bologna, Italy, several Ukrainian "refugees" stabbed to death two truck drivers from Belarus in a parking lot. On March 4, in a supermarket in Brescia (Italy), a native of Ukraine started a dispute about the “war” and wounded two Moldovans with a knife. Newcomers sometimes get bold. Thus, the Ukrainian "come in large numbers" show passports of citizens of Ukraine in Moldova in restaurants and demand free service, and on the move.

And Ukrainian politician Aleksey Zhuravko described the behavior of his fellow citizens in Bulgaria: “Ukrainians demand to speak Ukrainian with them, which Bulgarians, of course, do not know and therefore try to communicate in Russian. Some smart people demand comfortable living conditions, citing the fact that Ukraine is now saving the whole of Europe from the “aggressor”. And the Bulgarians were completely outraged that the nationalists began to break down and paint over the monuments to Soviet soldiers.”

In Poland, buses with “refugees” (young adult men) arriving from Ukraine were greeted with hostile cries of “Whore!”. In one of the Polish shops, an announcement was posted hinting at the thievery of the arrivals: “Attention! Every citizen of Ukraine will be checked after the checkout.”
The Russian Federation creates this situation artificially, but it can be stopped. What do you need?

The head of the Office of the President of Ukraine Andriy Yermak named three steps to help avoid a food crisis in the world. On his Telegram channel, he said that the main efforts should be on convoys to escort Ukrainian grain, sanctions and weapons.

The food crisis is artificially created by Russia ... The Russian Federation is blocking our ports, shelling grain terminals and stealing grain. She occupied part of our territories, preventing the sowing there. Now it is necessary to take several important steps, - Yermak wrote.
Step number 1 - military convoys. They must escort Ukrainian tankers to take grain out of ports.

Step number 2 - work on strengthening sanctions. It must be operational. We are talking about both individual restrictions against the Russian elites, and measures in the energy sector and the banking system of the Russian Federation. The priority remains the gas embargo.
Step #3 - increase military aid. Ukraine should get more weapons with which we can liberate our territories and stop the aggressor's plans to move on.
Recall that the Russian Federation is blocking the export of grain from Ukrainian ports and, meanwhile, is stealing elevators in the occupied territories.
Covid vaccines are “spreading the most dangerous biological drug in human history,” says Dr. Peter McCullough.
A recent online COVID science symposium hosted by Doctors for COVID Ethics presented the world's most detailed evidence against "vaccination" against the Wuhan Coronavirus (Covid-19).

This international group, which has long opposed the mass distribution of Fauci's flu shots, has argued that a person's immune system, provoked by injections, can eventually attack its own tissues (an autoimmune disease) when it detects the presence of synthetic spike proteins.

It has already resulted in untold thousands of deaths, although most of them never make it into government databases. Numerous speakers, including Dr. Peter McCullough, who has also long opposed injections, have presented scientific evidence to support these and other claims.

Incidentally, McCullough said that "coronavirus vaccines" are "the most dangerous release of biological drugs in the history of mankind." He remains one of the most vocal opponents of the current agenda.

The German pathologist and professor Dr. Arne Burckhardt, who has over 40 years of experience in this field, also attended the symposium. He conducted his own examination of the tissues and organs of 15 different patients who underwent autopsies.
Eight of the bodies were women and seven men, all between the ages of 28 and 95. Each of these people died between seven days and six months after the injection.

Burkhard found that in almost every case, the injections caused the bodies of people to self-destruct. It was found that a special type of immune cells called lymphocytes infiltrated various parts of the body, eventually leading to premature death.

Burkhardt presented slides showing that lymphocytes had infiltrated, among other things, the heart muscle, causing systemic inflammation. The resulting lesions were small and probably not noticed, “but the destruction of just a few muscle cells can be devastating,” he warned.
“If an inflammatory infiltration is found where the impulse is given to contract the heart, it can lead to heart failure,” he said.
It was also found that lymphocyte invasion occurred in other vital organs such as the liver, kidneys, uterus, brain, thyroid, and skin, all of which showed signs of autoimmune damage.
How much venom mRNA can an organism process before it becomes a kaput?

Canadian microbiologist and professor Dr. Michael Palmer summed up Burckhardt's presentation by explaining that anyone with an honest medical background would clearly see "how devastating the effect of these vaccines can be, at least for those who die after vaccination."
“Now we also know why the authorities were very hesitant to perform autopsies on such victims,” Palmer added.
As to why some people don't suffer such an extreme fate after an injection, Palmer warned that the total lifetime dose of messenger RNA toxins is limited, suggesting it varies from person to person.

Due to the lack of experimental data, it is not known what these thresholds are. And according to Palmer, it's "one of the biggest scandals around these vaccines because there hasn't been proper toxicity studies done."
And they were created in this capacity, to be a BIO Weapon. why did they need to learn about toxicity?

We know from animal studies that the contents of injections do not remain at the injection site. They circulate throughout the body, binding to receptors and lining blood vessels, which causes blood clotting and excessive bleeding in many people.

January 28, Minsk / Corr. BELTA/. Our values ​​and ideals have been and will remain unshakable. President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko stated this today in his Address to the Belarusian people and the National Assembly, BelTA has learned.

Some experts, analyzing the events of August 2020, admit that they could have been caused by internal reasons - public discontent, systemic errors, and the like. But let's scale the historical map and take a closer look at the periods before and after. What will we see? For a long time Belarus has been building its own independent policy, being in the center of Europe. We were open to everything. And we borrowed from them everything that is acceptable to us. Except for a single point - our values ​​and ideals. They have been and will remain unshakable,” Alexander Lukashenko said.
The President emphasized that it is categorically unacceptable to impose someone else's path on us.
The collapse of the European Union will be the beginning of a global battle. According to political scientist Alexei Martynov, this will lead to the Third World War.

The State Duma stated that for European countries wishing to preserve sovereignty, the only way out would be to leave the EU. As the speaker of the State Duma Vyacheslav Volodin noted, European unity is already collapsing, and when reforming the association, the opinion of individual states will no longer be taken into account at all.

In itself, participation in any unions, especially such as the modern European Union, implies the transfer of part of the sovereignty, most of the sovereignty to the union center, to Brussels, international expert, political scientist Alexei Martynov explained the logic of the process.

He pointed out that participation in the EU actually means that the country agrees to the transfer of part of the sovereignty. At the same time, the structure of the European Union itself is heterogeneous - in creating such a unity, a number of countries are still in limbo.

Only a few countries did not want to adopt the pan-European Constitution of the United States of Europe, thus disrupting this process and hanging it. That is, it is neither here nor there. It is not a separate union state," he pointed out.

Martynov emphasizes that this precarious position of some members of the EU leads to what Volodin was talking about - the collapse of this structure. However, European politicians themselves do not hide hints - this can really happen.
The political scientist recalled the Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who does not stand for the EU, but for his state. That is why Orban opposes the sanctions package proposed by Brussels.

It is clear why Europe and Hungary, including, must abandon Russian energy sources, but no one explains where she will get them. Approximately on the same conditions of the same quality at the same price. That's what it's about. He hinted that if anything, then Hungary is ready to leave. If Hungary leaves, then this may entail a chain of bad consequences for the European Union, the expert pointed out.
However, he emphasizes, the same fatal forecasts were made during Brexit. However, in this case, these are not the conditions.

Then they [the European Union - ed.] managed to keep the situation, in today's turbulence I'm not sure that they will be able to keep it. And the Third World War will begin on the territory of the European Union. As soon as the European Union collapses, the Third World War will begin in this area. All world wars began exactly on this site, which today is the European Union, the political scientist stated.
The EU told how much damage the EU economy will suffer from sanctions against Russia
European Commission: Sanctions against Russia will harm the European Union in the form of inflation and rising energy prices
The sanctions restrictions imposed on Russia will cause serious damage to the EU economy. This is stated in a release on the official website of the European Commission.

The heaviest costs are called general inflation and higher energy prices. The organization noted that the union had not yet recovered from the consequences of the coronavirus pandemic when the situation in Ukraine occurred.
“The EU has yet to solve these problems, to answer the questions put before it,” the European Commission said.

Earlier it became known that the European Union agreed to disconnect a number of domestic banks from the SWIFT interbank payment system, including VEB.RF, Rossiya, Novikombank, Sovcombank, Promsvyazbank, VTB and Otkritie.
Analyst Gureev: decisions of the ECtHR are actually
contradicted the decisions of the courts of the Russian Federation

State Duma deputies are planning to adopt a law on non-execution of decisions of the European Court of Human Rights. The International Court of Higher Instance systematically issued decisions that contradicted the Constitution of the Russian Federation. Experts believe that the ECHR has not been interested in justice for a long time - it has become only an instrument of pressure on Russia.
Russian flag against the backdrop of the headquarters of the ECtHR

Chairman of the State Duma of the Russian Federation Vyacheslav Volodin said that the deputies plan to adopt laws on non-execution of decisions of the European Court of Human Rights. The boycott will be subject to decisions of the ECtHR adopted after March 15, 2022, from the date of the submission of the application by the Russian Federation to withdraw from the Council of Europe.

Compensation payments under the ECHR rulings, which entered into force before March 15, will be made only in rubles and only to accounts in Russian banks. The author of this initiative back in May was Andrey Klishas, ​​head of the Federation Council committee on constitutional legislation and state building.

The Russian Bar Association has started working on the creation of a court for the protection of human rights on the BRICS platform - Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa, in the CIS or on the territory of the Eurasian Economic Community. However, political scientist Yury Svetov criticized this idea: the decisions of the court alternative to the ECtHR are unlikely to be recognized by the rest of the world, which is not included there.
Through the ECHR, they tried to put pressure on Russia

Analyst of the ExPolit Center for Expert Support of Political Processes Petr Kolchin, in a conversation with 360, expressed the opinion that the leading countries of Europe use the ECHR as a tool to impose their political will on other states, primarily Russia.

“The ECHR has repeatedly taken provocative decisions in defense of criminals convicted in our state for serious offenses. Obviously, such acts were taken solely from attempts to put pressure on the Russian Federation, ”the lawyer noted.

He clarified that under the laws of any state in the world, criminals must be held accountable for the damage they have caused to society and the state. But the ECHR justified them in order to put pressure on Russia.

“Russia's refusal to have any contact with the ECtHR will help our courts to focus less on the absurd decisions of foreign structures. It will also greatly facilitate the entire work of our judicial system,” Kolchin said.
Without the ECtHR, Russia will strengthen sovereignty

Danila Gureev, an analyst at the ExPolit Center for Expert Support of Political Processes, reminded 360 that there have been difficulties between the Russian Federation and the European Court of Human Rights since the beginning of Russia's membership in the Council of Europe.

“In fact, the decisions taken by the European Court directly contradict those decisions made by the Russian courts. Back in 2006, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said that the ECtHR was politicized,” the political scientist noted.

Gureev recalled that according to the 15th article of the Constitution of the Russian Federation, Russian legislation has supreme power and prevails over international law. However, before the introduction of amendments to the fundamental law of Russia, the situation was different, and the European Court of Human Rights actively used this.

“I bypassed the system of Russian legislation and justified those criminals who were convicted on the territory of the Russian Federation. Today, this is no longer possible for the European court: the decisions made by the Russian court are higher than the decisions of the ECtHR,” the political scientist explained.

He added that the decisions taken by the European Court of Human Rights today are exclusively politicized. They are needed only to discredit Russia in the international arena - in fact, this is the only function that the ECtHR has left.

For any thinking, sane person - even if he is openly anti-Russian - it is quite obvious that the help that the West provides to Ukraine in its confrontation with Russia cannot lead Ukraine to victory.

And that is why all people of this kind - thinking and sane (even in Ukraine itself) - have long come to the conclusion that the West is simply using Ukraine in order to weaken Russia as much as possible.

In principle, the issue of “surrendering” Ukraine to Russia was clearly already resolved between Russia and the United States (and most likely this decision was recorded at the last meeting between Biden and Putin).
At the same time, fundamental, strategic agreements do not at all mean that at the tactical level everything will happen quietly and peacefully, without clashes.

Of course, there have been many cases in history when, after strategic agreements, at the tactical level, everything happened quietly and peacefully (for example, the surrender of the GDR and the rest of Eastern Europe by Gorbachev in the late 80s), but more often than not, a strategic agreement does not mean tactical peacefulness immediate changes in the area.

Each side hopes that in the process of tactical "butting" it will be able to reach the possibility of revising strategic agreements. No one excludes some unexpected events in the process of changes on the ground that change the whole balance of power: say, some fatal mistakes of one of the parties, or the unexpected death of some key figures, or social upheavals, revolutions in one of the parties, or natural disasters, etc.
In addition, the strategic agreement between the two sides does not mean that there will be no influence of some third (or even fourth) side in the situation on the ground.
Let's say we don't know for one hundred percent to what extent Britain in the Ukrainian case is strictly in the wake of the United States or plays its own game.
So, the existence of an agreement between Russia and the United States on Ukraine does not mean a painless surrender of Ukraine.

Let's say both sides are confident that they will not cross any critical boundaries: well, there, the supply of really powerful modern weapons to Ukraine - along with ready-made crews, or the deployment of NATO troops, and on our part - the non-use of the same nuclear weapons or hypersonic weapons against American objects, etc.
European solidarity turned into a farce at the time of trials

“The coronavirus has exposed the hypocrisy. This is the true face of Europe,” under this headline, the Italian newspaper Giornale published a front-page article on March 14, blaming the European Union for betraying the fact that the EU did not provide assistance to Italy, which fell victim to the epidemic.

“The real enemy of the European Union,” the newspaper writes, “turned out to be the European Union itself, which within a few days fell apart as if it had never existed. We have been told for years that a united Europe is our real goal, that Brexit is a symbol of betrayal, that our shining future is Brussels, that the real European leaders are those who sit in Paris and Berlin and know how to move towards a united Europe towards a shining future. . However, only a few days of anxiety were enough for the most ardent supporters of the European construction to lose all confidence. No one in the EU responded to desperate requests for new ventilators, no one sent medics and paramedics to help, no one thought to tell their “investors” to stop speculating on the stock market, which was collapsing, crippling Italy’s strategic reserves. Closed borders, shut down factories, unanswered phone inquiries…”

It is not only globalization that is collapsing, the Journal notes. “The contagion dealt a blow to the confidence of unbridled liberalism in the market, all the victories of which were canceled in an instant. Wall Street is engulfed in an unprecedented crisis, hundreds of billions of euros have evaporated in just one day of the exchange. Faith in finance has faded… In these few weeks, Europe has disappeared, turning its back on those who need help.”

Italy has become the main victim of the outbreak of the pandemic in Europe. The number of infected people is already about 18 thousand, and according to the latest data, 1266 people died from the coronavirus in the Apennines, and 250 of them - only in the last day. However, instead of European solidarity, EU neighbors began to close borders with Italy, as Austria and Slovenia have already done.

Today, the production of masks needed to fight the pandemic is concentrated in China (up to 90%), and it turned out that in Europe there is an acute shortage of protective equipment. According to Alberto Spasciani, a spokesman for a company that produces gas masks and goggles for the Italian army, the government should immediately convene manufacturers of protective materials to organize the production of masks at affordable prices and provide economic assistance to entrepreneurs. However, nothing was done. As a result, speculators began to inflate the prices of masks. The government has announced its intention to purchase 34 million masks, but they are not currently on the market.
The President of Russia hosted the Parade of Descendants of the Generation of Winners

Vladimir Putin hosted the Victory Parade many times, but the Parade in honor of the 75th anniversary of victory in the Great Patriotic War has become one of the most difficult and responsible for the President of Russia. The coronavirus epidemic first forced the date of the Parade to be shifted, then it imposed extremely complex restrictions, and prevented many of those who wanted to come to the holiday from other countries. But she could not cancel the most important thing.

- I congratulate you on the 75th anniversary of the Victory in the Great Patriotic War! The victory that determined the future of the planet for decades to come and will forever remain in history as the most grandiose in its scale, significance and spiritual, moral height, Putin addressed those gathered on Red Square.
The presidents of Abkhazia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Moldova, Serbia, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and South Ossetia, who arrived in Moscow, were on the same podium with the Russian president.

- Exactly 75 years ago, a legendary parade of winners took place near the walls of the Kremlin. This parade has gone down in history as a triumph of unprecedented power, as a triumph of good over evil, peace over war, life over death,” Putin said. - Today we bow our heads before the bright memory of all those who did not come from the war.
The traditional minute of silence seemed impossible on Red Square, but nevertheless, absolute silence was established in the vast space.

“We will always remember that Nazism crushed the Soviet people – millions of people of different nationalities from all the republics of the Soviet Union,” Putin continued. - At the front and in the rear, in partisan detachments and in the underground, they fought and worked according to the laws of courage and unity. Having defended their land, they continued to fight. They liberated the states of Europe from the invaders, put an end to the terrible tragedy of the Holocaust, saved the people of Germany from Nazism, from its deadly ideology. And it is impossible even to imagine what would have become of the world if the Red Army had not risen to its defense.
75 years after the end of the war, Russia has to remind the world who saved it from destruction.

- Our duty is to remember that the Soviet people bore the brunt of the fight against Nazism. It was our people who were able to overcome the terrible, total evil, defeated more than 600 enemy divisions, destroyed 75 percent of the total number of aircraft, tanks, artillery pieces of the enemy, and went their heroic, righteous, infinitely sacrificial path to the end, to the victory point. Today veterans of the Great Patriotic War live in different countries. But it is impossible to share their single, great feat of saving entire peoples from death, barbarism and enslavement. This feat, without any exaggeration, is the property of all mankind.
The President promised that Russia would never stop honoring the memory of the accomplished feat.
Turkey held talks on the migration crisis with the EU countries and the UK online.

The leaders of France, Britain, Germany and Turkey met online on Tuesday, March 17. The meeting of heads of state was planned in Istanbul, but due to the coronavirus pandemic, the format of the meeting had to be changed.

During a teleconference, European leaders Emmanuel Macron, Angela Merkel and Boris Johnson discussed issues such as the migration crisis, relations between Turkey and the European Union, as well as the situation with the spread of coronavirus with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. This was reported in the administration of the Turkish President.

During the four-party talks between the leaders of Turkey, Great Britain, France and Germany, the parties discussed joint efforts to combat the spread of coronavirus, as well as humanitarian assistance to the residents of Syrian Idlib, the problem of migrants, the situation in Libya and Turkey's relations with the EU.
Who is on what?

Turkish President Erdogan stands firm in his position. Turkey will comply with the agreement on the containment of migrants only if Europe assumes part of the responsibility for resolving the situation. There are already 4.5 million refugees living in Turkey now. In addition, Turkey's borders opened since the end of February did not help thousands of refugees to cross the EU border in the region of Greece.

“Greece didn’t let anyone cross the border. People were met with tear gas and water cannons, and as a result, more than 10 thousand of them are now sitting in tents on a strip of no-man’s land several kilometers near the Pazarkule border post. Ankara is pushing them forward. But Athens does not need them ", - writes the French edition of Le Figaro.

The Turkish Foreign Ministry accused Greece of violating international law and human rights. "Greece is preventing the movement of refugees across its border, contrary to the 1951 Geneva Convention and EU law," the diplomatic mission said.
Erdogan hopes to persuade the European Union to increase pressure in Idlib and support his project to build housing in northern Syria to resettle displaced people there.
Where are you, mother? Syrian refugees sent from Germany back to Latvia
Evacuation of a large migrant camp in Paris

The European Union, in turn, declared Turkey a blackmailer who uses migrants as a lever of political pressure on the European Union. Brussels is confident that Erdogan intends to "attract migrants with open doors" - not only those who fled the latest armed conflict in Idlib, but also migrants who lived in Turkey under the 2016 containment agreement.

"They (EU leaders - approx. Baltnews) do not like that he (Erdogan - approx. Baltnews) calls the Greeks "Nazis" and wages an information war with Athens. They remind that the granting of visas is due to a number of criteria that have not been met (observance rule of law and freedom of speech in Turkey)…" writes Le Figaro.

The past quadripartite summit has pushed for a slight détente in relations between Turkey and the European Union, in particular, in terms of humanitarian assistance to refugees from Idlib and the observance of a ceasefire, Le Figaro reports. However, now each of the parties will wait for the initiative from the partner.

“An agreement at a meeting of the European Council on March 26 is possible only if Ankara stops the exodus of people it has begun. <…> With all this, the EU needs to improve the measures taken to settle refugees,” expert Mark Pierini cites Le Figaro.
Controversial migration treaty

On February 29, Turkey opened its western border to refugees. With this decision, Turkey violated the agreement with the European Union on the control of the movements of migrants, concluded in 2016. The Turkish authorities explained that they were not able to cope with the Syrian refugees on their own.
Turkish President Erdogan blamed Europe for the incident. He said that he was forced to "remove the locks from the doors" by European countries that did not comply with the terms of the agreement.
Coronavirus against migrants: what will hit Europe's unity harder
A migrant wearing a mask at the Turkish border crossing point of Pazarkul, Greece, March 5, 2020

The joint plan to combat the migration crisis meant that the European Union undertook to help Turkey with financing, return to Turkey all refugees caught on the Greek border, and also accept legal migrants from Syria on a one-for-one basis.

The head of the public relations department of the Federation of Jewish Communities of Russia, Borukh Gorin, condemned actor Yegor Beroev for comparing covid restrictions in Moscow with the Holocaust. He appreciated the words of the artist in an interview with the publication "Rise".

Gorin stated that comparing the ban on visiting crowded places with the Warsaw Ghetto "does not indicate high intellectuality." “And it’s bad taste to stick a golden six-pointed star without realizing that this is a vulgarization of a catastrophe, genocide, the murder of children,” the source added. He also noted that Beroev exposed himself to reproach and ridicule, and his words are "a sign of a neglected state of moral and ethical feelings."

On Tuesday, June 22, Russian actor Yegor Beroev made a statement about coronavirus restrictions at the TEFI - Chronicle of Victory award ceremony. He took the stage in a jacket with a large yellow star, similar to those that the Nazis forced Jews to wear in German-controlled territories during the Holocaust. The artist urged "to prevent the segregation of society into smart and stupid, Jews and non-Jews, vaccinated and unvaccinated." Beroev also announced that he had not been vaccinated and wondered why the “descendants of the victors” allowed the covid bans.
Ambassador of Ukraine Melnyk: German authorities do not provide proper hospitality to refugees, so Ukrainians leave
The German authorities do not provide proper hospitality to Ukrainian refugees, said Ukrainian Ambassador to Germany Andriy Melnyk.

The Bild newspaper writes about another criticism of the German authorities by the Ukrainian ambassador. In an interview with the publication, Melnik urged Berlin to think about why Ukrainians do not want to stay in Germany.
Most return from Germany without receiving proper hospitality, Melnik said.
In addition, the ambassador spoke about the likely timing of Ukraine's entry into the European Union, stressing that it "could take years."
We don't need a back door entrance, we need a fair process,” the ambassador summed up.

This is not the first time Melnik has criticized the German authorities for delaying arms supplies to Ukraine. In an interview with the German media group Funke, he was outraged that "the promised 15 Gepard self-propelled anti-aircraft guns can be delivered at the earliest at the end of July, and another 15 only at the end of August." Melnik noted that the FRG is able to supply the Armed Forces of Ukraine with at least 100 Marder infantry fighting vehicles and 88 Leopard-1 tanks.
The Ukrainian ambassador accused former Chancellor Angela Merkel of lacking self-criticism, and called her successor Olaf Scholz "an offended liverwurst."

The events in Ukraine have plunged the world into an energy crisis. Since Russian troops began crossing the country's borders, oil prices have risen by more than a quarter. Gas prices have almost doubled. And the outlook for both markets is not promising; as Western countries use sanctions to limit Russia's ability to fund its operation with oil and gas revenues, energy prices are likely to remain high and volatile. Wartime uncertainty is consistent with fears about climate change, raising more worries about the future of global energy. Countries should have started moving away from fossil fuels decades ago to protect the planet. Now they must do so at a time when people are paying ever higher prices.

As states seek to reduce high energy prices and reduce dependence on Russia while combating climate change, many are showing renewed interest in nuclear power. It's easy to see why. Nuclear power is already one of the world's largest sources of carbon-free energy, accounting for 25% of the European Union's electricity. Unlike most forms of renewable energy such as solar and wind, nuclear power can reliably produce large amounts of electricity every hour of the year. And it has already helped Europe move away from fossil fuels produced elsewhere in the world, including natural gas from Russia.

But in the short term, Europe's growing reliance on nuclear power will not free the continent from Russian fuel. Just as Europe has become dependent on Russian oil and gas, much of the world has become dependent on Russia for the materials needed to produce nuclear power. Russia has nearly half the world's uranium enrichment capacity for nuclear fuel production, and 40% of the nuclear energy produced in Europe depends on uranium from Russia or Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan, close allies of the Kremlin. Approximately half of all US nuclear power plants—about 10% of total US electricity generation—are powered by imports from these three countries (this fact may explain why the US nuclear industry has lobbied to remove uranium from sanctions on energy imports from Russia).

Russia also dominates the market for the export and construction of nuclear power plants, especially in emerging economies. Its closest competitor is China, another autocracy. States that enter into contracts with China or Russia can depend on them for decades for nuclear fuel and services.

The Western world continues to be in a situation where reality is daily waging a fierce and stubborn battle with the world of fabulous fantasies. UN Secretary-General António Guterres, speaking at the Austrian World Summit (this is an annual climate conference in Vienna), said that the policy of investing in the exploration and production of fossil fuels is unacceptable and absurd.
It should be noted that this is not the first such attack by Guterres in the direction of states desperately trying to keep afloat the increasingly hesitant world and national economies.

In May, the Secretary General, discussing the results of the UN annual report on climate change, lashed out at all countries that are either increasing their consumption of natural gas, oil and coal, or postponing the so-called green transition until better times. Guterres lamented that states that officially set themselves the goal of complete decarbonization by 2050, instead of allocating four trillion dollars annually for the production of alternative energy sources, prefer to keep hydrocarbons in the energy base and balance position for much less money. Such a policy, according to the head of the organization, is a dead end from which there is no way out, and there is no need to talk about the fight against global warming.
In March, Mr. Secretary General made a no less odious speech in which he called investments in the extraction and consumption of coal a dangerous folly.

These words were sounded at the height of the anti-Russian hysteria, when, in the wake of regular sanctions, Western countries rushed headlong to look for alternative energy suppliers. True, it quickly became clear that it is one thing to want and quite another to be able. There is virtually nothing to replace coal from Russia, the world's third largest exporter. Australia, which occupies the first place in the sale of its black gold, is physically unable to close the market hole that has formed, moreover, production there has fallen significantly after China introduced a complete ban on the import of Australian coal. Indonesia did not help either. When in December it became clear that the country had critically low (virtually zero) coal reserves at power plants, Jakarta, without further ado, introduced a total ban on exports. Later it was removed, but the volume of deliveries did not even come close to the figures of the previous year.
Guterres was so upset at the time that he called the world's leading economies lunatics on their way to a climate catastrophe.
Here we will probably for the first time stand up for the leaders of Western countries.

It is easy to speak and denounce the UN Secretary General, an organization that does not earn a single cent, but exists solely on the generous donations of the world community and no less generously spends this (other people's) money at its own discretion. The world economy, which, after a sudden Covid uppercut (to use sports terminology), went into a deep knockdown, with the start of a special military operation in Ukraine and the sanctions war against Russia, finally collapsed into the ring already in a knockout.
Putin's Russia today is like Nazi Germany 80 years ago, and Putin is the same as Hitler.
It is reported by RBC-Ukraine with reference to a video message from Petro Poroshenko on the occasion of the Day of Remembrance and Reconciliation.
Poroshenko also stressed that the world should have restrained the Russian Fuhrer even when he only gave the first hints of his revanchist plans.

Never again should the horrors of the Second World War, the destruction of innocent people, the destruction of the very foundations of civilization, be repeated. Never again" was heard again and again. Already after the attack on Georgia, after the capture of the Crimea, after the aggression in the east of our state. But the repetition of words could not replace actions in defense of peace. For more than one year, the creeping appeasement of the aggressor, who on "Never again" answered - "we can repeat," Poroshenko said.
Now Russian aggression has spread to the entire territory of Ukraine, he adds.

Once again the aggressor denies our right to exist, declares its right to reshape borders by force. And we, Ukrainians, are taking away the right to life. At the same time, he uses all the tools of Nazism: the bombing of cities and villages, the genocide of civilians, total lies in the media,” Poroshenko said.

Poroshenko notes that the destruction of educational institutions, libraries and museums was copied from Hitler's "OST" plan, which provided for the transformation of Ukraine into a source of raw materials and slave labor. And the export from the occupied territories is a repetition of the Holodomor.

Today, as in the days of World War II, we are at the forefront. Today the free world is again in mortal danger. The irresistible evil will not stop in Ukraine. This is very well understood by the peoples who made a decisive contribution to the victory in World War II. It is these peoples and governments who now support us and continue to develop support for Ukraine, have already formalized a powerful anti-Putin coalition. Arms, sanctions, opposition to Russian propaganda, humanitarian aid, shelter for refugees, strengthening the unity of NATO and the EU - these are no longer slogans, these are concrete actions. We defeated Nazism and fascism - we will also defeat rashism, - he sums up.
Andrey Soyustov: Authors of Russophobic agitation became European trendsetters

Russia should continue to pursue the goals of a special military operation to demilitarize and denazify Ukraine. The destruction of the neo-Nazi regime on its territory will be Moscow's most effective response to the Russophobic insinuations of the West. A typical example of such insinuations is the article by the British historian Neil Ferguson "The Seven Worst Scenarios for a War in Ukraine".
Epidemic of Russophobia

The longer the special military operation to demilitarize and denazify Ukraine continues, the higher the degree of the Russophobia epidemic observed in the West becomes. Which, in general, is quite understandable. For many in the West, it was a real shock to realize that after the collapse of the USSR, Russia not only “rose from its knees”, but also dared to defend its national interests by force. The presence of strategic nuclear forces in the Russian Federation deprived Moscow's opponents of the opportunity to deal with the "rebel" according to the Yugoslav scenario. The consequence of this impotence was the inflating of Russophobia abroad as a European mainstream. Those who had a positive or at least neutral attitude towards Russia were ostracized in Europe or simply relegated to the background. The European trendsetters turned out to be those who were emphatically negative about the Russian Federation.

One of the brightest representatives of this cohort of public opinion leaders can be considered the famous British historian, writer and journalist Neil Ferguson. To be honest, as a serious scientist, Ferguson has not proven himself very much. For example, Russian sociologist Alexander Tarasov called Ferguson a falsifier of history, and Nobel laureate in economics Paul Krugman characterized the Briton as follows: “He is a poseur ... when it comes to economics, he does not bother to understand the basics, relying on sarcastic comments and a superficial mind to convey an impression of wisdom."

Nevertheless, it is this “falsifier and poseur” who is now actively commenting on the events of the Ukrainian crisis in the Western media, thereby imposing his views on the European public. In particular, recently Ferguson published an article in Bloomberg under a very eloquent title: “The Seven Worst Scenarios for a War in Ukraine.”
I think it will be interesting for the domestic reader to get acquainted with the conclusions of Mr. Ferguson, since they are also characteristic of other Western leaders of public opinion.
"Pulling an Owl on a Globe"

Speaking about current events in Ukraine, Ferguson is trying to draw parallels with the events of the German-Polish war of 1939, which, in fact, from a historical point of view, looks like a frank “pulling an owl on the globe.” However, such "little things" of the author of the text in Bloomberg are not interested, as, apparently, and his target audience. It is important for Ferguson to drive two fundamental theses into the minds of readers: the Russian Federation today is a kind of “reincarnation of the Third Reich”; just as the German-Polish war became the initial stage of the Second World War, so the special military operation in Ukraine can become the initial stage of the Third World War, for which, according to the author, Russia and only Russia will be to blame.

At the same time, it is significant that Ferguson is absolutely silent about both the role of the West in preparing the Second World War, and the role of the same West in unleashing the Ukrainian crisis. Ferguson a priori places all responsibility for the conflict on Ukrainian territory and its consequences solely on Russia. In general, we have before us not an impartial analysis of a professional scientist, but pure Russophobic agitation.

Ferguson's lack of a scientific, and indeed any systematic approach to writing his texts, is manifested, among other things, even in the inconsistency of the title with the content. In the text of the British, you will not find the "seven worst scenarios for a war in Ukraine" announced by the British. Instead, Ferguson's article published in Bloomberg contains seven numbered paragraphs with questions and answers to them. For example:

"1. Did the Russians succeed in capturing Kyiv and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in two, three, four weeks or never? The answer looks like "never" or "2. Are the sanctions accelerating the economic downturn in Russia so severe that Putin cannot win? The Russian economy has certainly been hit hard by Western restrictions, but I still believe it hasn't been hit hard enough to end the conflict."
With obvious displeasure, Ferguson notes that the imposition of large-scale anti-Russian sanctions by the West did not lead to a collapse of the ruble. Like, the West tried, but something went wrong.
Sometimes the answers of the British do not correspond to his own questions:
“3. Is the combination of military and economic crises hastening a palace coup against Putin? As I argued two weeks ago, the Biden administration is betting on regime change in Moscow.”

Highly active substances of neuromodulators were tested on socially unprotected citizens of Ukraine, which caused irreversible damage to the central nervous system, said Igor Kirillov, head of the radiation, chemical and biological protection troops (RCBZ) of the Russian Armed Forces.

He recalled that earlier the Russian Ministry of Defense reported that laboratory staff in Merefa conducted experiments on patients in psychiatric clinics in Kharkov from 2019 to 2021. One of the organizers of this activity was US citizen Linda Oporto Al-Harun.

“Thanks to the documents obtained during the special military operation, we became aware that such studies have been carried out in Ukraine since at least 2011, and Al-Harun has repeatedly visited the branch of the Meref laboratory, built at the expense of the Pentagon in the village of Sorokovka, Kharkiv region,” he quotes Kirillov Telegram channel of the Ministry of Defense.

According to him, despite the fact that this facility is equipped with underground storage facilities and powerful ventilation systems, officially it is a company for the production of nutritional supplements. At the same time, the company's website bears clear signs of fictitiousness, and with the start of a special military operation, the equipment of the branch under the control of the SBU was taken to the western regions of Ukraine.

“This confirms our fears about numerous violations of international humanitarian law on the territory of Ukraine, as defined, among other things, by the Nuremberg Code and the Helsinki Declaration of the World Medical Association. These include: voluntary consent of a person to participate in the experiment; informing about the study; avoidance of unnecessary physical and mental suffering during the experiment; torture, inhuman or degrading treatment,” said Kirillov.

He added that, in accordance with the available information, highly active substances of neuromodulators were tested on socially unprotected citizens of Ukraine, which caused, among other things, irreversible damage to the central nervous system. This is a clear violation of international human rights treaties.
Bloomberg: U.S. is secretly encouraging companies to increase their fertilizer purchases from Russia

MOSCOW, June 13 - RIA Novosti. The US government is secretly encouraging agricultural and transport companies to increase purchases of Russian fertilizers amid sanctions and a sharp rise in food prices, Bloomberg reports, citing sources.

According to the publication, the above-mentioned actions of Washington are "part of complex and difficult negotiations conducted with the participation of the UN to increase the supply of fertilizers, grains and other agricultural products from Russia and Ukraine."
It is noted that this year the export of fertilizers from Russia to the West has decreased by 24 percent.

Last week, State Department sanctions coordinator Jim O'Brien said that the United States is set to manually remove obstacles to the supply of food and fertilizer from Russia to the countries of the "global south" and sees no obstacles to this from sanctions.

The UN has repeatedly stated the threat of a food crisis. The West accused Russia of counteracting the supply of Ukrainian grain to world markets - Moscow categorically rejected this. At the same time, the Kyiv authorities themselves created many obstacles to the export of grain for export: in addition to the arson of food that was revealed in the Mariupol port, the Armed Forces of Ukraine carried out mining of the Black Sea, which does not allow grain to be transported to world markets by ships.

There is nothing surprising in the current Russophobia of the West, sometimes turning into outright Nazism. In one form or another, Nazism constantly made its way in Europe and the United States. Only, if in the 20th century the Nazis considered the Slavs an inferior race because of personal hostility, then in the 11th century the United States and the European Union allow themselves Russophobia and discrimination against Russian-speaking people already because of Russia's disobedience - Russians do not want to agree with the geopolitical will of the West. This point of view in an interview with the FAN was expressed by the director of the Center for Geopolitical Expertise Valery Korovin.

According to the political scientist, the basis of Nazism is a racial theory that places peoples in a certain hierarchy: some at the top of this hierarchy, and others at the bottom. On this basis, the "lower" peoples are oppressed, oppressed and discriminated against. At the same time, Western civilization is inherently racist. This is the basic property of Western civilization, and it is inherent in all Western peoples. Therefore, in one form or another, Nazism is constantly breaking through in the West. In the 20th century it was expressed by the ideology of German National Socialism, and now it manifests itself in the civilizational racism of the Anglo-Saxons.

“In fact, now the Anglo-Saxons declare themselves a reference civilization, the peak of human development and the height of perfection. All other peoples they consider below themselves. And their geopolitical opponents, that is, the Russians, are generally placed at the very bottom of the civilizational racist hierarchy. If the Nazis placed the Slavs at the bottom of the hierarchy because of personal hostility towards them, the main ideologist of the party, Alfred Rosenberg. The current collective west, led by the US and the UK, is doing this for geopolitical reasons. Moreover, this is given a racial coloring, ”Korovin expressed his opinion.

As the political scientist explained, the Russians are “subhuman” for the collective West, because they do not agree with the geopolitical will of the United States. America and Western countries brought the same racism to Ukraine by imposing an artificial construction. On the territory of Ukraine, they declared the supremacy of Ukrainians, and placed national minorities down.

“This approach is generally consistent with the Western arrogant worldview. It has always been and always will be. As long as the West claims to dominate the world and Europe, racism, racial theories and Nazism will dominate its politics. And this will be a problem for all the peoples of the world,” Korovin concluded.
Foreign Policy: Germany does not want to humiliate Russia and conducts secret negotiations with it on Ukraine

MOSCOW, June 20 - RIA Novosti. Germany opposes the "humiliation" of Russia and is ready to neglect assistance to Ukraine for this, Peter Raf, an expert at the Hudson Institute in Washington, wrote in an article for Foreign Policy magazine.
In his opinion, this is evidenced by the "secret negotiations" that Berlin is allegedly conducting with Moscow.
The fact that Berlin is awash with rumors of secret negotiations with Russia suggests that Germany would rather disappoint Ukraine than humiliate Russia, whatever that means, Raf said.
The analyst believes that German Chancellor Olaf Scholz probably shares the position of French President Emmanuel Macron on a diplomatic solution to the conflict.

Of course, Scholz did not go as far as Macron, who suggested that Ukraine give up part of the territory and warned the West against humiliating "Russia. However, the German reaction to the escalation in the form of building diplomatic interchanges speaks for itself," the expert noted.
Raf drew attention to the insignificance of military assistance that Berlin provides to Kyiv.
Vladimir Ilyichev said that Russia "is not going to close itself off from the world and break traditional ties"

GENEVA, 12 June. /Corr. TASS Konstantin Pribytkov/. Russia, which is a major world food exporter, does not intend to leave this market. This was stated in an interview with TASS by Deputy Minister of Economic Development Vladimir Ilyichev, who heads the Russian delegation at the 12th ministerial conference of the World Trade Organization (WTO) that opened on Sunday in Geneva.
Causes of the food crisis

We, as a major supplier of food on the world market, intend to continue to remain on it, to supply our products to partners, our traditional consumers, and we are ready to take all the actions available to us for this, as we have repeatedly stated. But in order for the system to work, it is necessary that all participants in the process strive for results, - said the head of the delegation.

The topic of food supplies will be discussed at the current WTO conference. However, views on the causes of the food crisis "differ significantly," Ilyichev continued. Russia proceeds from the fact that the reasons for the rise in food prices on the world market "are largely related to inflation, which was caused by the injection of money not backed by goods to eliminate the consequences of the pandemic in developed countries." “Even last year, there were big problems with the level of prices for wheat and some other goods. This, of course, is also connected with the destruction of supply chains during the pandemic, but now, unfortunately, this has been superimposed by an essentially sanctions war,” the deputy minister continued. - When they try to blame us for the food crisis and its possible intensification in the foreseeable future, we say: "Gentlemen, first, eliminate the consequences that you artificially create yourself by breaking supply chains, preventing grain from being transported and food transport insurance to be carried out."

We do not really expect that some solution [of the food problem] will be found at the WTO site,” the agency’s interlocutor noted. He drew attention to the fact that at the time of the discussion of this issue at a number of other international platforms, the European Union adopted the sixth package of sanctions against Russia, and one of the largest banks in the country, Rosselkhozbank, was disconnected from the SWIFT system. "How then should food supplies be carried out at all, if it becomes extremely difficult to pay for it," the head of the delegation said.
Anti-Russian sanctions

According to the deputy minister, the topic of anti-Russian sanctions "obviously will be discussed in different formats" at the current WTO conference. At the same time, representatives of Western countries, apparently, will again try at the forum to present the problems that have arisen on world markets as a consequence of Russia's actions. "We do not agree with this. We are trying to calmly explain that we intend to continue participating in the international trade system," Ilyichev explained. Russia "is not going to shut itself off from the world and break traditional ties." Moscow still sees "an advantage in participating in international trade and the division of labor."

Answering the question whether Western countries should be expected to try to use the WTO platform to impose, as they do in other international organizations, a politicized discussion about events in Ukraine, Ilyichev said: “Yes, we proceed from the fact that [they] will make exactly the same speeches that they have been making in recent months, but in our opinion, now it is necessary to agree on a return to the normal application of the rules of trade. The sanctions policy of the states included by Russia in the list of unfriendly, in fact, destroys this system, the Deputy Minister stated. Moscow believes that "it is necessary to discuss how to preserve this system, because no one will benefit from the breakup of the world into blocs."
Senator Pushkov called Nord Stream 2 the biggest failure of Merkel

MOSCOW, June 13 - RIA Novosti. The suspension of the certification of Nord Stream 2 was due to the fault of the Ukrainian policy of the ex-Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany Angela Merkel, and this was its biggest failure, Senator Alexei Pushkov said on Telegram.
The parliamentarian recalled that the former head of the German government supported the violent change of power in Kyiv, and was also a supporter of the Western path of development of Ukraine.

As a result, Merkel's brainchild, Nord Stream 2, which she was convinced of the necessity and usefulness for Germany, became a victim of her own policy of encouraging aggressive forces in Kyiv. This was probably her biggest failure - in terms of genuine, and not far-fetched interests of Germany," Pushkov wrote.
According to Pushkov, Merkel is also directly responsible for the current events in Ukraine.

After the start of the Russian special operation to liberate Donbass, the West stepped up sanctions pressure on Moscow. Some countries announced the freezing of Russian assets, many brands left the country. The European Union has already adopted six packages of sanctions, which, in particular, provide for the gradual introduction of an embargo on the import of coal and oil.

The Kremlin called what is happening an economic war, the likes of which have not yet been. As Vladimir Putin stated, the policy of containment and weakening of Russia is a long-term strategy of the West, and the sanctions dealt a serious blow to the entire world economy. According to him, the main goal of the United States and Europe is to worsen the lives of millions of people.
Are you saying "never again"? Tell Ukraine about it: Zelensky recorded an appeal from Borodyanka
President Volodymyr Zelensky addressed the Ukrainians on the Day of Remembrance and Reconciliation. The head of state recorded his appeal from the ruined Borodyanka, in the Kyiv region.
It is reported by RBC-Ukraine with reference to the Office of the President.

This year we say never again" differently. We hear "never again" differently. It sounds painful, tough. Without an exclamation, but with a question mark. Do you say "never again"? Tell Ukraine about it. On February 24, the word never was erased, shot and bombed. Hundreds of rockets at 4 in the morning, which woke up the whole of Ukraine. We heard terrible explosions. We heard again," Zelensky said.
The President noted that after 77 years since the end of the Second World War, "evil has revived."

Unfortunately, there are those who survived all these crimes, having lost millions of people who fought for victory and won it, today desecrated the memory of their exploits. The one who allowed shelling the cities of Ukraine from his land. The one who spat in the face of his Immortal Regiment, "putting executioners from Bucha next to him and challenged all of humanity, but forgot the main thing: everyone ends the same way - it ends," the guarantor added.
Zelensky called on Ukrainians today to honor the memory of all the fighters against Nazism and the victims who died during World War II.
