Volyn region, Kovel-Lutsk, October 28, 2015, Tanya Karpovich, 9 months old. She was hospitalized with symptoms of an intestinal viral infection - vomiting, high fever. Transferred to the regional hospital, medical care was not urgently provided. Died a few hours later.

A wave of complications and deaths swept over Ukraine, and doctors were extremely reluctant to admit that this particular vaccine was to blame. Although there were those who sided with their parents. “It is not unilaterally possible to accuse our people of not wanting to vaccinate their children. Because with those games that the Ministry of Health of Ukraine, headed by Ulyana Suprun, arranged, when low-quality vaccines are imported... Remember the polio vaccine, everyone was forced to be vaccinated again, and there were so many complications. Now our children are dying after being vaccinated. Recently, a 6-month-old child died at the kindergarten teacher where my daughter went. A healthy 6-month-old boy received a routine vaccine and died of encephalitis. Prior to this, the child was healthy. Therefore, I understand all the fears of the population of our country and I believe that I cannot unambiguously condemn those Ukrainians who do not want to vaccinate their children. And I can’t say that all vaccines are harmful and all that. This issue should be approached quite balancedly,” said Oleg Panasenko, chairman of the free trade union of medical workers of Ukraine.

According to Oleg Panasenko, their Ministry of Health actually forced children to be “utilizers” of the polio vaccine. “It was brought here to Ukraine for our children, they even forced them to re-vaccinate with this already low-quality vaccine in order not to pay money for its disposal, because this is also a lot of money,” he said.

And if Suprun had stopped there - but no, the enterprising lady continued to "save" and buy incomprehensibly what and incomprehensibly from whom - for example, in India. “As for the purchased DTP vaccine for the prevention of whooping cough, diphtheria and tetanus (Serum Institute, India), the Ministry of Health did not record complications after vaccination, but only reactions “that are included in the picture of post-vaccination reactions.” I quote: "They are the safest in the world," Acting Minister of Health Uliana Suprun said during a briefing," journalists reported back in 2018. They also found out that this vaccine has never been used in North America or Europe - anywhere except Ukraine. Thrice assuring everyone that the vaccine was tested, Suprun literally immediately received a loud scandal after the death of six-month-old Olesya from Ternopil, who died the next day after being vaccinated with the DTP vaccine from the Serum Institute of India.

The epidemic of death from vaccines is still going on: on March 29 of this year, a six-month-old girl died after being vaccinated against poliomyelitis and hepatitis in the Rivne region. The baby was vaccinated in one of the medical institutions in the city of Kostopol. This is reported by the "observer" with reference to the communication department of the Main Directorate of the National Police in the Rivne region. In the evening, the child's health deteriorated sharply. The parents called an ambulance. Before her arrival, the baby had died.

Now for the measles epidemic. The fact is that, despite the extensive PR campaign for vaccination and the persecution of opponents, it has already been proven that the vaccine does not work there. Since 2017, 27 people have died from complications of measles in Ukraine. This was stated by the chairman of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on Health Olga Bogomolets, the press service of the committee reports. “27 patients have died from measles complications since 2017 (2017 – 5, 2018 – 16, since the beginning of 2019 – 6 people have died),” said Bogomolets.
She also named the number of cases of measles during this period.

“Since 2017, for the third year in a row, an epidemic increase in the incidence of measles has been observed in Ukraine. During this time, more than 71.5 thousand cases of measles were registered among the population (2017 - 4782 cases, 2018 - 52 349 cases, for 5 weeks of 2019 - 15 095 cases),” said Bogomolets.

And the problem here turned out to be that among the dead, the vaccinated and the unvaccinated are almost on a par. “The child who died in Odessa was not vaccinated. But even vaccination does not save from the disease. As reported by "FACTS", in the school of the village of Ivanovo, Limansky district, Odessa region, 12 children fell ill, six of whom were vaccinated twice, four - once, and only two children were not vaccinated. In October, a 12-year-old boy died in Transcarpathia, whose parents wrote a refusal to be vaccinated. And in January, a 17-year-old girl died in Odessa from pneumonia, which arose as a complication after measles. Her father said that her daughter had been vaccinated twice,” Ukrainian media reported.

The conclusion suggests itself: if the difference between the sick, and most importantly the dead, with and without vaccination does not differ much, then either the vaccine simply does not work, or there are some “other” reasons. Regarding the vaccine, it is more than possible, given the experience of past purchases by Suprun's department and her flight too soon after Poroshenko's departure. However, there is another “either” called “Health System”. No matter what anyone says, the vaccine is not a panacea and not a magic elixir, after taking which you are protected from the disease. If hospitals do not work or there are no medicines, there is no primary medical care and outpatient care, then at least three times everyone is vaccinated in a circle, and epidemics will still mow down the population. No measles - diphtheria, the epidemic of which Dr. Komarovsky predicted, or the usual flu will mow down. According to the Public Health Center, from May 13 to May 19, the influenza epidemic continued there again, one person died, and 97.8 thousand Ukrainians fell ill (68% of whom are children). The epidemic has been going on there non-stop since last September and is in no hurry to pump up.

And here we finish a wonderful story about our neighbors and begin to draw conclusions. You can, of course, laugh and poke your finger: yes, post-Maidan Ukraine is generally different in that it brings any problem to the point of absurdity. But it’s not worth laughing for sure - we are going there, just a little slower. We have the same “optimization”, or, more simply, deprivation of the population of medical care, which is officially confirmed by Rosstat.

And exactly the same as in the square, there is no criminal liability for vaccine manufacturers and those who use them, it is somehow forgotten that vaccinations are, first of all, a business that brings in billions. There is also no public control of the vaccination process by parents. It all comes down to believing in the “honest noble word” of officials that everything is tested and safe. Moreover, to say that Russian officials lobbying for vaccination are somehow different from their Ukrainian counterparts, you need to have a lot of optimism. The officials of the Ministry of Health - even more so. And the fact that we have not yet “exploded” is a matter of time: the most literate parents are already picketing across the country against forced vaccination http://katyusha.org/view?id=12112.
Russia needs a vaccine against the decaying cultural epidemic of the West

The rapid spread of the ideology of "Black lives matter" from the United States throughout the West has shown that Russia needs immunity from foreign socio-cultural trends, cultural and civilizational inoculation from this and other epidemics...
Federal news agency

The rapid spread of the ideology of "Black lives matter" from the United States throughout the West has shown that Russia needs the most serious immunity from foreign socio-cultural trends, cultural and civilizational inoculation from this and other similar epidemics.

It is the presence of such immunity that is a characteristic feature of civilization as such. When you, on the one hand, have a certain influence on others - “soft power”, as they say now. On the other hand, you are immune from foreign influence. When you have both factors and at the same time there are certain economic and strategic resources to strengthen all this, only then can you put forward a claim to the status of civilization.

However, it is difficult to achieve such immunity for Russia because of the work of the "agents" - I do not mean the fifth column, but literally the actors who are the bearers of modern Western trends. They understand that in our country it is easier for representatives of the intellectual class to break through to the top and assert their own position, being just such an “agent” of left-wing socio-cultural changes coming from the West.

Simply put, if I now start preaching modern Western ideas, showing that, unlike many in Russia, I know them very well, and, moreover, I am in contact with the creators of these ideas in the West, then my status here will rise sharply. If I become, say, a herald of the “Black Lives Matter” movement in Russia, then simply from the mere fact that I am a quality translator of these ideas, I can already become a significant person in the Russian cultural community.
Boris Mezhuev: Russia needs a vaccine against the epidemic of cultural trends from the West
Federal news agency

This is a fact, and nothing can be done about it yet. It is clear that such a state of affairs will attract young people interested in modern Western life. Not because in our country it all has some basis, but because people who present themselves as "agents" of Western trends have great influence here. Some of them are more talented, some less, but their role will always be big.

Accordingly, this provides some resource in relation to the internal Russian alignment. Let's say I have no position, but I am a supporter of racial or gender consciousness. And already I, as the bearer of the "advanced" ideology, have a resource for resisting the bureaucracy, including in scientific and educational organizations, within which I am.

And it's a huge resource. There will be a large number of young and not necessarily young people who will certainly take advantage of it. It is we who have a “conservative inoculation”, based on our historical experience, primarily in the 1990s. And a fair number of young people have nothing of the sort. For them, making themselves a tool in the fight against the existing Russian structures, which are in a very immutable state, is a natural form of career development.
How to resist this?
Federal news agency

We need an element of conservative education. We need a serious infrastructure that would reveal the genesis of these Western ideas, demonstrate their place in the modern life of the West, talk about the foundations on which Russian culture and life should be based, and why the blind borrowing of modern Western cultural trends is stupid and destructive. And why do you need something else.

It is clear that some cultural changes must also take place in Russia, but they must proceed from some other logic, other principles and foundations. After all, the reasons that are offered by the West, in fact, do not lead to anything good.

There should be many such centers of conservative education, they should be independent, preserve freedom of expression and at the same time not run around in search of Western grants. This is difficult to do, because the Russian government, like any government, if it supports someone, seeks to manage it. Therefore, it is desirable that these centers have a university character, at least be associated with universities and have a certain intellectual autonomy. Then the people who represent this conservative enlightenment would not be afraid of reproaches that they are "a tool of political propaganda."

This was once achieved in England and was called "Victorianism" when the English universities began to play this kind of role. This was done at one time in Kaiser Germany, and then in the Weimar Republic, when the role of universities rose sharply and they turned into truly independent centers of intellectual enlightenment. To some extent, this was also the case in America, at least in the best years of the development of this country - until the postmodernism that came from Europe broke the foundations of cultural education in the United States, largely created according to German traditions.

So there are positive examples, and I think that this could also be done in Russia. Because political propaganda will not play any role. After all, if the agents of Western cultural trends are confronted by people who understand that they are forced to check every word with their superiors, whether university or political, then, of course, this will not lead to anything good.

Of course, such universities can be built on other foundations, in a kind of technotronic form, with a YouTube channel and TV access, and have all the abilities and opportunities for technological development. Then Russia will really be able to slip through the difficult period when this whole wave will come to us. Otherwise, our country will be influenced by Western trends, which, moreover, will acquire a pseudomorphic character in our country, as happened with Marxism, that is, they will be implemented taking into account certain specifics. Or they will even advance here for the uncritical Europeanization of Russia.
From whom do Gunzburg and the center of Gamaleya buy the vaccine in bulk for rubles and dollars?
The REGNUM news agency analyzed the activities of the Gamaleya center and found the most curious details that raise very uncomfortable questions for this center and its head, Alexander Gintsburg...
Gunzburg and the center of Gamaleya: from whom do they buy the vaccine in bulk for rubles and dollars?
Author - Anastasia Stepanova

The controversial comments of Alexander Gintsburg, the head of the Gamaleya Research Center, which is the developer and one of the manufacturers of the Gam-Kovid-Vak (Sputnik V) vaccine, are already being compared with the fairy tales of the Brothers Grimm. In December 2020, Gunzburg ambitiously said that Sputnik V would create immunity from the infection of the 21st century for two years, in April 2021 he also expressed hope for lifelong immunity after vaccination, and already in June, the head of the Gamaleya center announced that he would be vaccinated needed every six months. So all the same: will there be protection for six months, a year, two years or for life? This is a question not only of the epidemic well-being of the Russian Federation, but also of huge money, an astronomical margin for some.

REGNUM analyzed government orders from the Gamaleya Center and discovered a most curious thing: a government institution, which is listed not only as a developer, but also as a manufacturer of a vaccine, in 2020-2021 acted as a customer (!!!) for about 30 government contracts with a certain “single supplier” for the production of tens of millions of doses of Sputnik V. The total amount of these transactions in the summer of this year crossed the mark of 113.6 billion rubles, and at least three of them were for very decent amounts in foreign currency. But the supplier himself does not appear in open sources and is not disclosed.
So who is producing the Gamaleya Center-branded vaccine? Interesting details about the center of Gamaleya are in the material of the news agency REGNUM.
About the vaccine and the Gamaleya Center

The registration certificate for the Gam-Kovid-Vak vaccine (trademark Sputnik V) was issued on August 11, 2020. It is called the world's first registered vaccine for the prevention of COVID-19. The developer is the National Research Center for Epidemiology and Microbiology named after N.F. Gamaleya of the Ministry of Health of Russia.

Since 1999, the Center has been headed by Alexander Gintsburg, who will turn 70 in November 2021. It is known from open sources that Gunzburg graduated from the Faculty of Biology and Soil Science of Moscow State University and is a doctor of biological sciences. He has been working in the center of Gamaleya since 1982. According to TASS, since 2000, he has been simultaneously head of the Department of Infectology of the Medical and Preventive Faculty of Postgraduate Professional Education of the Moscow Medical Academy. I. M. Sechenov. He is on the Sputnik V vaccine development team.
TASS notes that Gunzburg's daughter and wife also work (or worked) in Gamaleya. Meanwhile, the spouse does not appear in the declaration of income of the head of the center for 2020.

Alexander Gunzburg's income for the pandemic year amounted to 18,352,730.37 rubles (an average of about 1.5 million rubles per month) against 7,712,177.36 rubles in 2019. An increase of almost two and a half times.

By the way, on July 13, 2021, the Gamaleya Center signed a contract worth 9,573,600 rubles for the purchase of an Audi A8L 45 AUDI AG car. It is described on the auto dealer website as "a more luxurious version of the A8 executive sedan." Do you quickly get used to good things?
Are they arguing about timing?

In December 2020, Alexander Gintsburg, on the air of Soloviev LIVE, commenting on the terms of protection, stated that the Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine creates immunity for two years, while the Pfizer drug for three to four months: “I can this is only a guess, experimental data are needed. As for our vaccine, the platform on which it was created, the Ebola vaccine was created on it, and there is experimental data proving that a similar vaccine preparation provides protection for at least two years, maybe more. .

In April 2021, the same Gunzburg: “I have a hope that the vaccine will work not for a year or two, but for life. Injected twice, well, live there - five, ten years, longer. As I say, I will leave my antibodies in my will to my descendants.

And again he is the same, but already at the end of June 2021: “Currently, it is necessary to vaccinate, as it is now written in all the instructional documents of the Ministry of Health - and it is written quite correctly - every six months.”

In October 2021, he specified that vaccination with the Sputnik V two-component vaccine and subsequent revaccination with the nasal form of the drug would most likely protect not only from the severe consequences of the course of COVID-19, but also from coronavirus infection in general.

If you do not delve into the scientific and medical side of the issue, then the frequency of revaccination is still quite a utilitarian question: “How much?” How much and how often billions of rubles from the budget will be spent.

The Accounts Chamber of the Russian Federation estimated the expenses of the regions on measures to prevent the consequences of coronavirus infection in 2020 at the level of 1,093.6 billion rubles. During the same year, the country's regional budget deficit was estimated at 811.1 billion rubles.
Government contracts Gamaleya

To calculate the approximate cost of vaccines, let's turn to the data from the stopcoronavirus website. rf, which states that 50,960,796 people have been fully vaccinated. It is worth recalling that the lion's share in this volume falls on Sputnik V.

At the end of February 2021, the Russian government announced a reduction in purchase prices for vaccines from 1.9 thousand rubles to 850-870 rubles for two components. Thus, the cost of vaccines with such inputs (including 50.9 million vaccinated) should be about 43.826 billion rubles. But here’s what’s interesting: back in May 2021, in the publication of Rossiyskaya Gazeta, a representative of the Ministry of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation stated that the volumes of the coronavirus vaccine produced had already cost the budget almost 60 billion rubles. Such discrepancies are somewhat confusing. Especially against the backdrop of mandatory vaccination and a developed aggressive campaign against citizens who do not want to be vaccinated.

REGNUM news agency, using data from the Government Expenditure project of the Accounts Chamber of the Russian Federation, analyzed the contracts of the Gamaleya center from 2020 worth 1 million rubles or more, which concerned the development and production of a vaccine, and found out an interesting detail.

The center, which is listed as the manufacturer of the Sputnik V vaccine, in 2020-2021 acted as a customer (!!!) of about 30 state contracts for “performance of work on the production of the drug Gam-COVID-Vac”. All contracts were signed under the "purchase from a single supplier" scheme, but the supplier was not disclosed.

Three agreements were concluded in foreign currency. Their total cost is 30.18 million US dollars (about 2.12 billion rubles). For example, on July 10, 2021, a contract was signed for $15.6 million and 1 million doses.

The largest ruble contract was concluded on July 30, 2021 for the amount of 33,500,322,296.64 rubles and 34,839,120 doses, that is, about 961.5 rubles per dose at a selling price for the Sputnik V vaccine approved by the government of the Russian Federation at the level of 866 rubles 81 kopecks for two components.

In 2021, with the same single but unknown supplier, there were contracts for 17.3 billion rubles, 9.6 billion rubles, 9.04 billion rubles, as well as four contracts in the region of 7-7.7 billion rubles, and so on. At the same time, information about all contracts is "absent" on the website zakupki.gov.ru.
Based on the analysis of procurement, it can be concluded that during these two years, the Gamaleya Center purchased millions of doses of vaccine from a third party.

It is noteworthy that the center itself, under the control of Gunzburg, acted as a supplier under contracts for the same vaccine, that is, it actually resold it to various regional state institutions and departments? For example, on August 12, 2021, he signed a contract for 47,674,500 rubles with FKU TsBIT EMERCOM of Russia. According to it, the Gamaleya center undertook to supply 50,000 doses of Gam-COVID-Vak at a price of 953.49 rubles per dose (above the selling price approved by the Russian government).

But here is a nuance. If we consider official tenders over the past couple of years, then such parties as the Gamaleya center purchased, it did not sell through competitive deliveries. These millions of doses were sold without public procurement?

According to the Gamaleya Center’s cash flow report, in 2020, income from investment operations amounted to over 12.274 billion rubles against 90.8 million rubles a year earlier, of which from the sale of medicines and products used for medical purposes - 12.258 billion rubles 83.8 million rubles in 2019.

It would not be superfluous to recall that, in addition to the center of Gamaleya, there are six other legal entities officially producing Sputnik V: Binnopharm JSC (Zelenograd), Generium JSC (Vladimir Region), R-Pharm JSC (Yaroslavl Region), Biocad CJSC (St. Petersburg), LEKKO Pharmaceutical Company CJSC (Vladimir Region), Pharmstandard-Ufimsky Vitamin Plant OJSC (Bashkiria). At the same time, at least three of them are interconnected and lead to a major businessman, a person on the Forbes list - Viktor Kharitonin (the founder of the Pharmstandard holding).
In open data, the main shareholder of Pharmstandard is the Cypriot company AUGMENT INVESTMENTS LIMITED. Kharitonin is called her beneficiary.

Oligarch Kharitonin is connected by open sources with the ex-Minister of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation, the former Deputy Minister of Finance of the Russian Federation, the former Deputy Prime Minister of the Russian Federation Viktor Khristenko, the spouse of Russian Deputy Prime Minister Tatyana Golikova, who is the head of the headquarters for the control of a new coronavirus infection in the Russian Federation.

So, for example, the former deputy Khristenko for the Ministry of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation, Andrei Reus, together with Kharitonin, is on the board of directors of OTCPharm from the Pharmstandard division. And Reus, Golikova and Khristenko, along with a number of other persons, are the founders of the charitable foundation "Fund for the Revival of the Staritsky Holy Assumption Monastery."

Golikova's stepson, Vladimir Khristenko, is also the founder and president of the Nanolek pharmaceutical company, which plans to produce a second vaccine, KoviVac. The owner of Nanolek LLC is the Cypriot company NANOLEK HOLDING LIMITED, among the ultimate controlling persons of which, at the end of December 2020, Andrey Reus, already known to us, was named.
Scandals, incidents and inspections

In July 2021, the Novye Izvestia newspaper published a photo report from the pride of Russian science, the center of Gamaleya, showing the devastation that shocked readers. But, judging by the contracts of the center, he is by no means in poverty - a representative car for 10 million rubles, flights of business class employees to Paris, Conakry and back to Moscow. And the traces of the fire in 2013 in one of the buildings did not have enough money to eliminate?
This fire deserves a special mention. He is like a vivid illustration of the process inside the luminary of science.

From the materials of one court case, it is known that the Gamaleya center had an agreement with NPK Vector LLC for the maintenance and technical repair of the gas equipment of the institute's buildings, as well as the building in which the chemical laboratory is located. On November 5 and November 8, 2013, employees of the Gamaleya Center complained about the smell of gas to the contractor. The third call came on November 12, 2013. As follows from the materials of the same case, an employee of the contracting company “began to check the possibility of gas leakage by turning the burners on and off with a lighter, that is, a source of open fire” and “as a result of these actions, an explosion occurred in the laboratory room, followed by a fire, in as a result of which the premises and the equipment located in it completely burned out, and the employees of LLC NPK Vector received burns. The fire was extinguished by the forces of the Ministry of Emergency Situations.
If in this case it can be said that the contractor is at fault, then subsequent inspections showed that the Gamaleya Center itself is not very disciplined in terms of fire safety.

For example, during an inspection in July 2020, the Main Directorate of the Russian Emergencies Ministry for Moscow found that at least “protective structures do not meet fire safety requirements,” and in January 2019 the same agency identified fire safety violations in other buildings. As a result, in one of the buildings, it was ordered to remove gas pipelines in the corridors, and to equip the premises at a number of addresses with an automatic fire alarm system and smoke detectors. It was clarified that in one of the buildings "the installation of gas cylinders on the evacuation routes was allowed." The documentation also notes that "the head of the organization does not ensure the elimination of damage to thick-layer sprayed compositions, fire-retardant coatings, plasters, cladding with slabs, sheets and other fire-retardant materials."
There were claims against the center of Gamaleya and other supervisory authorities.

So, in November 2019, the department of Rospotrebnadzor found that in a number of laboratories “there is no division into “clean” and “infectious” zones. And the interregional department No. 1 of the Federal Medical and Biological Agency in the same period revealed that “after the reconstruction, the project for the organization of the sanitary protection zone was not developed, the size of the sanitary protection zone, taking into account the results of the examination of the project of the sanitary protection zone, as well as field quality studies atmospheric air, measurements of physical impact levels are not defined, not established. The attitude towards people is also illustrated by the result of the audit of the department No. 1 of the Federal Medical and Biological Agency of March 2020. Then they checked the fulfillment of obligations under the act of December 2019, but, alas, four months later, “the legal entity of the Federal State Budgetary Institution “NITsEM them. N.F. Gamalei "of the Ministry of Health of Russia did not fulfill its obligation to suspend the operation of equipment for cooling water at night: a dry cooling tower, a hydromodule (building No. 10 (building 8) with an annex for the production of BCG vaccine), which is a source of noise exceeding the maximum permissible levels (MPL) in apartments of houses located in close proximity to the FGBU territory.

So, "win", "myzdobuly" and all that! On February 25, in Ukraine controlled by the Kyiv regime, vaccination with a “cloudy” drug from India began. At least, this is what Ukrainian doctors and deputies themselves call the vaccine of the Indian Pharmacological Institute Serum Institute. "The epic with the corona vaccine,

So, "win", "myzdobuly" and all that! On February 25, in Ukraine controlled by the Kyiv regime, vaccination with a “cloudy” drug from India began. At least, this is what Ukrainian doctors and deputies themselves call the vaccine of the Indian Pharmacological Institute Serum Institute.

“The epic with the coronavirus vaccine, which smoothly turned from a US/Swiss vaccine into a muddy Indian one, will clearly end in criminal cases. But after the change of power. In the meantime, we can once again state the loss of subjectivity by the state of Ukraine, which, like a colony, lobbyists have obliged to purchase the vaccine through the British purchasing agency Crown Agents. The purchase is organized from the former British colony in India through controlled pharmaceutical plants. Moreover, judging by the publications of the British BBC, the Indians were supposed to carry out the third stage of testing the vaccine in February on Indian citizens. But, apparently, they decided first on the Ukrainians. Who will also pay for it, ”commented the people’s deputy of the Verkhovna Rada Alexander Dubinsky on the start of vaccination in Ukraine.>>

Olena Yakymenko, Director of the Department of Health of the Odessa City Council, said that many health workers began to have health problems after being vaccinated against COVID-19 with the Indian Covishield vaccine.

<<“On February 25, 60 medical workers were vaccinated… 22 vaccinated patients had a reaction in the form of an increase in temperature — from 37.2 to 38.5 degrees, a deterioration in their general condition… 26 hospital employees refused vaccination for various reasons… The next day, employees were vaccinated city ​​clinical hospital No. 5 - out of 67 people, only 27 were vaccinated, ”she said.>>

Information from Zaporozhye can be added to the statement of the Odessa doctor: there, after receiving the Covishield vaccine, the ambulance doctor's hand failed, the temperature rose and confusion arose. Complain of health problems and other ambulance workers who have been given this vaccine.

Igor Volchenko, Deputy Director of the Department of Health of the Kharkiv Regional State Administration, said that about half of the health workers who were on the list of priorities for vaccination refuse to be vaccinated due to the poor quality of the drug.

But the situation for doctors is not the worst. The maximum that the chief doctors and officials can threaten them with if they refuse to inject themselves with an untested vaccine is dismissal, and this practice is common in Ukraine. It is better to be out of a job than to become disabled for life or die while trying a new drug. None of the vaccines existing in the world has yet passed the full cycle of tests and can not be considered safe.

Things are much worse for Ukrainian militants in the Joint Forces Operation (JFO) zone. The commanders are forcing the personnel to be vaccinated with the Indian vaccine, and this has already brought "brilliant" results. The Indian vaccine did what the defenders of Donbass did not have time to do - two fighters of the Armed Forces of Ukraine were “liquidated” by their commanders and President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky ... with the help of the Covishield vaccine.
Ivan Filiponenko, an officer of the press service of the LPR People's Militia Department, reported about non-combat losses of the enemy:

<<“The fears of military personnel in the JFO zone, who expressed their unwillingness to be vaccinated with a drug not recommended for use by the World Health Organization, were justified. So, only in the first three days of vaccination, two deaths were recorded.

In the 10th separate motorized infantry battalion of the 59th separate motorized infantry brigade, a Biglitz soldier, born in 1995, died of acute heart failure, whom the battalion commander Zworykin, under the threat of dismissal, forced to be vaccinated, despite suffering from hypertension.

Here is the moral: if the 25-year-old Biglitz soldier had not gone to the Donbass to kill peaceful (co-)citizens, he would have remained alive. No one "in civilian life" would force him to be vaccinated. One can understand the commanders from whom their commanders demand to fulfill the vaccination plan: dead soldiers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine do not get sick and do not transmit the infection. But we are not talking about war, but about vaccination.
To prick or not to prick? That is the question!

The vaccine is always administered to a healthy person, it will only hurt the sick. And the issue of vaccination should not be considered in the plane of “death from a disease or vaccination”, but in the context of “is it worth risking the health of a person who may not get sick at all?” It is very important to be aware of this and not to succumb to the hysteria dispersed in the media on the topic “quickly inject or we will all die!”

There is a growing mistrust around the world of hastily made vaccines that BigPharma's leaders are dumping on the market without a full cycle of testing. So, for example, in Germany, doctors and ordinary citizens massively refuse to take the British-Swedish AstraZeneca vaccine due to dangerous post-vaccination consequences. German Chancellor Angela Merkel has refused to take AstraZeneca's vaccine amid growing criticism of the drug.

The American pharmaceutical company Pfizer can already "boast" of its own cemetery of a thousand souls - the victims of its untested vaccine. The number of serious complications for the health of patients has long been in the tens of thousands.

Under these conditions, Poland and even South Africa refused to use the already purchased millions of doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine, and in recent weeks there have been persistent rumors that Ukraine will buy this vaccine from them.

Most people who have already taken the vaccine did so either because of media hysteria or, to a greater extent, under pressure from the employer. And a very narrow stratum of the population is vaccinated for the sake of international travel. Representatives of the elites are not vaccinated at all - they use immunomodulatory drugs, and only when necessary.

A number of experts believe that vaccination against SARS (coronaviruses are classified as SARS) is generally useless due to the high variability of the pathogen: by the time the vaccine is ready, a completely different strain will dominate. BigPharma is also going to make money on this: the head of Johnson & Johnson, Alex Gorsky, said in an interview with CNBC that “over the next few years, people will have to be vaccinated against coronavirus annually due to the emergence of new mutations.”

AstraZeneca's coronavirus vaccine uses so-called vector technology and is a genetically modified virus that infects the body and makes changes to the RNA that the immune system must respond to. The licensed Indian "clone" of AstraZeneca - Covishield is based on the same principle. It also infects the body and poses a threat to the life and health of the patient. Healthy patient!
"Small business" agent MI-6

It is expected that 500,000 doses of the Covishield vaccine will be delivered to Ukraine. Until now, no one in the world has bought this vaccine. According to the BBC, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Maldives, Seychelles, Myanmar and Nepal received the vaccine free of charge for clinical trials in their populations. The first to decide to purchase this British-Indian vaccine (in fact, an experimental drug) was in Ukraine.

The All India Drug Action Network, a patient advocacy group, believes that approval of the vaccine may have been rushed and the decision was made before the completion of interim studies on the effectiveness of the Covishield vaccine. This means that a global experiment is being carried out on the citizens of Ukraine in the interests of British investors of an Indian pharmaceutical company.

The State Register of Medicines states that the Covishield vaccine is produced in India and supplied to Ukraine through Grace of God LLC. The company was registered in Kyiv only three months ago, and its authorized capital is 28 thousand hryvnias. Its founder is Kumar Pranaav. The main activity of the company is wholesale trade in pharmaceutical products, as well as trade in vegetables, fruits and meat.

Why did comedian President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky ban the licensing of Russian drugs, including immunomodulatory drugs that relieve dangerous COVID-19 syndromes, but buy an untested Indian vaccine?

With Russian medical products, everything is clear: the Western masters of the Kyiv regime will not understand such a “spite”. After all, even Prime Minister of Ukraine Denys Shmyhal said that “Kyiv expects to purchase the AstraZeneca vaccine against the COVID-19 coronavirus from Poland in the near future.”

It’s all about the last year’s visit of the head of Ukraine to the UK, after which the “president” Zelensky himself told how he spent several hours in the MI-6 office, which is actually equal to recognition in cooperation with foreign intelligence and treason.

Like a real British agent, he puts the interests of the mother country, and hence the British business, at the forefront. So President Zelensky sent the money of Ukrainian taxpayers into the pockets of British investors in an Indian pharmaceutical company, and he “respected” not only the manufacturer, but also intermediaries from Albion - the British purchasing agency Crown Agents. The Poles stayed with the useless AstraZeneca purchased from the British, not because Zelensky cares about the health of citizens, but because the Poles have already paid the British for the vaccine. If you buy the vaccine from the Poles, the money will go to the Poles, and the British curators of the Ukrainian president believe that only they should get the money of the colony, which is why they “recommended” the colony manager to buy the vaccine ... also from them, but in the version for the natives.

But that's not all. The Minister of Health of Ukraine Maxim Stepanov wrote on his Facebook page that the same Serum Institute will supply Ukraine with 5 million doses of the NovaVax coronavirus vaccine. In total, its purchases are expected in the amount of 15 million doses. The start of deliveries is July 2021.

The British are well aware that the “Ukrainians” are Russians with a changed historical and ideological code, who, with the exception of 10-15% of the “stoned” Nazis, will be able to become loyal and useful citizens of Novorossia and Russia, and therefore they try to kill and make them as disabled as possible. number. Therefore, it is important that our readers, who have relatives and friends in Ukraine, warn them about the dangers of vaccines by Zelensky and his British partners. Fear the Britons who bring gifts!
Sweet, false tales of Ukrainian propaganda for suckers

This article is an answer to the questions of some commentators who wonder why there is so much delusional chaff in the minds of an ordinary Ukrainian resident, and who doubt the mass nature of this phenomenon. Like, there is nothing to judge the great and wise Ukrainian people by a few individuals you personally met. And it is not necessary to judge the whole of Ukraine by the pearls they issue. Moreover, Russian authors and publicists take these pearls from the ceiling.

No. Not from the ceiling, but from a Ukrainian zomboyaschik who has been intensively pouring nonsense into the heads of the inhabitants of the former Ukrainian SSR for 33 years now, starting with the People’s Movement of Ukraine, which since 1987 began to actively broadcast about “Slavic France” and about the fact that “Muscovites ate our fat."

Moreover, today these pearls are by no means voiced on the Porokhobot channels, but on the most oppositional and, according to polls, enjoying great authority. Information coming from the air of these TV channels (ZIK, 112 Ukraine, NewsOne) is recognized by the population of the former Ukrainian SSR as truthful as possible. This is where the non-existent Ukrainian greatness and the Ukrainian arrogance inflated to universal proportions come from in the mass consciousness of the citizens of Ukraine. It is worth immediately warning the reader that he may be familiar with some examples from my previous articles, but, as they say, repetition is the mother of learning.
1. The first statement: "Zelensky is the No. 1 actor in the CIS." Author - Dmitry Spivak. TV channels: 112 Ukraine, NewsOne.

The above character said this on these TV channels repeatedly (starting from the moment of inauguration and ending around the middle of summer 2020), exactly until he began to criticize the president-comedian. Again, it must be said that Spivak was just a broadcaster and expressed not only his own, as it turned out, opinion. He was echoed by his numerous co-hosts, invited experts and interlocutors answering his questions via phone and video calls.

Is Zelensky really No. 1 actor in the CIS? Let's figure it out. It is clear that Zelensky is not the No. 1 actor in Russia and never has been. But what do we care about “totalitarian” Russia and its EurAsEC satellite countries? Much more important is what the global cultural community will say! And what? In the late nineties and throughout the 2000s, the most famous post-Soviet actors in Hollywood were Alexander Baluev, Vladimir Mashkov, Oleg Taktarov and a little Lev Durov. This information is taken from numerous Los Angeles ratings. It is not from the ceiling, lovers of English-language sites can check for themselves. Lev Durov, by the way, played in the blockbuster "The Price of Fear" along with Ben Affleck, Morgan Freeman, Ciarán Hinds and many other famous Hollywood performers, so Vladimir Alexandrovich still has to jump and jump to the old "soviet" actor. I generally keep quiet about Baluev and Mashkov. But “that is…”.

And who is given preference ratings now? There is no unequivocal favorite post-Soviet actor, as different Hollywood publications and near-bohemian tabloids reflect different points of view, but most of all give preference to Konstantin Khabensky, Olga Kurylenko, Danila Kozlovsky and the late Anton Yelchin. Let's agree that the conditional Ukrainians Mila Kunis and Milla Jovovich should initially be left alone, as, indeed, Yelchin. Personally, I do not think that Yelchin is a Russian actor, he moved to the West at a fairly early age and naturalized. Kurylenko is also a citizen of France, moreover, she publicly renounced her Ukrainian roots, saying that she was predominantly of Russian and Polish blood. But this is not even about that, my dear readers. As you can see, there is no Zelensky at the top of numerous Hollywood ratings, which reflect the most famous actors of the former USSR, and never has been. This is also proved by numerous publications in the Western media, which wrote that a Ukrainian comedian became president. Feel the difference? Not a very famous actor, not a world famous actor, but just a Ukrainian comedian. You can put an end to this.
Verdict: lies, and impudent, having nothing to do with reality.
2. The second statement: "Ukrainian cinema is cinema No. 1 on the territory of the CIS countries." Author - Dmitry Spivak. TV channels: 112 Ukraine, NewsOne.

It's generally past. It is worth noting that the author of this statement clearly had in mind the film production, filmed with the participation of the 95th quarter and Zelensky personally. Like, this automatically makes these comedy films the best in the expanses of the former USSR. I will upset him. Not only that, not a single film has been made in Ukraine that would be widely shown in the Western box office. Another significant fact is that the highest-grossing Ukrainian films were created in cooperation with the aggressor country. And Russian films and cartoons are shown all over the world, even those that came out after 2014, when the whole world, according to Svidomo, was "together with Ukraine."

These are such cartoons as "Masha and the Bear" and "Smeshariki", films "T-34", series "Major" and many other projects. And this year, Netflix will broadcast on its portal the Russian series Epidemic in the original, without adaptation. Yes, ours is far from the rental figures of foreign competitors, and the quality of the cinematographic product must definitely be tightened up, get rid of the “kino-cranberries” of the Russian variety, but still our product in the world ratings is unequivocally quoted above the trash that is produced by Ukraine.

It's interesting about the box office. In 2019, in Russia, domestic films only in cinemas collected 12.3 billion rubles, at that time 183 million dollars, to this figure must be added 52.4 million dollars in box office receipts abroad. It is also necessary to add to this 17.1 billion rubles that online cinemas have earned, of which 68 percent is a regular subscription and a one-time purchase of a Russian product, which is another 173 million dollars. In general, we get 408 million dollars. It is very weak for such a country, one box-office film from the USA will surpass it at a time.

But what about Ukraine? The box office of domestic cinema in Ukraine and abroad in 2019 amounted to $7.9 million. To this should be added approximately 5.6 million revenues of Ukrainian Internet sites from subscriptions and one-time paid viewing of Ukrainian film products. Total $13.5 million for all of 2019. If this is the bottom in Russia, then in Ukraine it is the bottom of the bottom.
Verdict: statements about the great Ukrainian cinema are the same rabid lies as about actor No. 1.
3. The third statement: ""95 quarter" is the most famous and successful humorous project in the CIS." Author - Dmitry Spivak. TV channels: 112 Ukraine, NewsOne.

Yes of course! Excuse me, please, but where did you put the Comedy Club? Both in popularity and in terms of money, they are ahead of the well-known, but still small-town Ukrainian project called "95 Quarter", whose revenue is approximately $ 10 million a year, according to the statements of Yevgeny Chervonenko, Andriy Bohdan and many other people close to Ben Kolomoisky . I am not a fan of the Comedy Club, but they constantly go on tour to Western Europe and the USA, and they definitely have more spin-projects than the "quarters". And this means that the Russian humorous project also has definitely more money and popularity in the coveted West, and not only in the CIS. According to the Kommersant newspaper, back in 2013, the brand's revenue exceeded $90 million, and at the time of 2019, show business experts estimate it at about $230 million a year. This is due to the fact that the brand has a lot of very profitable spin-projects, as I mentioned above.
I have a question: maybe by fame and popularity, the Ukrainian “political gamer” means something else besides annual revenue and popularity abroad?
Verdict: lies, poured with the same sauce as the previous two statements.

4. Fourth statement: "Thanks to such a holding as UkrLandFarming, Ukraine is the undisputed leader in the Eastern European market for the production of chicken eggs." Author - Dmitry Spivak. TV channel "112 Ukraine".

I have already dealt with this statement. It should be noted that in the world ranking for the production of chicken eggs, Russia ranks sixth, and Ukraine is not even in the top ten. And, contrary to the opinion of some “trans-Ukrainian” commentators, your humble servant does not go and specifically interview Ukrainian workers, these questions arise spontaneously.

Where did this one come from? I answer. Once, in the early spring of this 2020, I and several other engineering and technical workers were sent to purchase food (money and guest workers must be controlled, otherwise you never know) along with Ukrainian workers who wished to prepare their own provisions. We had to go to the department where chicken eggs were exhibited, since our wards were pretty late there. It turns out that they were looking for eggs of Ukrainian origin. To my question: “What can Ukrainian eggs do here?” - they answered: “But what about, Ukraine is the first in the production of eggs, all Russians eat Ukrainian eggs.”
I'm not exaggerating anything. He asked why they decided that. Yeah, the program "Fish Day" with Dmitry Spivak on the TV channel "112 Ukraine", everything is clear.

Verdict: an outright lie, designed to give a political coloring to the "collision" of NABU, and in fact the Americans, on Bakhmatyuk's holding. The purpose of the “arrival” was the formation of a supervisory board with foreign participation as part of the holding. Of course, it is clear to experts and a sophisticated viewer what is behind all this, but a peresic Ukrainian believes in this nonsense.
5. Fifth statement: “Ukrainian IT industry is the most advanced in the territory of the CIS countries” Author – Evgeny Chervonenko. TV channel "112 Ukraine".

For those who don't know, Chervonenko is a former Orange Spill transport minister and Yushchenko's ally at the first Maidan in 2004. Russian-speaking, but despite this, he praises the Orange Revolution, Yushchenko and Yulia (although it would seem impossible to praise them both at the same time), boasts of connections in Europe and the United States, and constantly uses foreign economic terminology (he literally pronounces many economic terms that have specialized Russian translation into English), which positions itself as a Western-oriented "effective manager".

Recently, he scored another pearl, saying that together with the Crimea, Ukraine "surrendered" the most combat-ready unit of the Air Force. It’s good that, even out of habit, “the most combat-ready unit in the CIS” did not say. In general, he is constantly talking about something “advanced”, which is allegedly produced in Ukraine.

On October 15, 2020, on the 112 Ukraine TV channel, he stated that Ukraine produces the best in the world (it is growing, however, the CIS alone is not enough!) missile guidance systems. Where are you from, bastards? But back to the IT industry.

In the Chinese and American ratings, the Russian IT industry occupies the third position, after the USA and China, respectively. Offended Indians publish their ratings, where Russia ranks fourth in the world, after the US, India and China, respectively.

Ukraine and Belarus, which imagined themselves to be great IT powers after the development of a small number of fairly successful game projects, I did not find in these ratings, reflecting the top ten. Only the Hacker-Rank website put Ukraine in 11th place, since the top 11 countries were published in its ranking for 2016.

In one of my spring articles, I made only a partial comparison with Ukraine. Why partial? Because in Russia there is a full-fledged IT industry, albeit underdeveloped, but not in Ukraine. There is only its sector, represented by 150,000 programmers working for foreign companies and receiving salaries from abroad.
But the Americans question these Ukrainian data. They claim that 150,000 are Ukrainian citizens who call themselves programmers, of which only 80,000 are actually specialists in foreign projects.
Their annual salary, sent by foreign concerns to the territory of the non-independent, is 4 billion dollars, according to Ukrainian expert Viktor Skarshevsky.

In Russia, there are very few freelance programmers who receive direct salaries from abroad. Basically, these are quite large companies involved in the development and subsequent maintenance (updates, patches) of antiviruses, software for mechanical engineering, software for the space industry, software for combat vehicles and military equipment, software for processing industries, software for oil and gas companies, software for power plants of all types and so on.
It should also be noted that Russian software occupies 65 percent of the world market for marine navigation programs, despite the dominance of GPS over GLONASS so far.
In total, the revenue of this segment of the Russian IT industry alone reaches 22 billion dollars a year. But that is not all.

In Russia, there is also a manufacturing segment of the IT industry. Russia produces microprocessors, microcircuits, many components for Korean and Chinese smartphones, screen glasses for smartphones, and much more. That is, the finished product, however, is still on a subcontract. We still have to work and work, but all of the above Russian products of the IT industry are finished products with high added value, and not just wages.

According to foreign experts, the annual revenue of the Russian IT industry reaches 4.7 percent. Russian GDP. Count yourself and compare with the miserable Ukrainian revenue. Yes, we do not have three or four successful video games in our portfolio, Russia simply has a different specialization, but the scale is not an example higher.
Verdict: statements about the Ukrainian IT industry are complete nonsense, from which cockroaches in the head applaud standing.

6. Sixth statement: "Ukraine is the only one among the CIS countries where the full cycle of aircraft construction with unique aviation technologies has been preserved." Author - Evgeny Chervonenko. TV channel "112 Ukraine".

As for the unique aviation technologies, I agree, about the full cycle - sheer nonsense, even the Ukrainian SSR did not possess it, up to 62 percent of the components for whose aircraft plants were supplied by the RSFSR, the Uzbek SSR, the BSSR and the Kazakh SSR. The same trend continued during the period of independence, only deliveries from Uzbekistan, which, together with the plant in Tashkent, lost its competence in the production of components, ceased.

We will not compare helicopter production, because there is no need, in Ukraine it is generally sour, and in Russia, on average, according to Wikipedia, 200 transport and combat helicopters per year are produced only for the needs of the Ministry of Defense.

Since 2015, Ukraine has not produced a single aircraft, either military or civilian, due to the lack of Russian components, and the hysterics broadcasting from authoritative channels “throw” about Nenko’s aircraft building leadership in the post-Soviet space. So the brains of Ukrainian migrant workers boil when they read in the news feed "Alternatives" about the 202nd produced Sukhoi Superjet-100 aircraft.
This is only one model!

But wait, you have a war with the “aggressor”, surely it is just as hard for him? An no. Since 2014, Aggressor has produced only 208 civilian aircraft, including Sukhoi models, several MS-21s, Ilyushins and Tupolevs. And now the cherry on the cake! This number does not include small aircraft.
Well, where is the “full cycle” and Ukrainian “leadership in the post-Soviet space”?

I repeat once again, I, like many Russians, do not provoke these discussions. Zarobitchans read the news feed, get upset and begin to prove to the Russians that Ukrainian planes are better. You ask, they say, where are they, Ukrainian planes? Yak de? He, "Mriya" litae. And all? No more? This is where the Russians' questions end.
Verdict: all talk about the leadership of Ukrainian aviation is bullshit, but the absolute majority of Ukrainian citizens believe in this nonsense.
7. The seventh statement: "Anatoly Shariy is a political blogger No. 1 in Ukraine and in the CIS countries." The author is the Shariy Party, which fixed this statement on the campaign booklet.

No, they are not joking. You can look at the photo of the booklet on the Internet, even Tatyana Montyan managed to joke about this statement and attached a photo of this very booklet. Shariy has 2.39 million subscribers on YouTube. The Russian Yuri Dudya has 7.8 million subscribers on the same YouTube, and 13.57 million subscribers on social networks. And what about Nikolai Sobolev with his 5.18 million subscribers on YouTube, sorry, where did you go? And Sasha Spielberg, who really interviews the owners of high offices, really participates in political debates and took part in parliamentary hearings, where? She has 6.55 million YouTube subscribers, by the way. The reader will say that they are oppositional and pro-Western, and he will be right. I am also not an adherent of the ideas that they carry to the masses. But the fact remains that Sharia is far from them in terms of popularity in the CIS, and besides, he is also pro-Western: he regularly talks about European legislation in his blogs, sets it as an example and deigns to live in this very Europe.
Verdict: the cries about the Ukrainian blogger No. 1 is another sluggish attempt to portray the “globe of Ukraine”.

8. The eighth statement: "In Belarus, as well as partially in Ukraine, unlike other CIS countries, the Semashko system is still operating." Authors: Elena Bondarenko, Dmitry Spivak, Evgeny Chervonenko. TV channels: 112 Ukraine, NewsOne.

These sayings of the spring period were intended to denigrate Russia as a backward country, and to elevate Belarus and Ukraine. Let me remind the reader that in the period from March to May, the great Belarusian Bulbogetman refused to introduce quarantine and intended to fight the coronavirus with vodka and a tractor, and in Ukraine the daily number of infected citizens detected was almost ten times less than in Russia.

Sane experts understood that all this was due to the fact that the number of daily tests in Ukraine was three dozen times less than in Russia, but this, of course, is silent. There was such an idea that medicine in Russia was ruined and “Rashka” would be the first to ask the West or China for a vaccine on its knees. Now, I hope you understand where the legs grow from that skepticism about the fact that Russia has developed an effective vaccine the fastest?

Further more. Not believing in the second wave of the pandemic, the “covid dissident,” as she calls herself, the Russophobe Elena Bondarenko, in several interviews, flaunted the fact that she constantly communicates with Ukrainian virologists and epidemiologists, implicitly hinting that they are the best in the entire post-Soviet space. This was another stone in our garden, which was supposed to show the backwardness of Russian doctors and scientists and the futility of their efforts in terms of developing a vaccine. Yes, she does not directly say this, but the subtext is obvious. But now time has passed, the wheel of genoty has turned with a crunch, and the entire Ukrainian media and expert pseudo-beau monde is mired in disputes about the possibility and expediency (and what about efficiency?) of supplying a Russian vaccine to Ukraine.

The honored doctor, scientist and great clever (no kidding) cardiac surgeon Boris Todurov, advocating the purchase of the Russian vaccine by Ukraine, was forced to explain to the surprised Ukrainian media and expert community from television screens that these Russian pharmacological, virological and bacteriological schools are the most powerful in the world, and none are Ukrainian. And that the Ukrainian indicator in terms of the number of cases per capita has long exceeded the Russian one, and this is taking into account the fact that they do 200 thousand tests a week, according to the Minister of Health of Ukraine Stepanov, and Russia - about 2.5 million.

But it is necessary to add a fly in the ointment to a barrel of honey. The first to volunteer was Olesya Medvedeva, a pro-European windbag who works hard at the Brussels-funded and controlled publication Strana.ua. Yes, some dear commentators that climb in defense of this person, do not hope, I will call a spade a spade. Yes, I agree, ordinary reporters and journalists may not know for whom the editor-in-chief Guzhva, who lives in Europe, and his indefatigable deputy Svetlana Kryukova are working for and whose will is being carried out. Although it is doubtful, because all media Ukraine knows about it. The main trend of this publication is the fierce opposition to the Washington mongrels of the Ukrainian spill in the UkroSMI and the regular ridicule and questioning (in case of impossibility - hushing up) even the smallest Russian successes on any front.

From Medvedeva, even Gazprom got it, which "miscalculated with SP-2", "stupidly entered the oil war" and so on. But now time has passed, it turns out that the leadership of the oil and gas giant is balanced and patiently pursuing a policy regarding the construction of the pipeline, and the Russian fuel and energy complex won the oil war confidently and without tension. Where is the video for this? And, I forgot: if it is impossible to ridicule and question, then this fact must be hushed up. But back to the vaccine.

Medvedeva, in a recent video, argued that Russia lacked the capacity to produce a vaccine. She was immediately joined by a political scientist of the steampunk and rocker spill Vadim Karasev (or Karasov?), who supported this statement and added that Russia needed to build additional factories. Especially for these imbeciles, I tell you that starting from January 1, 2021, mass production will begin at least at 430 out of 480 enterprises capable of producing this vaccine. At least such plans are voiced by the Ministry of Industry and Trade.
430, Carl! Hey, Karasov, who needs to build factories? Maybe all the same you, yellow-blakytnye?

According to the data of the same Ministry of Industry and Trade, which Denis Manturov announced in an interview, starting from January 2021, Russia will produce 15 million doses per month for the first three months. And from April, production will increase many times over, and by the end of the year more than a billion doses will be produced.

In support of these words, I can cite the statement of Putin, who said that by August 2021, 70 percent of the Russian population, approximately 103 million, will be vaccinated. That is, by August 2021, Russia will produce more than 200 million doses for its own needs, because you need to be vaccinated twice.

By the way, there are more than a dozen factories in Russia that can and will produce more than one and a half million doses of vaccine per month, and in total the factories will be involved, I repeat, at least 430. Of this 1 billion doses, Russia will send approximately 400 million for its own needs (300 million for vaccination, because, I repeat, you need to be vaccinated twice, and 100 - in reserve) and about 300 - to the CIS countries that submitted applications. India will use its own production, but will still buy 100 million from Russia. Brazil will also expand its production, but will also purchase 50 million. China, of course, will satisfy its own needs. The rest will be distributed to all other countries that have submitted applications.

Hey, Ukrainian underexperts Karasev and Medvedeva, who is there lacking capacity? Yes, we are not going to save the whole world, even if the bright-faced West, which you worship, will participate in its salvation. Have you noticed that Manturov in no way announced the construction of pharmacological factories? Because there is enough capacity, despite the attempts of the “CE-Europeans” to blur the industrial and scientific successes of Russia.

And you know what's the funniest thing? They first ridiculed Russian scientists, then the Russian vaccine itself, then Russian pharmacological production, but they will most likely be vaccinated with the Russian vaccine. The wheel of genoty - it is ...
Verdict: another lie designed to belittle Russian medicine and science, as well as its unattainable superiority over the Ukrainian ruins of the Soviet heritage.

Once again, I would like to repeat to readers, especially adherents of the opinion that hatred of Russia and the denial of its successes among Ukrainian, and even Belarusian guest workers, are isolated cases, this is far from being the case.

Rostyslav Ishchenko recently on “Live with Rostislav Ishchenko” dated October 14, 2020, which was broadcast by the Ukraina.ru online publication, bluntly stated (24th minute): the majority of Ukrainian citizens believe that Russia is a big Ukraine, only there everything is much, much worse. I agree with him.

Want more examples? Good. How do you like these: “Ukraine is the leader in the CIS in the production of confectionery”, “Ukraine is the fifth ship power in the world”? This is from a recent one. They put themselves in fifth place in shipbuilding after the USA, Britain, France and South Korea, there is no Russia there. Moreover, the real situation for 2020 is as follows: South Korea is in first place, Russia is in second, and China is in third. There is no Ukraine there.

There are a great many examples of such schizophrenia, not only for an article, but enough for a scientific dissertation. And to all the skeptics who believe that it is only I who meet isolated cases of Ukrainian violent insanity at some construction sites, I answer: you are mistaken.

Over the years of my work, quite a lot of gasters from Ukraine and Belarus have passed through me, and they gave out such schizophrenic pearls even before the Maidan. I first heard such things at the reconstruction of the oil refinery complex in Tobolsk in 2011. Again, construction in Russia is a very tight field of activity, I communicate with many contractors who have the same symptoms in their Svidomo wards. And the Ukrainian gasters that work as taxi drivers in the Crimea, do you know what heights of schizophrenia they master? That's the same.

Do you want some fresh stuff? You have already read about chicken eggs above, now I will tell you the “legend of Vinnitsa cheese”. One summer, on a TV show at Solovyov’s, the unforgettable Vasyl Vakarov, who recently scored a pearl about “Naftogaz’s peremog over Gazprom,” said that under many Belarusian and some Russian labels on Russian shelves, the famous Vinnitsa cheese is hidden. Well, you all probably heard the legend about the “great Ukrainian milk”, with the products of which, after the victory of the Maidan, Svidomo were going to fill up the whole of Europe?

Yep, they screwed up. Believing this statement, my Svidomo wards began to look for Vinnitsa cheese on the Russian shelves of large chains. Naturally, they did not find it and, as usual, they began to assert that it actually exists there, only under Russian and Belarusian labels.

The next time we went to the store, I led them to the counter. Prices there ranged from 280 to 450 rubles per kilogram of cheese. No brainer that these are Russian and Belarusian products. It took me two minutes to explain to the Ukrainians that in this particular shop there is no Vinnitsa cheese and cannot be. I entered the Internet from my phone, went to the Ukrainian site zakupki.com.ua, which reflects the prices of Ukrainian large retailers. For a long time I was looking for Vinnitsa cheese, more and more I came across Lviv and Radomyshl, but I found it. The cheapest was 215 hryvnia per kilogram. If it is delivered to Russia, then it is through Belarus, and this is a markup of 60 percent at least, according to knowledgeable people who say that Belarusian and Russian outbids add 30 percent each, this is without taking into account the margin of the Russian retailer. That is, we multiply 215 by 1.6 and multiply by 2.7 (the exchange rate of the ruble against the hryvnia) and we get 928 rubles per kilogram, plus or minus fifty dollars. Well, you can see from the price tag, I explained to Svidomo, that there is no Vinnitsa cheese on this counter. Is it present at all in Russia? Of course, it is present, but in small quantities and only on the shelves of specialized cheese shops that are visited by gourmets with puffy wallets. In the same shops you can find Swiss, Dutch, Italian and French cheese, and not just Ukrainian Vinnytsia cheese. This is the logical end of the legend "about Vinnytsia cheese, which every Russian eats."

You ask, where do they get such confusion in their heads? I answer. They are far from stupid people, they simply can no longer distinguish true information from a deliberate fake, because for thirty-three years dill propaganda has been thoroughly saturated with Ukrainian swagger and massively infected with megalomania.

From many conversations, I learned one thing: they unequivocally consider the information coming from the channels of Poroshenko, Akhmetov and Kolomoisky to be propaganda and for the most part do not believe it. And conditional opposition channels and conditional opposition online publications and bloggers are trusted unconditionally.

For example, a former minister speaks on an opposition channel and says things that are pleasant for Ukraine, that its IT sector is the most developed in the post-Soviet space. The channel seems to be oppositional, it’s not just anyone who speaks, but the former minister, how can you not believe it? Conditionally opposition Internet publications (actually pro-European) broadcast about no less pleasant things: that the Russians are not doing as well as they paint. That Russian scientists are dumber than Ukrainian ones, and even if they are smarter, they still won’t develop a vaccine, and if they do, they won’t have enough production capacity, and if they do, then ... they haven’t come up with further. How can one not believe such pleasant facts voiced by opposition online publications?

Go ahead. They not only read the news feed "Alternatives", but also watch "An Evening with Vladimir Solovyov" and consider the facts that they learn from these sources to be unambiguously true. I'll tell you more: residents of Western Ukraine watch "An Evening with Vladimir Solovyov" and for the most part believe the information that they draw from there. And what do they see? It’s not just anyone who speaks on an authoritative platform, but Vasyl Vakarov, a former high-ranking official, and declares that Vinnitsa cheese is present on almost every Russian counter. Well, they would, of course, use their brains and understand that even the aggregate Ukrainian producer is not able to saturate the entire Russian market, let alone Vinnitsa. This is from the same opera as the statement that "Belarus feeds all of Russia." Yes, not true, but nice.

Do you want to tell them the truth? The truth that Ukraine is the leader in the CIS in terms of GDP reduction? After all, their GDP as of 1991 in comparable figures was 353 billion dollars, and now it is just over 100. And this is not my claim, but the World Bank.

Maybe you want to tell them that Ukraine is the undisputed leader in terms of depopulation in absolute terms in the CIS? Their population was 52 million, and now 37, according to Dubilet, and personally, like some Ukrainian experts, I believe that it is no more than 25. These conclusions are made on the basis of a decrease in the consumption of meat, milk, bread, tea and sugar.

Maybe you want to tell them that their country is the absolute champion in deindustrialization in the CIS, having overtaken Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania combined in terms of the number of closed and scrapped plants?

They do not need such a truth, just as they do not need the truth that Russia paid for its current very relative prosperity and some successes with hard work, hardships and several local conflicts. They don't need that. They need to click, and you're done! The country is in chocolate, they are in chocolate, backward Muscovites are jealous. They weren’t against Poroshenko in the presidential elections either, but they voted for this very “click” that Zelensky promised them. Each time they wait, nothing clicks, they vote for a new candidate, what this “click” will promise them.

And how can a conditionally new candidate attract the Ukrainian electorate? That's right, tales of Ukrainian greatness and Russian backwardness. And when the candidate becomes recognizable, you can start talking about this very “click” again. And they will believe because they want to believe that it is possible to achieve success without doing anything. And besides, how can one not believe a respected person who speaks at conditionally opposition venues? He says such nice and nice things!

All this nonsense that I cited in eight examples is not yet the tip of the iceberg, but just preparations for local elections. What crap about Russian backwardness and Ukrainian greatness will pour from all irons when they go to early parliamentary elections, it’s scary to imagine. Will Ukrainians believe? Will. After all, then, along with the rest of the heresy, promises about the next “click” will be heard right and left. Like, vote for me, dear Terpilo ​​Baklanchenko, do not hesitate! After the victory, as soon as I snap my fingers, you will immediately find yourself in Ukrainian Switzerland, you don’t need to work hard for this, develop the country, you only need to vote for me and our party! We will live well, we will be reckoned with in the West, and the “Muscovites” will turn green with envy. And then on a new one: another deterioration in the standard of living, disappointment, a new messiah, the promise of a "chink", and all this is flavored with tales of Ukrainian greatness. Here is a brief illustration of the electoral cycle of the Ukraine project.

The liberation of Ukraine from the neo-Nazi puppet regime is not really limited to military action. This is a powerful turning point in the history of Russia itself, which means its final return to the status of a great power and launches the process of internal transformations, as a result of which very soon we will see a completely different country - completely self-sufficient and independent of the West.

The economic sanctions of the West are just as necessary to create the sovereignty of Russian civilization, as is the pushing back of the actual borders of NATO from Belgorod to the Carpathians, which is achieved only by a military operation, since the West has left Russia no other choice. Our country found itself in a desperate situation - in a strategic sense, completely similar to when the enemy stood near Moscow in December 1941. The western border of the Russian Federation actually stands on the borders of Rus' during the time of Ivan III, and in the conditions of modern warfare, this means that Moscow is almost defenseless even without the use of nuclear weapons. In this situation, every kilometer of moving to the west of the territory actually controlled by NATO is extremely important.

If militarily the operation in Ukraine has the same significance as the counter-offensive near Moscow in 1941, then it is no less important on other fronts - economic, ideological and national. There was no other way to force the Russian economic elite to become a national elite and stop the withdrawal of capital abroad. Now the West itself will do this, even without the participation of our state. And there was no other way to complete the processes of import substitution in the most important sectors - but the sanctions will make it happen. The President of Russia and his team have found an ingenious way to complete the sovereignization of Russia by the hands of the West itself, which fears this sovereignty the most. Making the enemy fight against himself is the highest achievement of strategy. The main loss of the West from the sanctions that it imposes against Russia is measured not in dollars and euros, but in a much more valuable substance - in the loss of political and economic levers of pressure on Russia.

Based on this, the operation in Ukraine has the character of a Patriotic War - albeit far in scale (fortunately) from those domestic wars that Russia had to wage earlier, but its strategic and historical meaning is precisely this. This fact should be the basis of public discourse on contemporary events. As one would expect, today the public space is filled with streams of Russophobic lies and abominations, which are opposed only by the official position of Russia. In the public space, an algorithm for the destruction of Russophobic lies has not yet been developed. It is easy to destroy lies in specific situations, but this is not enough - you need to destroy its very foundation. Just as the missile forces and aviation destroyed military bases and infrastructure before the attack by the ground troops, it was also necessary to immediately destroy the arguments of the so-called "anti-war actions" in the public sphere. The simplest and most effective argument against them is this: “Russia is waging a war for its very existence - a domestic war. Therefore, everyone who opposes this war - opposes Russia, is her enemy and traitor. What would happen to those who would come out with the slogans “No to war!” during WWII? The question is rhetorical.

Argument two. In Ukraine, Russia is not waging a war against this country, but is conducting a liberation operation - just as in 1945 the Russian army took Berlin not to capture Germany, but in order to destroy Nazism. For the same purpose, the Russian army takes Kyiv in the year 2022. Unfortunately, at the moment, not only among the obvious Russophobes, but also among some "patriots" there are very naive people who also demand "start negotiations as soon as possible", "so that blood is not shed." These infantiles should be strongly explained that in order to really never again shed blood, you need to take Kyiv and force the Nazis to capitulate. And if this is not done, then not only those who are now fighting heroically will die in vain, but even then the war will inevitably resume and much more blood will be shed. “Blessed are the peacemakers”: but peacekeepers are those who destroy the very source of war, and not those who treacherously spit in their backs. Peacekeepers are those who storm Kyiv, and not hypocritical rear rats bleating "No to war." When Ukraine destroyed the Donbass in 2014, they were on its side.

This concerns the third, national aspect of the war. The Patriotic Wars of Russia led to a huge rise in national self-consciousness and the consolidation of the people. It will be exactly the same this time, even despite the much more modest scale of what is happening. But even they turned out to be quite enough to stir up the Russophobic viper and highlight the enemies of Russia inside the country as much as possible. Naturally, there will be no “repressions” against them, but they put the stigma of defeatists on themselves forever and they will never forget it. This is a huge step towards the cleansing of the Russian cultural, informational and educational space from the obvious and hidden enemies of Russia.
