However, in this matter, we cannot rely only on the state, but we should actively show civil initiative - create public organizations that would record everyone who ideologically supported the enemy and spat in the back of the Russian army during the new Patriotic War. We must not allow these people to continue to "brainwash" the people, occupying almost the entire information and cultural space of Russia.

The ongoing events are consolidating the people not only within Russia itself, having drawn a clear divide between the true patriots of Russia and the “cursed non-Russians” (regardless of their nationality). Such a section already took place in 2014, but now it has become even clearer and deeper. Consolidation has now gone beyond Russia and has actually divided the entire global world into our friends and enemies. Even in the West, there were many adequate people who understand the reasons for Russia's actions. But outside the collective West, almost the entire world is actually now on the side of Russia, as it is fighting for the common cause of destroying the world dictatorship of the West and building a just world order.

For Orthodox people, this Fourth Patriotic War has a very definite religious and even eschatological meaning. How not to relate personally to V.V. Putin, but objectively, that is, in accordance with the Orthodox understanding of history, Russia V.V. Putin is currently waging a war against the apostasy civilization of the Antichrist, defending the very existence of Katekhon - "holding", which at the moment is Russia. And no matter how far from the Church the majority of the people in modern Russia may be due to the Bolshevik yoke of the 20th century, it is quite obvious that Russia as a state at the present moment has remained the last defense of Orthodoxy in the modern world. Without Russia, the rest of the Orthodox world is defenseless and doomed to a quick death, which has already begun in the form of the Bartholomew schism. The current operation also has the direct meaning of the Russian reconquista - the salvation of the Kyiv Metropolis from dragging it into schism and falling away from Orthodoxy.

At one time, Vladimir Putin's article "On the historical unity of Russians and Ukrainians" appeared unexpectedly and immediately made many guess - what kind of future strategic projects and decisions in foreign and domestic policy does it portend? In the light of current events, this became clear. It is worth recalling that the thesis that “Russians and Ukrainians are one people” has not been heard at the official level for more than 100 years. Before the events of 1917, in Russian and world classical science (historiography, ethnography, linguistics, etc.) it was an axiomatic statement that the Russian people consisted of three ethnic groups - Great Russians, Little Russians and Belarusians. The differences between them are ethnic, not national. It is according to scientific, and not some ideological criteria. Ideology came already in the twentieth century and overshadowed the scientific approach to this topic. The Bolsheviks created the ideology of "three fraternal peoples", and the Ukrainian nationalists ("Mazepins", as they were called a hundred years ago) inspired their adherents that they were not only not "brotherly", but initially hostile peoples. But in both these cases there was a departure from the centuries-old consciousness of the unity of the Russian people.

For comparison, it is also worth recalling that 100 years ago, the lands of the main European countries were inhabited by peoples who almost did not understand each other's language, but thanks to a very tough assimilation policy, now we have almost linguistically homogeneous arrays of Germans, French, British, Italians, etc. d. But 100 years ago, the languages ​​of the Bavarians and Saxons differed from each other much more than the Little Russian and Great Russian dialects of the Russian language, and for example, most of the inhabitants of Italy then did not understand the Italian literary language at all, etc. Thus, the processes in Europe and Russia in the 20th century flowed in opposite directions - unification in Europe and an artificial ethnic split in Russia, as a result of which “Ukrainians” and “Belarusians” were constructed, and only Great Russians began to be considered Russian. But by European standards, “Ukrainians” and “Belarusians” are nonsense.

At the moment, social chaos has begun in Ukraine, the flight of the "elite" and real anarchy. The “stoned” nationalists rely on a certain part of the population, which, although it is a minority in the country, is very active, aggressive and consolidated. In addition, many of them have experience in punitive operations in the Donbass. In this situation, after the re-establishment of a new state on the territory of Ukraine, a special policy of denazification of the country will be necessary, which should be carried out at the level of the state program.

History has a valuable precedent for denazification in post-war Germany. In its eastern part, which was under the control of the USSR, it took place in a tougher form than in the western, which later became known as the FRG. However, in both cases, this process was quite painless and was not accompanied by mass repressions. Punishment of Nazi criminals had a “pinpoint” character only on the basis of judicial investigations, and the bulk of the population was not affected in any way, although formally it could be considered that everyone, without exception, collaborated with the Nazi regime. Thanks to such a careful policy, the denazification process was carried out quickly and efficiently. An important role in it was played by the new legislation, which banned Nazi organizations and propaganda of their ideology. The same will need to be done in Ukraine, given the fact that many of the Ukronazis will try to disguise themselves under very neutral political "signs".

The second aspect was to work with the mass consciousness, which had previously been subjected to massive Nazi propaganda for many years. A very similar situation is currently taking place in Ukraine, where the Bandera ideology is already de facto official, which in the 1940s was actually a variety of Nazism and Hitlerism. Thus, Ukraine will have to repeat the same path of cultural denazification that Germany once went through. That German experience will need to be used both in the field of anti-Nazi legislation and in the field of cultural policy, primarily in the field of restructuring education. In the political and administrative spheres, personnel lustration will be absolutely necessary - a ban on these types of activities for those persons who have worked in responsible positions in the administrative sphere and in politics since 2014, or who were active propagandists. Without denazification, Ukraine will always remain in a state of latent civil war and political chaos.

After the completion of the operation to demilitarize and denazify Ukraine, Russia will face a very difficult task of arranging this territory. Although the President of Russia V.V. Putin has previously repeatedly reminded that the aggression of Ukraine against the Republics of Donbass will lead to the liquidation of Ukrainian statehood, but this does not mean that this will happen all at once. The operation to demilitarize and denazify Ukraine will eliminate the Nazi puppet rage on its territory, but before the full reintegration of these territories into a single Russian state, a certain transitional period must still pass, during which Ukraine will be restored as a state friendly to Russia, and political integration will be preceded by economic integration . But for this there must be a complete change of the political and economic elite on Ukrainian territory.

The state "Ukraine" was a very specific phenomenon even against the background of other modern failed states - "failed states" that are not able to maintain their existence as a viable political and economic unit. This specificity lies in the fact that the current Ukrainian state, on the one hand, was initially unviable and doomed to extinction and decay, but on the other hand, it was actively used to cause maximum harm to Russia as the main geopolitical competitor of the West. The meaning of the creation of Ukraine as a state for the West initially consisted precisely in this, no one was going to include Ukraine in the "European community" and even more so in the "golden billion". Ukraine was originally for the West a kind of "disposable tool" according to the principle - "used and thrown away." And this is natural, since Ukraine, as an instrument of the West's geopolitical war against Russia, is itself a part of historical Russia. Thus, its curators from Washington expected to simultaneously achieve two goals at once: on the one hand, first create various problems for Russia with the help of this hostile state, and on the other hand, simultaneously reduce this state to insignificance so that its territory would not become in the future for Russia as a factor of its strengthening. The West understands that sooner or later Ukraine will have to be returned as the original Russian territory, but it expects to return the territory of Ukraine to Russia only as a desert, and not as a developed region. The current events cross out this vile plan, which would be the worst for both Russia and Ukraine.

Naturally, such a strategy cannot be voiced in any official documents, but it is easily read analytically, based on the general processes taking place in Ukraine after 1991. If the West really wanted to include Ukraine in its civilizational community (in "Europe", as it is called in Ukraine), then its policy towards it would be approximately the same as towards Poland - it would include real investments worth hundreds billion dollars, the inclusion of Ukraine in European structures, NATO, etc. But from the very beginning, the West was not going to do anything of the kind, and nothing depended on Ukraine itself. The country's domestic investment opportunities are meager and mostly owned by local oligarchs, and by now have been practically exhausted. Western investments mainly went to the banking sector - i.e. in reality, they were not investments, but quite the opposite - channels for pumping out the main part of profits from the country. In this situation, Ukraine was already doomed to always remain a poor third world country with a completely corrupt state system.

In this state, the country could exist for a long time, but its inevitable collapse was brought closer by two new factors: 1) internal - aging and extinction of the population and the flight from the country of its most able-bodied part, which led to catastrophic depopulation, even greater impoverishment and destruction of the economy; 2) two coup d'etat in the form of the so-called. "Maidans", which destroyed the remnants of state sovereignty and brought to power in the country a completely controlled colonial administration from the outside and established an authoritarian regime, completely destroying any possibility of a peaceful change of regime and the revival of the country.

The only condition for the survival and revival of the people living on the territory of modern Ukraine is the re-establishment of the state. The preservation of the state that currently exists on this territory would inevitably lead to an almost complete depopulation of this territory and, as a result, to its division into zones of responsibility between neighboring states. Given the rate of depopulation, this could happen in the next 20-25 years. The only way to avoid such a development of events is not just a change of the ruling regime, but a complete re-establishment of the state in this territory. The new state may have a different name, but the essence of the matter is not in this, but in the fact that it should be based on a new real social contract between the people and the new government, based on the interests of the people living in this territory. If such a power based on a new treaty does not arise, then the state will not be re-established. And this, in turn, will mean only one thing - a further uncontested path of extinction and flight of the people, the collapse of the current anti-people state.

The state that emerged on the territory of present-day Ukraine in 1991 was not initially an independent political entity and tried to build its policy, focusing on its Western patrons. On the other hand, he had to maintain normal relations with Russia, from which Ukraine was and remains economically dependent for objective reasons. In this situation, Ukraine for some time even had the possibility of a slight economic growth in the early 2000s, but this process was forcibly interrupted by the first "Maidan" in 2004. As you know, Ukraine is the only one of all the countries of the "former USSR" that has not was able to restore the level of Soviet GDP in 1990. The second Maidan in 2014 made the process of devastation irreversible. This process will go to its logical conclusion in the form of the destruction of the economy and the state, landslide depopulation and social catastrophe - in the event that an alternative future is not implemented in the form of a re-establishment of statehood in this territory.

How can this happen? The objective basis of the existence of any state is a social contract between it and the people living on its territory. The concept of "social contract", as you know, appeared in the Enlightenment and denotes a clear criterion for the viability and legitimacy of any state. Only as long as the social contract between society and the state is fulfilled, the state lives and develops, and when the state violates this contract, it is doomed to destruction. This destruction may not be fast, because the state can exist for a long time without the support of its people, by "inertia", simply because there is nothing to replace it yet. The official part of the social contract is formulated in the Constitution of the state, but its unofficial part is actually even more important - it is the correspondence between the expectations and interests of the people, on the one hand, and the actions of the state, on the other.

The social contract on which the state was founded on the territory of Ukraine in 1991 was based on the promise of the state to provide the people not only with development, but also with entry into a new community, which in Ukraine is called "Europe". Over the past 30 years, both of these promises have not only not been fulfilled, but the process is generally going in the opposite direction. Instead of developing, Ukraine is rapidly dying out, and instead of "Europe", it has become one of the backward countries of the "third world". The authorities in Ukraine traditionally explain this fact by allegedly “unpreparedness” of the country for integration “into Europe”. Such an "explanation" is focused on the ignorant layman, is a deception and manipulation of the consciousness of the masses. In fact, integration "into Europe" does not depend on someone's readiness, but is a "technical" process, which is ensured by powerful investments and the country's inclusion in European structures. If this does not happen, then “readiness” itself does not play any role. As you can see, for 30 years the European Union has never intended to launch this process, and nothing depended on Ukraine itself. Thus, the basis of the agreement on which the existence of modern Ukraine is based, from the very beginning, was the lie and outright deceit of the people living here.

The 30th anniversary of Ukraine's "independence" celebrated last year allows us to draw conclusions about an entire historical era. These conclusions are quite obvious. Having become a puppet of the West, Ukraine still objectively remains a part of Russian civilization - and not only in terms of language and the remnants of culture, but also in terms of absolutely objective economic criteria, since the West considers Ukraine in its economic space only as an empty periphery of raw materials. No investments that could bring it at least to the level of Poland were originally planned to be made there - only a debt noose was planned, which works very successfully, killing the remnants of the economy.

All this was covered up by an incredibly false and hypocritical phrase that “Ukraine must first build its own Europe” - that is, in conditions when there is not a penny left in the country for any investments, since all the profits through their banks are sucked out of here by that the West, building on this robbery of poor countries its thieves' "well-being". The West understands that by killing Ukraine, in fact, it is killing a part not of its own, but of Russian civilization – they don’t do that with their own. It has long been known an interview with George Soros, in which he let slip about the goals of the West in Ukraine: according to him, Europe does not need Ukraine, it will remain Russia, but in the end Russia will receive a desert, which will become only a burden for it. That is, by destroying Ukraine, the "masters of the world's money" are actually destroying Russia - in parts, first splitting it into "independent" states, as they always strived for. Usually they argue about the degree of reliability of the mentioned interview, however, in fact, this is not even important, since an objective analysis of the ongoing processes leads to exactly the same conclusion.

For 30 years, Ukraine has lost a third of the population and almost all of its industry, not to mention the territories - Crimea and Donbass. There are no preconditions for reversing the process of degradation and extinction, and are not foreseen. In another 30 years, the territory of Ukraine will turn almost into a desert, which, in the worst case scenario, will be divided into sectors controlled by neighboring states. The only chance for this territory not to be populated by immigrants from Asia and Africa in the future is a complete change of statehood, without which it is impossible to change this catastrophic situation.

There is no doubt that the entire current ruling class of Ukraine is well aware of this prospect. Therefore, all of them, starting with President Zelensky himself, have foreign passports and real estate abroad. They consider Ukraine exclusively as a convenient temporary place for conducting their semi-criminal business, but in the future they are not going to live here (and their children have long been studying and living in the West). This is an occupying power in the most literal sense of the word. They will leave, leaving here the dying population, which will soon have nothing to pay pensions. Thus, without a radical change in the state in the coming decades, only slow death awaits Ukraine.

Therefore, it is quite natural that already in 2021 the leadership of the Russian Federation announced fundamentally new theses regarding relations with Ukraine. In particular, President V.V. Putin voiced the thesis that the inhabitants of Ukraine and Russia are one people, artificially divided as a result of the catastrophic events of the twentieth century. This thesis has always been an axiom among academic scientists, but this is voiced as a political thesis for the first time since 1917 (as is known, in Tsarist Russia, the Russian nation was understood as consisting of three ethnic groups - Great Russians, Little Russians and Belarusians).

Article by V.V. Putin about Ukraine means a fundamental turn in Russian policy: if earlier it was about the cooperation of fraternal peoples and, moreover, often even about gratuitous assistance to Ukraine (even earlier, the president also announced the figures of Russia's actual donor assistance to Ukraine in the form of low gas prices, etc.). ), but now the situation has fundamentally changed. After Ukraine, being completely under external control, unleashed a war in the Donbass against the Russian population living there and positions itself as a country at war with Russia, this policy of fraternal assistance has become impossible. Now we are only talking about the fact that the Russian Federation takes under the protection of the Russian-speaking majority of its population living in Ukraine. This has already been done in relation to the people of Donbass and is the last warning.

In turn, a recent article by D.A. Medvedev about Ukraine has already become the logical conclusion of the public formulation of a new strategy for Russia in relation to this country. The main thesis of this article about the complete impossibility of dealing with the power that has developed in Ukraine under external control, and that Russia will wait as long as necessary until a new, negotiable and sane power emerges on this territory, means the beginning of a fundamentally new period of history. In fact, it is said that Ukraine in the form in which it currently exists is not a serious political partner for Russia, and the upcoming “reset” of power in this country is absolutely inevitable.

Let's return to the question of how the re-establishment of statehood on the territory of Ukraine can take place as a specific political process? In the conditions of a peaceful development of events, that is, slow decay, the “trigger” of this process would be the collapse of its economy and political system, which will inevitably lead to social chaos. The collapse of the economy is already inevitable as a result of its long degradation and the catastrophic reduction in the proportion of the able-bodied population. Already in the coming years in Ukraine, the full payment of pensions would become impossible due to the aging of the population, and labor migration abroad increased even more. The loss of the “food base” of the semi-criminal business, due to which the Ukrainian so-called “political elite” exists, will also reach a critical level, which will force the majority of these people to emigrate and withdraw their capital abroad.

Under the conditions of a general economic and political collapse, the population would begin to protest, led by former militants who fought against the Donbass, who have a large number of weapons in their hands. In this situation, there would inevitably be attempts to re-establish the state, coming from these militants professing neo-Nazi ideology. But since these people are not capable of any creative activity and do not have the support of the bulk of the population, they would not be successful, but would only continue to spin the civil war scenario. However, the events of recent days, fortunately, stopped this worst-case scenario for Ukraine and created a completely different perspective.

The progress of the operation in Ukraine was very revealing in many respects. First, he showed that the Russophobic “fifth column” in Russia is not at all as strong and not as large in the total share of the Russian population as it might seem, judging by social networks. Russophobes are active and aggressive in virtual reality, while real realities are cowardly and few in number. The bulk of the Russian population supports the operation and understands its necessity very well. At the same time, there were many representatives of the "sofa troops" who for some reason believed that a "blitzkrieg" should take place in a week. Such an opinion does not speak of a great mind. It is worth at least recalling two campaigns in Chechnya, which is 20 times smaller than Ukraine in terms of area and population - these campaigns lasted for several months, not even counting the subsequent fight against underground terrorists.

In addition, from the very beginning, the task was to minimize losses both among our own troops and among the civilian population - and this immediately means a slow advance with a long siege of cities. In addition, the Russian Federation uses few troops - exclusively contract soldiers - and therefore, from the very beginning, Ukraine has a three-fold superiority in personnel, which continues to be maintained due to mobilization in Ukraine. Although the population of Ukraine is massively hiding from mobilization and fleeing abroad, but someone is being called - in fact, "to be slaughtered." The strategy of the Russian army is to minimize contact battles and defeat the enemy through air supremacy and multiple superiority in artillery. This is a "classic" war of the XXI century. This is how the Americans fought in Iraq - however, unlike them, the Russian army is trying to save the civilian population.

The course of the military operation demonstrates the gratifying fact that Russia has again begun to feel sorry for the lives of its soldiers. Thank God, they don't fight with "cannon fodder", and this is the most important thing. The prolongation of the war due to the strategy of war in the cities, hiding behind civilians, the chosen Ukrainian army (this strategy has already been dubbed the “war of scum”) only prolongs the agony of the Ukrainian army and increases the suffering and losses of the Ukrainian population, and nothing more. This strategy of delay will not affect the outcome of the war in any way. Time is now playing for Russia and against Ukraine: Ukraine has almost no warehouses, no fuel, no aviation, no stocks left. Ukraine does not have a military industry - its remnants have already been finished off. Western deliveries are a "drop in the ocean", which basically will not reach the front, it will be destroyed by Russian aircraft along the way.

Now many are asking the question about the reason for the withdrawal of Russian troops from the east of Kyiv. The troops were removed correctly and on time - why should they stand there to no avail, if they are going to take Kyiv last? Now the main task is to close the large cauldron around Slovyansk, and then it will actually be just finishing off the Ukrainian army, since all its combat-ready units will remain in the cauldron. Most likely, this large cauldron will be liquidated much faster than Mariupol, since there you can no longer hide in a huge city, and the Ukrainian troops will already be without fuel and demoralized. The correct defense strategy was chosen in the southern direction. Counterattacks on Kherson turned out to be only to the detriment of the Ukrainian army - it achieved nothing there and lost all the equipment. Ukrainians were simply driven to slaughter there, but they showed a beautiful picture for the West.

Secondly, it quickly became clear that the most civilized version of the war, in which the Ukrainian army and its infrastructure are only destroyed, and then the government in Ukraine is changed to a more sane one, will not work. It will not work due to the fact that the Ukrainian army is fighting according to the method of terrorists - hiding in cities and hiding behind the civilian population. This delays the operation, leads to casualties among the civilian population and no longer leaves the possibility of preserving Ukraine as an integral state. It has already been officially announced by the representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry Maria Zakharova: “They have already missed the main chance for the existence of Ukraine within their own borders, sovereign Ukraine, independent Ukraine.” The creation of military-civilian administrations (CAAs) in the liberated territories means that they will no longer be under the jurisdiction of Ukraine and they will have a different political future. On the territory of historical Novorossia and in the Kharkiv region, most likely, people's republics will be created according to the 2014 model, with their subsequent acceptance into the Russian Federation. The fate of the rest of the territories will depend on geopolitical alignments.

Thirdly, the war, of course, also showed the area where Russia is still weak and where it must urgently build up its forces. This is the realm of information warfare. Of course, some minimum information warfare is being practiced, at least in relation to the population of the Russian Federation. Western propaganda is opposed by the internal Russian information environment, which more or less protects the people of Russia from direct manipulation by enemy propaganda. But this is clearly not enough. It was necessary to urgently introduce criminal punishment for fakes about the Russian army - but this silenced only the most arrogant propagandists. In general, the information war against Russia within Russia itself continues to be waged - although not in such a frank, but no less effective form. The Russophobic "intelligentsia" has a huge influence on the youth of universities. Formally, they do not violate any laws, but at the same time they freely impose their pro-Western anti-Russian ideology on young people. The struggle for youth is the struggle for Russia, in the future even more important than a military operation. What to do in this situation?

It would be a very important and effective measure to hold special lecture courses in universities and other places where young people gather about current events, their historical and geopolitical background. In these matters, as a rule, young people are very poorly versed - even those who consider themselves "educated." For these lecture courses (only a few lectures in each department), you can find good lecturers from different cities of Russia who have scientific degrees, experience in working with students and a clear patriotic worldview. Such groups of lecturers could quickly move around different cities and engage in educational work, the importance of which is now difficult to overestimate.

In addition, these lecturers will inevitably get into arguments with those university professors who are hostile to Russia's actions. Thus, these people will already publicly manifest themselves, and not "underground" engage in their aggressive anti-Russian propaganda, corrupting the youth. In general, the phenomenon of the Russophobic "intelligentsia", which once destroyed Russia in 1917, is once again becoming a huge national problem. Being narrow specialists in certain fields of science, these people are complete ignoramuses in everything else and do not have a normal "natural" mind and sense of the Motherland. Therefore, their impact on young people is truly catastrophic. Of course, Russophobic propaganda should be under the same strict legal ban as fakes about the Russian army. Unfortunately, the current Russian government is not yet fully aware of this danger.

Although the total losses during the operation are not comparable to serious wars, nevertheless, this is a great national feat with heavy casualties. Therefore, we need to finish what we started and not repeat the mistake of 2014. The main mistake then was the hope of somehow civilized agreement with Ukraine. The Russian authorities need to understand once and for all - you can never agree on anything with Ukraine, because it will always deceive. The state, originally based on a lie, cannot be otherwise. It will be possible to negotiate not with this Ukraine, but with that state, initially friendly to Russia, which will need to be created on this territory.

Visa-free status and association with the EU In 2017, the demand for Schengen visas predictably fell in Ukraine due to the influence of visa-free travel. This is reported by the organization "Europe without barriers" with reference to its own data. Last year, only 721,000 Ukrainians applied for such a permit
Visa-free status and association with the EU
In 2017, the demand for Schengen visas predictably fell in Ukraine due to the influence of the “visa-free” regime.

This is reported by the organization "Europe without barriers" with reference to its own data. Last year, only 721 thousand Ukrainians applied for such a permit, while in 2016 - more than 1.411 million. The number of visas issued, respectively, was 694 thousand and 1.36 million. visas Ukraine dropped from third place to sixth.

True, those traveling to Europe on their own at the border discover a problem - long queues. To get past them, you have to give a bribe to the border guards (20-50 euros per car). We already wrote that the EU grant program for the construction of new checkpoints on the border with the EU countries was almost completely mastered by Ukraine, but no new checkpoints appeared.

“After the scandal with the pit (inspectors found only a pit at the site of one of the new checkpoints, 3 million euros were allocated for construction - Ed.), Ukraine can hardly count on help from the EU to improve the border. And without modernization, there will be eternal traffic jams, especially since more people travel abroad after the visa-free regime. This is a shame for Kyiv. Brussels is tired of turning a blind eye to Ukrainian corruption and is already thinking of taking visa-free travel,” Strana.ua quoted its source in European structures as saying.

The State Border Service reports that since the start of the regime of visa-free entry of citizens of Ukraine into the countries of the Schengen Agreement (i.e. June 11 last year), 483 thousand Ukrainians have used this right. Compared to the total passenger traffic, this is quite insignificant. So, in 2017, “vizbezniks” increased the total number of entries by only 3%.

However, the “value” of a Ukrainian passport in the Henley & Partners rating (which evaluates passports in terms of the comfort of traveling around the world) has really increased by 19 positions at once - now Ukraine occupies as much as 80th place in the world. The reason for this growth, of course, is visa-free travel with the EU. True, Ukrainian officials rejoicing at the breakthrough forget that in 2013, in the same rating, Ukraine, without any visa-free travel, ranked 74th.

Ukraine can get one more point of disagreement with Hungary (in addition to the language of instruction in schools with compact residence of Ukrainian Hungarians). President Petro Poroshenko initiates a law imposing sanctions against residents of Ukraine who have passports of other states. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine even on duty remembered 100 thousand Hungarian passports in Transcarpathia (the information is old, now there are more). Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto was indignant at the proposal of the leader of Ukraine. Considering that just the other day Hungary blocked the holding of the Ukraine-NATO summit at the level of foreign ministers for the third time, one can be sure that the Ukrainian authorities are blocking their own Euro-Atlantic inclinations with their own hands.
At the same time, just two weeks ago, Poroshenko, speaking at the 11th Kiev Security Forum, once again touched on the topic of the NATO Membership Action Plan:

“I emphasize that there will be no better case. Ukraine, Moldova and Georgia belong to the Western alliance and should be part of it. This is our agenda. Until the next high-level meetings with NATO and the EU. As far as NATO is concerned, we will push for a Enhanced Opportunities Program for Ukraine and a Membership Action Plan.”

Those. it seems that a person wants to shove Ukraine into NATO, but then he remembers: “The Hungarians issued 100,000 passports in Transcarpathia! Moreover, they want to keep Hungarian as the language of instruction.” And plans are flying down the drain: what kind of MAP is there if Ukraine has been corny unable to hold a formal summit with NATO since October last year?
Work migration
The quantitative migration of Ukrainians to Poland is gradually developing into a qualitative one.

“Among individuals, there is a growing interest in buying land in Poland by citizens of Ukraine. In 2017, they received 134 permits, which is almost 50% of all permits for the purchase of land real estate, which are issued to individuals,” the Polish Ministry of Internal Affairs said in a report.
It should be noted that this is already a trend - in 2016, Ukrainians received 47% of such permits.

Meanwhile, the Polish economy does not even think about getting fed up with Ukrainians. According to the forecast of the Union of Entrepreneurs and Employers of Poland, in order to support economic growth, they need to attract 5 million migrants, and, according to Polish experts, the total number of invitations issued for Ukrainians in 2018 will be 3 million (1.7 in 2017, according to information from the chairman of the Polish -Ukrainian Chamber of Commerce of Jacek Pehota). Overcoming the threshold of 2 million Ukrainians at a recent press conference in Kyiv was confirmed by the Polish Ambassador to Ukraine Jan Pieklo.
Approximately 100,000 more Ukrainian migrants are expected this year in Slovakia - the local Ministry of Labor has turned to its Ukrainian colleagues with a request for assistance.

Due to the high rates of labor migration in Ukraine, it has become an extreme problem to calculate the real employment of the population. Let's say that only 360 thousand unemployed people are registered with the Employment Service, the ILO gives 1.8 million, and the State Statistics Service - 1.7 million. However, how to understand which of them are really unemployed, and who only waits 6 months to have the right to return again to work in Poland?

Sectoral imbalances also hinder the assessment. For example, there is a shortage of personnel in blue-collar professions: enterprises are forced to “scoop out” vocational school graduates and finish their education already at work, because there are no other ways to recruit staff.

However, there is an indirect argument in favor of the fact that unemployment in Ukraine is indeed declining. The National Bank of Poland, which studied the motivation among Ukrainian guest workers, cites interesting statistics. So, until 2013, more than 36% of respondents named the lack of work as the reason for leaving to work in Poland, and almost 50% - too low wages. Now the ratio has changed: almost 60% of respondents are dissatisfied with the salary, while only 20% of migrants complain about the lack of work. And the number of migrants who cited the political situation as a reason has grown exponentially: before there were only 3.5% of them, now it is 12.5%.

“Ukraine is simply becoming part of the European labor market, and other countries have already gone through a similar process,” Poroshenko himself said at an expanded government meeting, thereby making it clear how the authorities relate to this process.
But experts do not agree with this assessment.

“These phrases confirm that our officials did not teach well or did not teach the science of the development of labor resources. The new members of the EU faced similar problems. But it's one thing when on your western borders there is a country with a high-quality labor market, and on your eastern borders with a low level of wages. Then the problem of compensation of labor resources is solved at the expense of the eastern market. And Ukraine has become a black hole of labor resources: people migrate to the west, north, south and east. Who will compensate us for the outflow of labor?” — financial expert Oleksiy Kushch explains Poroshenko’s mistake in a commentary for Newsone.ua.
The outflow of people is already being discussed at the level of parliament

“The situation today is quite strange - in the western regions of Ukraine, where investors have entered, in particular, Japanese investors, and from Germany and other countries of the European community. There is a problem with the recruitment of people to work. That is, Western Ukraine, due to the fact that we already have a visa-free regime, left to work as labor migrants in the European Union, ”said Irina Lutsenko, the presidential representative in parliament, during a speech in the Verkhovna Rada.
Well, the French ambassador to Ukraine warned Ukrainian officials about this exactly a year ago.

Meanwhile, Poland is beginning to think about attracting not only unskilled labor, but also Ukrainian doctors. Rzeczpospolita writes about the plans of the Polish Ministry of Health to simplify employment for non-EU health workers. In particular, it is planned to cancel the nostrification of diplomas for doctors.

The government of Ukraine does not leave hopes to lay hands on the earnings of migrants. Minister of Social Policy Andriy Reva proposes to accrue seniority to such Ukrainians, as well as to make it possible for their family members in Ukraine to receive housing subsidies for utility bills. However, all this is offered to buy.

“... We are ready to give a subsidy to families where people work abroad, provided that they voluntarily insure themselves and pay a contribution for at least three months ... For three months, the minimum contribution is UAH 2,500, and for this we give them a subsidy and insurance experience which will give people the right to a pension,” he said on the air of the 112 Ukraine TV channel.
Economy and export

In January-February, Ukraine exported agricultural and food products to the EU in the amount of $2.8 billion (+$102 million compared to the same period last year), Deputy Minister of Agrarian Policy and Food of Ukraine for European Integration said at a press conference Olga Trofimtseva. This is approximately 36.5% of Ukrainian agricultural exports for the specified period. In general, 45.1% of Ukrainian exports in these months were sent to the EU.

Such active exports led to the fact that, as of April 17, Ukrainian producers had exhausted quotas for six items: honey, malt and wheat gluten, processed tomatoes, grape and apple juices, wheat, and corn. Moreover, in the case of honey, processed tomatoes, wheat and corn, both the main quotas (fixed in the agreement on the creation of an FTA with the EU) and additional ones (provided to Ukraine last year for a period of three years) have been exhausted. Ukraine also managed to use the second quarterly quota for the export of poultry meat and a semi-annual quota for butter.

"... As of the same date in 2017, the volumes of wheat have not yet been exhausted, and the quota for malt and wheat gluten in general for the past year remained unused," the analyst of foreign trade in agri-food products of the association Ukrainian Club of Agrarian business Daria Gritsenko.

Truly explosive growth in stone fruit exports. Thus, the export of plums to the EU in 2016 brought Ukraine 2.4 thousand dollars, and already in 2017 - 6.2 million dollars (mostly sold to Poland - 5.4 million). Inspired by this success, farmers are going to increase exports in other areas this year as well.

“There will be attempts to enter the EU market (Poland, the Baltic states) with strawberries in May and autumn 2018. An increase in the export of sweet cherries to the EU and Asia, as well as melons - in new directions is expected. For example, Kherson watermelons can go to the UK, the first such attempts were made in 2017,” Delo.ua quotes fruit and vegetable market analyst Tatyana Hetman.
In general, in the first quarter of 2018, Ukraine exported fruits, berries and nuts for $57 million (+68% YoY). True, this result was mainly provided by the export of walnuts ($42 million).

Europe does not leave attempts to force Ukraine to lift the moratorium on the export of round timber (in force since 2016). The Government of Ukraine and the European Commission have finalized the list of "neutral" arbitrators, one of them will head the arbitration. In total there will be three groups of arbitrators (neutral, from Ukraine and from the EU). It is they who will decide whether Ukraine had the right to introduce such a moratorium in accordance with the FTA agreement.

The problem is that there is still no group of arbitrators from Ukraine. Or rather, there is, but not in full force: Poroshenko approved four candidates, the last candidate has been under consideration by the Presidential Administration for eight months. And 80% readiness in such matters does not happen, only 100%.

The EU is convinced that the Ukrainian side is deliberately delaying the process of forming its group of arbitrators. At the end of February, the European Commissioner for Trade, Cecilia Malmström, even sent an extremely harsh ultimatum to Kyiv, in which she warned that if Ukraine did not provide its arbitrators, those arbitrators who could be approved would begin consideration.

“Several representatives of the European Union at once, right up to the general director responsible for relations with neighbors, assured the European Truth: Brussels has never had to start arbitration with partners with whom the EU has a free trade agreement. It was always possible to negotiate peacefully ... but Ukraine turned out to be special, ”says Serhiy Sidorenko and Yuriy Panchenko, journalists for the publication.

By the way, this is not the only problem in trade with the EU. Gennadiy Ryabtsev, deputy director of the Psyche science and technology center, warns that the EU could impose sanctions on Ukraine if the government does decide to introduce fuel import quotas.

Poland this year may come out on top among Ukraine's trading partners, if not in terms of trade, then in terms of exports, President of the Ukrainian Analytical Center Oleksandr Okhrimenko predicts in his article for 112.ua. According to the results of the first quarter, Ukrainian manufacturers exported products worth $853 million to Russia and $816 million to Poland. The gap is really very small.

However, despite all the successes in increasing exports to Europe, in the top five countries where Ukraine sells most of its goods, there are only two countries from the EU zone: Poland and Italy (2nd and 3rd place).
Grants, programs, targeted funding

As previously reported, the issue of lifting the moratorium on the export of round timber will not be put forward as a condition for providing Ukraine with another package of macro-financial assistance (a loan of 1 billion euros) from the EU. However, this does not mean that it will be provided completely without conditions. The European Parliament is discussing a proposal to allocate funds in exchange for the obligation to create a system for checking the property declarations of officials and data on the beneficiaries of companies. Moreover, as follows from the words of European officials (“... in the light of the incomplete implementation of the program related to the third package by Ukraine, it is advisable to include specific conditions for each of the two tranches of this assistance”), the funds will be allocated in small doses and only under the progress report.

The EU has prepared another assistance program for Ukraine - "Reforms for Investment", under which Ukraine will be able to receive up to 50 million euros. Moreover, as Johannes Hahn, European Commissioner for European Neighborhood Policy and Enlargement Negotiations, promises, its economic effect can be ten times higher than the actual grant part and will allow Ukraine to attract up to 0.5 billion euros of investments. According to the already known tradition, first you will need to do something. For these 50 million euros, Europe will require, in particular:
- independent regulation in the energy sector, i.e. all powers on tariffs, their validity and control will be transferred to the National Commission for Regulation of Energy and Utilities (NEURC);
- also in the EU they want to cancel the e-declaration for anti-corruption officials.

MOSCOW, July 8 - RIA Novosti. The former Supreme Commander of the Allied NATO Forces in Europe, General Philip Breedlove, called the Crimean Bridge a "legitimate target" for Ukrainian troops, the Russian authorities have repeatedly harshly criticized such statements, including comparing them with the words of terrorists and noting that all attempts to cause damage will fail and will be severely suppressed.
According to the general, Ukraine could use recently delivered Harpoon missiles to strike the bridge.

There are many Western leaders and former leaders, like me, who are now talking about what will happen if Russia starts sinking Ukrainian grain ships, or if the Russian naval blockade continues ... There are discussions about how the West can react if it will happen. Several people I spoke to said that the fall "(destruction) of the Kerch Bridge would be a huge blow to Russia. The Kerch Bridge is a legitimate target," Breedlove told the British Times newspaper.

Earlier, Major General of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Dmitry Marchenko told the Ukrainian media that the Crimean bridge would become the number one goal if the Ukrainian troops were supplied with appropriate weapons from the United States and Europe. The Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation then informed that it would give a legal assessment of his statements. Deputy Speaker of the State Duma Irina Yarovaya compared Marchenko's words with the typical behavior of terrorists. Press Secretary of the President of the Russian Federation Dmitry Peskov noted that the security of Crimea is guaranteed by preventive measures taken by the Russian military. He also stated that the threats against the Crimean bridge are known to the Kremlin, they are taken into account. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, speaking on the topic of threats against the Crimean bridge, pointed out that all these statements are taken into account, such plans will fail.

State Duma deputy from the Crimean region Mikhail Sheremet called Kyiv's threat to strike the Crimean bridge a suicide and warned that in the event of even an attempted provocation, decision-making centers would be immediately destroyed. The head of the Crimea, Sergei Aksyonov, pointed out that attempts to damage the Crimean bridge would be severely suppressed, the security of the structure and other strategic facilities was ensured at the highest level. According to him, the land part of Crimea is covered by air defense forces as much as possible, nothing threatens the peninsula.

Russia launched a military operation in Ukraine on February 24. President Vladimir Putin called its goal "the protection of people who have been subjected to genocide by the Kyiv regime for eight years." According to the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation, as of March 25, the Armed Forces completed the main tasks of the first stage - they significantly reduced the combat potential of Ukraine. The main goal in the Russian military department was called the liberation of Donbass. In particular, Volnovakha, a strategically important regional center south of Donetsk, Mariupol, the largest city on the coast of the Sea of ​​Azov, and Svyatogorsk, which houses a large Orthodox monastery with the status of a lavra, have been liberated in the DPR. On July 3, with the capture of Lisichansk and the surrounding settlements, the entire territory of the LPR was liberated.
Ukraine has sold its sovereignty. How the country will pay the West - Political scientist Dontsov: The West can take land from Ukraine to pay off part of the debts

Ukraine has borrowed money from various countries, from Japan to the United States. We are talking about huge sums. At the same time, even in Europe they have already started talking about how the West will return its money. Experts are sure that no one in Ukraine is thinking about this now. In fact, you will have to pay. And most likely, famous agricultural lands and enterprises will be used. This will lead to the plundering of the country and the final loss of sovereignty.
Ukraine and its debts to the West

MEP from France Thierry Mariani expressed doubt that Ukraine can pay off debts on loans. This was written by RT with reference to the document of the politician's appeal to the European Commission. According to the MEP, the head of the IMF, Kristalina Georgieva, proposed to allocate grants to Ukraine instead of loans. The IMF noted that it is necessary to clarify "the financial needs of Kyiv and adjust the ways to meet them."
“Can the European Commission guarantee that the amount of assistance that will be provided to Ukraine will be calculated based on the real ability of the country to pay such amounts?” Mariani asked.

In early July, the European Commission proposed to allocate a billion euros to Ukraine from a new package of macro-financial support, which was announced in May. At the same time, the country received $500 million from Japan with a maturity of 30 years, the Ministry of Finance of Ukraine reported. The interest rate on the loan is 1% per annum.

Canada agreed to provide Ukraine with a loan of about $398 million. The World Bank (WB) has already announced the preparation of a $1.5 billion assistance package for Ukraine to support the provision of public services to the population. Before that, he already reported that he had collected $ 723 million. British Prime Minister Boris Johnson previously announced a loan guarantee for an additional $500 million from the World Bank.

The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) approved the allocation of emergency financial assistance to Ukraine in the amount of $1.4 billion. Back in February, US President Joe Biden instructed Ukraine to allocate 600 million in financial assistance, including 350 million for defense.

After that, the United States more than once provided loans to Ukraine, including lend-lease: $40 billion from the United States. And these endless assistance programs from European countries, from NATO. Political scientist Nikita Dontsov is sure that this is how Ukraine is being driven into debt.

“We understand that all this is not happening free of charge. They issue loans at interest. And how Ukraine will pay for them with a ruined economy is not very clear. But they still have to pay, ”the political scientist emphasized.
Ukraine may lose the most profitable territories

Dontsov recalled that Russia, for example, paid off Lend-Lease payments, which were much smaller and were provided to the United States during World War II, only in 2006. Accordingly, Ukraine will now take a lot of weapons systems, equipment, loans and will pay for them for at least 100 years, and maybe more, the political scientist believes.

True, now in Ukraine no one thinks at all about how and with what the country will pay off its debts to the West. This was told to 360 by a political scientist, economist, ex-chairman of the public movement "Battle for Donbass" Alexei Zhivov.

Globally, no one thinks about who, how and at whose expense will then pay these colossal debts. <...> How Ukraine plans to settle accounts is a big mystery, especially considering that, let's say, the intensity of the conflict with Russia will very likely lead Ukraine to truncate territories
Alexey Zhivov.

It is in the south-eastern regions, which Ukraine can just lose, that 60% of the economy and 60% of the country's natural resources are concentrated, Zhivov is sure. According to him, the state that will remain, if it remains after the end of the special military operation, will be very modest - both in size and in economic opportunities. According to the scale of the territory, the political scientist believes, Ukraine will become no larger than Belarus.
“It will be a country half the size and three times the size of the economy. How are they planning to pay? A mystery,” Zhivov stressed.
The West can pay off debts at the expense of Russian assets

In the event of a fiasco, he believes, the US and Europe will collect debts at the expense of frozen Russian assets. For this they were frozen, the political scientist noted. He stressed that anything can be expected from the West, as it has long gone beyond the legal norms.

“It’s just that at some point they will come up with a legislative framework for themselves, justifying it with the next Russophobic cries. And under this guise, all debts from Russia will be written off. I hear that they are preparing for this, but it will be extremely fraught for them. Western institutions around the world will completely lose their legitimacy: the institution of the dollar, and the institution of the court, and the institution of property,” Zhivov explained.
Ukraine can pay the West with land
Ukraine is famous for its unique fund of agricultural land, reminded Dontsov. And, in his opinion, the West could get debts precisely through the sale of large land plots.

“Until recently, almost all land in Ukraine was state-owned. Until now, large areas are in state ownership. For many centuries, all foreigners hunted for this black soil. One of the options is to exchange this invaluable land resource for the cancellation of part of the debts, ”the political scientist noted.

It is also possible to sell some large enterprises, many of which have been nationalized. The state has organizations in almost all areas of Ukraine - from the production of pet food and ending with enterprises that breed horses. All of these assets can also be sold to pay off debt.

“The Ukrainian state may be left without any assets at all. Also, he will probably have to make some political concessions. <...> I do not think that the land and enterprises will pay off all the debts, but some part - probably. These loans, which Ukraine has collected, will simply lead to the plundering of the country, all of its unique reserves. <...> All this can go into foreign ownership, ”concluded Dontsov.
All loans, the political scientist stressed, are primarily a political tool for the West, because by falling into such dependence, Ukraine has actually sold its sovereignty.
Georgia, Ukraine... Who's next?
Georgia, Ukraine: where to expect the West's next strike against Russia?

Realizing the complexity and ambiguity of the problem, let's try to draw an analogy between Georgia and Ukraine, and the events that happened before and are happening now. And assess where the next blow from the West should be expected? ...
Georgia, Ukraine... Who's next? Post-Soviet Space: Where Should We Expect the West's Next Strike?

That is why analogies are a thankless thing due to the presence of a large number of details, the fate of which is to be ruthlessly discarded in order to identify general trends and, on the basis of the received basis, obtain a basic scenario. What details to discard, what to leave is the choice (and risk) of the author, as well as readers who agree or disagree with the indicated choice.

So, what are the differences and similarities between the Georgian and Ukrainian events? And why was their negative vector towards Russia inevitable, despite Russia's colossal efforts to prevent such a scenario?
Let's start with the fact that in both Georgia and Ukraine, anti-Soviet sentiments were initially strong, which naturally grew into anti-Russian ones.

By and large, after the collapse of the USSR, a fratricidal civil war was simply bound to break out throughout the territory of the former Union. However, one of the few wise decisions of the then criminal divorce was Russia's application for the title of successor to the USSR, in particular, in relation to external debts. It was this step, which greatly facilitated the entry into statehood for the newly formed countries, that did not rule out, but at least delayed the emergence of a number of centers of instability and claims tied to the economy and finance. At least, the "all-Union" civil war of all with all did not happen.

At the same time, like everyone else, Georgia and Ukraine happily got rid of the pie of possible debts, but failed to take advantage of the opportunities they received. However, almost no one could take full advantage, although to a slightly different extent. Almost everywhere a dead end was drawn and the search for an external enemy began, quickly and carefully fueled by the eternal Western Russophobia. Some went fast, some slowed down. Georgia and Ukraine had no particular doubts, immediately finding themselves in the forefront, quickly standing out as the "leaders" of the discordant choir.

Here it is worth remembering that even in the late Soviet period there were cases when a train with the direction "Georgia - the Soviet Union" left Tbilisi, and the signs changed when crossing the border of the republic. In Ukraine, it was different, especially in the western regions, where in Soviet times nationalism smoldered, which had other forms, rather underground, immediately, after gaining independence, resulted in semi-legal camps, where young people instantly began to intensively prepare for future Maidans.

One way or another, but both former Soviet republics came to extremely Russophobic regimes, albeit on different roads: Georgia - through a destructive civil war that destroyed all economic potential, Ukraine - more consistently, but with the same result, significantly losing the enormous opportunities inherited in inheritance from the Ukrainian SSR.

As a result, in Georgia there was a "revolution of roses" and the coming to power of the extreme Russophobe Saakashvili, in Ukraine there was a Maidan and no less Russophobe Yushchenko, who came to power by a strange vote. Tellingly, both events occurred almost simultaneously in 2004.

So, we have revealed the following: in Georgia and Ukraine, two "color revolutions" occurred simultaneously, although they came to them by different roads. Georgia went through a civil war and was completely ruined. Ukraine, having avoided shocks, has not completely lost its potential, remaining a large economy, especially against the backdrop of the post-Soviet space.
Why Georgia?

And now let's emphasize once again: both of these events took place with significant support from the West, but this similarity should have been followed by a choice: which of the two to bet on? Or maybe two at once?

I believe that if the West faced such a choice today, the second option would be chosen without a doubt. However, in 2004, it still seemed that Russia had not departed too far from the role assigned to it by the globalists. Well, she fooled around with Yukos, well, she canceled the predatory PSA schemes (production sharing agreements) and tolling.

There was no "Munich speech" yet, the army was breathing its last after the "fire to kill" in the 90s, the oligarchs were just on the verge of realizing that at least taxes had to be paid. So, it might well seem that a Georgian kick in an American boot is enough, and the old bear will either die or come to its senses irreversibly. In addition, for some Georgians, the cost of "boots" is an order of magnitude less and, in view of the zero economy, there is no need to rebuild anything, unlike Ukraine, which is closely integrated with Russia by numerous production chains.

In general, by the method of exclusion, and also in view of the insignificance of Yushchenko as a person, the unconditional choice fell on the unbalanced, but impulsive Saakashvili. Further, everything is known to everyone to the commas, which, just because of their wide popularity, we will omit and recall only a few important details:

- during the five-day war, the Russian Armed Forces captured war trophies in the amount of only 150 armored vehicles. In addition, a large number of American and European-made weapons, as well as military vehicles, including Hummers, were seized, which the Pentagon demanded to immediately return to the United States. Russia, of course, did not return anything to anyone, and the Hammers are now in the Museum of the Ministry of Defense in Kubinka;

- in the course of a fleeting war, all of Georgia fell into the cauldron, and as a result, it lost significant territories: Abkhazia and South Ossetia, which immediately turned into strongholds of the Russian armed forces in Transcaucasia;
- during the war, there was a fleeting naval episode, when Georgian military boats, ignoring Russian requests, were destroyed without hesitation by naval missile salvos;
- despite the promised support, neither Europe nor the United States did anything but outrage to save their protégés from military defeat.
Thus, the five-day war ended for Georgia in a complete fiasco with the loss of territories, military property and reputation.
Let's move on to Ukraine

Yushchenko's insignificance quickly became apparent not only to external players, but to the very people of Ukraine. Therefore, gradually, regardless of anything, the second Maidan began to be prepared, which happened in 2013. An even greater Russophobe Poroshenko came to power, immediately sent by the curators strictly to the east.

There was only one problem: there was no time to train and train the Armed Forces of Ukraine, so there was no open war with Russia, but there was a kind of civil war in the form of a protracted military confrontation with the rebellious republics of Donbass, unconditionally supported by Russia both humanitarianly and military equipment, equipment and ammunition .
Based on the results of a 4-year confrontation in a war that Russia did not attend:

- Ukrainian military aviation was almost completely destroyed, a huge amount of armored vehicles and other weapons, including foreign ones, were captured, ammunition depots on the territory of Ukraine itself are destroyed with a regular sequence. Losses in personnel, permanently falling into the boilers, far exceed the official UN figures and are only increasing;

- in the course of hostilities, a part of the Donbass was actually lost, as well as Crimea, where Russia has taken strict preventive measures to prevent violence and is currently equipping a strategically important territory in accordance with its plans, including (and above all) the military;

- at present, the West provides Ukraine with fairly broad support, both material and financial, and military, which, however, will quickly dry up in the event of an open armed conflict between Russia and Ukraine;

- and the last detail: before our eyes, Ukrainian combat boats attempted a "heroic" breakthrough of Russian territorial waters, very similar to what Georgian boats tried to do on August 10, 2008, which, however, rushed to their port of Poti, already captured by the Russian army . The result of the Ukrainian provocation is known: the boats were captured along with the personnel. They were captured relatively gently, although with shooting, and without fatal consequences, which the FSB Coast Guard could do at once.

As a result, the boats of the Ukrainian Navy, which, according to some funny estimates, make up about a third of the entire military fleet, will most likely be placed in some kind of museum (as well as the ever-memorable "Georgian" Hummers) due to their complete initial unsuitability for naval battles. During the capture, something like a ram was used, suspiciously reminiscent of a 30-year-old naval bulk (although not in such a ratio of weight categories), used by Soviet sailors of the Black Sea Fleet to train American warships.

Now you can talk as much as you like about the supposed "peaceful" passage of combat boats into the Sea of ​​​​Azov, calculate territorial waters and prove who went where or did not go. However, by definition, it is impossible to allow armed boats into the Kerch Strait without inspection by the FSB coastal service. Actually, this is precisely why it exists, despite the ukrophantasmagoria and phantom pains regarding the ownership of the Crimea.
Thus, the five-day war in August 2008 and the failed war with Ukraine brought enormous territorial and material losses to both Western protégés.
Outcome

Georgia and Ukraine in their condition are unconditional projects of the West directed against Russia in order to restrain the growth of its potential as a competitor. There is no doubt that in the event of an open military conflict with Ukraine, the war will end with the same lightning boiler of the entire territory and only with the timing adjusted for the large difference in the size of the countries (Georgia and Ukraine).

With all the significant similarities in the development of conflicts, growing Russophobia, the timing of "color revolutions" with different starting positions, one should take into account the fundamental difference in the attitude of Russians (Russians) towards Georgians and Ukrainians: if there was a real war with Ukraine, the Russian army would fire to kill only in in the most extreme case, trying to make the most of all other available means and instruments, the main of which is the threat of overwhelming military power.

With all the love of Russians for the wonderful Georgian people, based on cultural, historical and religious traditions, the ethnic component cannot be discounted in any way. For Ukrainians are the same Russians, only in some places they are badly corrupted by the West.

In principle, the latter can be quickly remedied by simply turning the handle labeled "propaganda" by 180°. Especially quickly if the Kyiv regime, after all, decides on a real large-scale provocation. Moreover, for some people, despite the Georgian (invaluable) experience, there is no other option for maintaining power after March 2019 in nature. This means that the fiasco with the introduction of martial law for 30 days instead of 60 is only an intermediate result, and we should expect an attempt to break through anywhere in the fragile, bad peace, which, of course, is better than a good war.
The dog barks - the caravan moves on

1. Today, Georgia, despite the continuation of the pro-Western course and the declaration of territorial claims to the lost territories, is a fairly peaceful state with a colorless political life - few people will immediately name even the name of the president, both the previous one and the one who just won the elections (besides the fact that this is woman), not to mention second-tier politicians.

Russia is quite satisfied with this, since in the future, with the final fading of the West's interest in the Transcaucasus (unless, of course, Armenia throws firewood on the fire), the usual neutrality and normal relations of the two peoples, doomed to be close neighbors, are possible. Perhaps a similar fate awaits Ukraine. In any case, such an outcome, at least, would be acceptable, since it does not imply further bloodshed in the Donbass, just as it is not flowing now in South Ossetia.

However, bearing in mind the mental and ethnic differences known to the West, I think that they are not very interested in Ukrainian neutrality, because for them this is tantamount to a real defeat. However, no other actions to support Ukraine, other than frowns and loud speeches about "close attention", should not be expected anymore.

From which it follows that the result of the naval battle in the Black Sea is only the beginning of a long journey towards the return home of the "severely spoiled" Russians. Even if not all, but only along the left bank of the river, to the middle of which, as you know, not every bird will fly.

2. Hard times lie ahead for Russia, both in terms of the inevitable pacification of Ukraine, and in preparing for new, just as inevitable, points of instability, and as potentially rich in provocations as the previous ones. It is not known how and when it will end, in any case, accusations of incessant aggression are unambiguous. As well as the inevitable accusation of unleashing a full-scale war, if such a reality happened. I do not really want to call the war a world war yet, although according to many authoritative estimates, all signs of such a development of the situation are already evident.
In the meantime, the bottom line, Russia:

- sharply increases the icebreaking fleet for escorting merchant ships along the Northern Sea Route, capable of taking on a significant part of the trade turnover of the western and eastern hemispheres. And in the course of 2019, it introduces a notification character for any foreign warships that intend to take a walk along near our northern borders. In principle, exactly the same notification as for the passage of the Kerch Strait. With all the ensuing consequences;

- Together with Iran and India, it is intensively discussing the construction of the North-South Trans-Iranian Water Trade Corridor (from the Caspian Sea to the Persian Gulf or the Indian Ocean), which could become another cheap alternative to the Suez Canal. Which option the corridor will follow depends largely on the prospects for stability in the Middle East, including (and above all) on the final fate of Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan.

This means that we should prepare for a new round of tough sanctions counteraction by those who are not ready to put up with normal competition where they are used to speaking only in the language of ultimatums. Transnistria may well turn out to be such a place, where:
- the republic is squeezed from two sides by unfriendly regimes, one of which has introduced martial law in the neighboring Vinnitsa region;
– more than a hundred thousand citizens have Russian passports;
- the Russian contingent deprived by the UN General Assembly quite recently (in September 2018) of the status of an international peacekeeping mission.

And most importantly, the Russian contingent has no rear, which means: in the event of a large-scale provocation, Russia will immediately come to the aid of its soldiers and citizens, for which it will be forced to send troops to Ukraine with all the ensuing international consequences. Q.E.D.
The dog barks - the caravan moves on.
